loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en:
Medilyn is married with an only child. She manages her own cafeteria to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the cafeteria. Aside from this, she runs a grocery store that sells a variety of goods in their community. To improve it, she requested a new loan from GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods to increase inventory in her store.
In the future, she wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr:
Pierrette est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est une vraie paysanne qui pratique toute sorte de cultures et d’élevages. Elle est mariée avec 2 enfants à charge.
Pierrette arrive à son 3ème prêt ou elle veut développer la culture de riz. De ce fait, elle compte acheter des semences et des engrais avec le prêt. Les bénéfices des prêts précédents ont permis à Pierrette d’acheter une rizière sur laquelle elle va cultiver le riz.
Elle espère gagner des bénéfices afin d’améliorer le bien-être de sa famille et de constituer de l’épargne pour faire face aux imprévus.
texts.en:
Pierrette is a 42-year-old woman. She is a true peasant who cultivates all kinds of crops and breeds various livestock. She is married with two children.

Pierrette is on her third loan which she will use to cultivate rice. Therefore she has to buy seeds and fertilizers with the loan. The benefits of previous loans enabled Pierrette to buy a rice field on which she will grow rice.

She hopes to earn profits to improve her family's welfare, and establish savings to cope with the unexpected.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers to cultivate rice

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
This is Noor, a sweet and adorable woman. She is 35 years old and a mother to five children. She is happily married and ‎earns and income by raising poultry. She works seven hours every day.
Noor has 5 years' experience doing this job. She continues to work hard in order to achieve her dream of buying a house ‎and expanding her business so that she may leave it to her children.
She is applying for a loan in order to buy an incubator. She can thus increase production capacity and increase her ‎income.‎

loans.use: to buy a poultry incubator.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
At 53, Antonio can be mistaken for someone younger. He is from Garcia Hernandez, in Bohol.

He works hard and manages three livelihoods to earn a living. He drives his motorcycle and transports people to other places, raises hogs and farms rice. These businesses provide him with the income that he needs for food and household expenses.

Antonio is asking for a loan so he can further invest in his farm and pigs. He will use his loan to buy feed for the animals, and fertilizer and pesticides for his rice field. Antonio plans to continue working and doing everything so he can provide for his family's expenses in terms of healthy meals for him and his wife and pay for other household expenses. His two children are already adults.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and pesticides

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace helps her husband to earn a living with her general store and has been doing this for many years. She earns a nice income from this and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her grocery store.

To earn more income, she operates a gardening business and supplies fresh vegetables in their community. To improve this, she has requested a new loan from GDMPC to purchase additional seedlings and organic fertilizer to improve their garden.

She always finds ways to improve their lives. With her determination, Grace hopes to earn more profit, to improve the general living conditions of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and organic fertilizer to improve her gardening business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with three children of adult age. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Her wish is to send her children to school until they finish college and land a good job. She doesn't want to see her children doing back breaking work like tilling and cultivating land like she is doing to provide for their needs.

Elizabeth is a hardworking farmer and a loving mother to her children. As she recalls, everything has been made possible with the financial support extended by Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to farmers like her. To get a head start on the next cropping season, she is taking a loan of PHP 35,000 to pay for land preparation, including plowing and harrowing, and to purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation, including plowing and harrowing, and to purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce.

loans.name: Roberlita

texts.en:
Roberlita is 38 years old and now married, and has two children who attend school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 13 years.

Roberlita requested her twenty fourth loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs to further build her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios has a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, diapers, spices and other groceries.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Cruelty and tyranny are part of life and the social and economic environment is very bad, but this and age have not stood in the way for Amneh, who married a poor working man who works making and selling straw brooms.
Amneh works as a farmer with her husband and also helps her husband in his second job, but wanting a higher standard of ‎living Amneh realized that both jobs were not covering their needs, so she decided to allocate a room in her house and ‎converted it into a grocery to improve their income.‎
After that she felt that her business was doing well and decided to expand and develop her business so she ‎allocated corner in her grocery to sell cleaning materials.
Amneh is an example of women's ambition and did not let any ‎obstacle stand in her way and as she said, "the challenge will never have a law and also the success is not linked with the age ‎of the person."‎
She wants the loan to buy food supplies, soft drinks, cleaning materials and other products to attract the largest possible number of customers to increase her incomes.‎
The picture shows one of her projects.

loans.use: to buy food supplies, soft drinks, cleaning materials and other products to attract the largest possible number of customers.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es:
Oscar, de 56 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, creció con sus padres quienes le enseñaron esta actividad; está acompañado, tiene 3 hijos y su pareja le apoya con los oficios domésticos.

Oscar, durante la mañana trabaja en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día se dedica a trabajar como albañil.

Oscar, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, pesticidas y abono para sembrar maíz.

Oscar, sueña con comprar animales para repasto y también desea poder comprar un terreno donde pastarlos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 56 years old and has made a living from agriculture for some years. He grew up with his parents who taught him this way of life. He is married, with 3 children. His wife looks after the household chores. Oscar works on the plot of land that he rents in the morning and then for the rest of day works as a construction worker.
Oscar needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seed, pesticide and fertilizer to sow maize. Oscar dreams of buying beef cattle, he would also like to be able to buy the land to graze them on.

loans.use: to agricultural supplies such as seed, pesticide and fertilizer to sow maize.

loans.name: Lolok

texts.en:
Lolok is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her parents and her younger brother. She is a young and very motivated weaver.

Her family owns 7 hectares of rice fields, 1.5 hectares of cassava field and eight pigs.

In 2013, she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Lolok makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal food, fertilizer and diesel for the field. Most importantly, she wants to make her family business grow thanks to her salary.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Keshaben And Group

texts.en:
Keshaben, who is 35 years old, hails from the Dahod district of Gujarat. She is married and is a mother of four children.

Keshaben is very ambitious and is self-employed for her family. She wishes to fulfill all their needs and provide them with a chance at a proper education. Hence she runs a vegetable business. She feels that expanding the business would earn her more income than she usually does, but due to a money crunch Keshaben is not able to maintain her business. Therefore, with the help of Prayas (Milaap’s field partner in Gujarat), she formed a group called Keshaben and Group.

The group consists of five members. Like Keshaben, the other members of the group also want to expand their businesses and contribute more money to their family needs. Together they need a loan that will be used for their respective businesses.

Keshaben is the leader of this group and she will use the loan to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, onions, garlic, cauliflowers and chilli at a wholesale price, and will then sell them in colonies using her cart. Similarly, Champaben, Setaniben, Tinaben and Sanjuben, who are the other members of this group, want loans for their vegetable businesses.

With your help these women will be able sustain and expand their businesses. The increase in their income will help them to manage their monthly expenses so they do not need to cut back on basic necessities like children’s education and medical needs.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, onions, garlic, cauliflowers and chilli for her vegetable business.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Con 42 años de edad, Reina es una madre de dos hijas de 19 y 15 años y un hijo de 9 años de edad con quienes vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora quien se gana la vida de manera humilde, con la venta de tamales de gallina. Pero en busca de obtener un mayor ingreso se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos lavando y planchando en los diferentes hogares de su comunidad y de las comunidades vecinas. Reina para poder mejorar su estilo de vida y la de su familia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra para encementar el piso y paredes de su cuarto. Y muy agradecida con el crédito anterior ya que con ello pudo invertir en su construcción.
texts.en:
Reina is 42 years old and a mother of three. She has two girls, ages nineteen and fifteen, and a boy, who is nine. They all live at home with her and their father. She is a very hard worker and makes an honest living selling chicken tamales. But in order to make extra income, she also provides domestic services, washing and ironing for different homes throughout her community and the surrounding areas.

In order to improve her and her family's living standards, Reina is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which she will invest in buying sand and cement, as well as to pay for labor to cement the floor and walls of her room.

She is also very grateful for her previous loan, since she was able to invest in building.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and to pay for labor to carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Marlene De Los Angeles

texts.es: Marlene es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace 15 años, lo cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Ella tiene 43 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 4 años de edad, a los que apoya para que estudien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.  Marlene desea terminar de instalar puertas y ventanas al cuarto que ha construido en su vivienda con mucho esfuerzo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: puertas, ventanas y tornillos para instalar puertas y ventanas en el cuarto de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marlene is a hardworking woman who has made a living in domestic services for 15 years, which has allowed her to support her family. She is 43 years old and lives with her life partner and their three children who are 13, 9, and 4 years old, and whom she supports so they may study and have a better quality of life. 

Marlene wants to finish installing doors and windows in the room that she has built in her house with much effort. For this, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: doors, windows, and screws to install doors and windows in the room in her house.

loans.use: to invest in: doors, windows, and screws to install doors and windows in the room of her home

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is a kind woman from North Tajikistan. She was born in 1981. Mavjuda is married and has 3 children. She lives in an agricultural region and she has a good opportunity to develop her agriculture business. Mavjuda has been busy with feeding cows. She also grows potatoes and crops. Mavjuda has been doing this work for more than 12 years and she has great experience in this field. Mavjuda is going to increase the number of cows which are she feeds. Mavjuda is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy cows. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad, vive al lado de su familia la cual está conformada por sus padres y sus hijos de 2 y 12 años de edad. Ella es madre soltera quien día con día busca la manera de poder mantener los gastos del hogar y así poder ofrecer una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos, y para lograrlo se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos en una vivienda que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Gracias a esta labor puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para satisfacer sus necesidades básicas. María en busca de poder mejorar su estilo de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: hierro y pago de mano de obra para la construcción e instalación de un portón en su vivienda, buscando de esta manera poder vivir de una mejor forma y más segura.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 and lives with her family: her parents and her children, who are ages two and twelve. She is a single mother who always finds a way to cover her household expenses in order to be able to provide a better life for her children. She works providing domestic services for a home near her community. This works allow her to make enough income to meet their basic needs.

In order to improve her living standards, Maria is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest it in buying iron and paying for labor to build and install a gate in her house, which will help her live better and more safely.

loans.use: to buy iron and pay for labor to install a gate.

loans.name: Shohista

texts.en:
Shohista was born in 1984. She is a smart and clever woman. Shohista lives with her husband and four children in a village. Shohista is a very hardworking woman, and she always tries to earn her living.

She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. Shohista buys cows, feeds them for some months, and then sells them in a local market. Shohista’s husband helps her with managing the business. Shohista has additional income from sewing. She sews fashionable women's dresses.

Shohista is going to develop her animal husbandry business further and in this way, get ahead. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cows for increasing working capital

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Borrowing loans has been a typical practice for small business entrepreneurs like Aurora. You can never improve your business without getting into credit, unless you have enough capital or investments. Aurora paid all her loans availed through CCT and she is very much confident to apply for new ones.

She would now like to request a PHP 50,000 loan. Just as she did with her previous loans, she will buy assorted grocery items, more toiletry products and beverages to increase her income from her sari-sari store. She believes that you will never fail her request. Once she gets the assistance, she assures that she will repay you in due time.

Aurora aims to add stock of rice products which will serve as an additional source of income for her. She dreams of business expansion and continuously flourishing profits. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a farmer from Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She cultivated her own land, together with her husband. Through this farming activity, she has been able to send her children to school. She has used various services of Paglaum MPC, including loan products and insurance services.

Recently, she approached the cooperative for a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation and the purchase of bags of fertilizers. Avelina is looking forward to a good harvest this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation (like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation) and to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Gbotima Group

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Abubakarr, who is married with four children. His children are all school-going children.

Abubakarr belongs to a solidarity group of two women and three men who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Gbotima” is the name of Abubakarr’s solidarity group.

“Gbotima” group needs a total loan of 14,500,000 SLL. Abubakarr will receive 4,500,000 SLL, which he needs in order to purchase cartons of slippers, African dresses, etc., for his business.

(See the group picture, in which Abubakarr is in the middle).

Abubakarr established his slippers and dresses business 13 years ago; he established the business to ensure his family gets enough money for their basic needs. Abubakarr uses the profit from this business to provide a livelihood for his family and support his children’s education. He opens his business Monday through Saturday every week. Abubakarr is a hardworking man; he opens his business from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

In the future, Abubakarr plans to support his children to acquire a university education. He hopes that one day he will become an international businessman. He thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of slippers and African dresses.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Riza is 42 years old and all five children are in school.

Riza has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Riza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF in order to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle for her passenger business.

Chita has been in this business for ten years. She also earns income from food vending and a general store businesses.

Chita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy wheels and other spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 47 years old and married with five children.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Fely has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns income from pottery.

Fely aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Yuly Yisenia

texts.es:
Con el objetivo de realizar reparaciones al galpón de pollos y comprar pollos para aumentar su producción la señora Yuly se encuentra hoy ante ustedes solicitando un apoyo para efectuar las acciones anteriormente descritas.
Ella es una mujer del área rural de Caparrapi, muy trabajadora, responsable y comprometida que busca con su negocio salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yuly needs to make repairs on her chicken coop and buy chickens to increase her production, so she's asking you for help now to carry out that objective.

She's a woman from the rural area of Caparrapi who's very hardworking, responsible, and committed. She's looking for a way to get ahead with her business and improve the conditions of her home.

loans.use: to repair the shed and to buy chickens to increase her production

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta inicio un negocio de venta de mercancía en el año 2012, buscando generar recursos para apoyar en los gastos de su familia.
Ella vende mercancía por encargo, está actualmente sujeta a lo que pidan los clientes.
Ella es una joven de 24 años de edad que busca la independencia total, trabajar para comprar una casa, tener sus propios bienes, activos, no depender de una persona, ese es su principal deseo.
Como se mencionó anteriormente la cliente siempre está sujeta a los pedidos que realizar sus clientes, pero quiere cambiar un poco su forma de vender pero para ello necesita de capital, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar su propia mercancía y vender a amigos, vecinos y familiares.
texts.en:
Marta, 24, started a business selling merchandise in 2012, looking for a way to earn income to help pay the family expenses. She sells merchandise on order and is currently subject to what her customers request.

She's looking for complete independence. Working to buy a house, have her own goods and assets, and not depend on anyone--that's her main desire.

As mentioned, the client is always subject to her customers' requests. She wants to change her sales channel somewhat, but she needs capital. She's requesting a loan to buy her own merchandise and sell to friends, neighbors, and family members.

loans.use: to buy personal care products, deodorant, powder, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está acompañada, se dedica a la agricultura y este oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que ya fallecieron, pero aparte de eso también vende ropa. 

Gloria, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo realiza durante la mañana junto a su esposo y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedica al comercio de ropa.

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa para su negocio, porque su inventario a disminuido y eso afecta sus ventas y sus ingresos.

Gloria, desea comprar vacas para producir leche y elaborar productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old. She went to school until first grade. She lives in a relationship.
She is working in agriculture which she learned from her parents who already passed away, but apart from that she is also selling clothes.

Gloria is working in agriculture, which she does during the morning together with her husband, and in the course of the afternoon she minds her clothing business.

Gloria needs the loan to buy more clothing for her business, because her inventory has diminished and this infects her sales and her income.

Gloria wants to buy cows to produce milk and prepare dairy products.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for her business

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvia, de 29 años de edad, estudio Licenciatura en Contaduría pública, actualmente trabaja como jefa en una institución, está acompañada, su pareja también trabaja en la misma institución y trabaja en el área de alfabetización.
 
Silvia, inició a trabajar en esa institución desde hace 8 años y su lugar de trabajo está a una hora de donde vive y trabaja de lunes a viernes.

Silvia, necesita el préstamo para reparar su vehículo, porque es el medio de trasporte que utiliza para trasportarse a su trabajo.

El sueño de Silvia, es que la trasladen a un lugar más cerca de su casa.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old. She studied to become a certified public accountant, and currently works as a manager in an institution. She is in a relationship and her partner also works win the same organization, which works in the are of literacy. 
Silvia began working in this organization 8 years ago, and her workplace is one hour away from where she lives. She works Monday through Friday. 
She needs the loan to repair her car, which is the means of transportation she uses to get to work. 
Silvia's dream is that her office will relocate to an area closer to her house.

loans.use: to repair her car.

loans.name: Mitzy Selenia

texts.es:
Mitzy es una mujer trabajadora madre de dos hijas, de 10 años y 7 meses, quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Estudió la carrera de comercio internacional, tiene 35 años y vive actualmente en la Culiacán, en donde tiene su negocio.
Siguiendo la tradición de su familia, hace diez años Mitzy incursionó en el trabajo de campo combinándolo con su carrera, para dedicarse a la comercialización de productos alimenticios, principalmente hortalizas.
Su empresa es de agricultura con gran impacto en Culiacán. En los últimos años, ha visto crecer su negocio e incrementarse el número de hectáreas para la siembra. Tras esta motivación y con el objetivo de hacer cada vez más próspero su negocio, Mitzy ha solicitado un crédito para tener la posibilidad de abrir una oficina para atención a clientes y profesionalizar su negocio aún más.
Con esta motivación y la idea de heredar el legado familiar a sus hijas, Mitzy mantiene su espíritu de lucha para sacar adelante la empresa.
texts.en:
Mitzy is a hard-working mother of two daughters, ages 10 and 7 months, who depend on her financially. She pursued a degree in international business. She is 35 years old, and is currently living Culiacán where her business is located.

In keeping with her family tradition, ten years ago Mitzy got involved with agricultural work, combining it with her degree in order to market food products, particularly vegetables.

Her agriculture business has a large impact in Culiacán. In recent years she has seen her business grow and the number of hectares for planting increase. With this as motivation and with the goal of making her business ever more prosperous, Mitzy has requested a loan in order to have the possibility of opening an office in which to meet with customers and make her business even more professional.

With this motivation and the idea of passing on the family legacy to her daughters, Mitzy keeps her fighting spirit to help her business get ahead.

loans.use: to open an office in which to meet with customers and make her business even more professional.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married, and has a kiosk. Her husband is very supportive of her business.

She is applying for a loan of $1,500.00, and is taking this loan to buy some additional products to sell in her kiosk, including sugar, milk, cooking oil, slippers, eggs, water, coffee, cigarettes, candles, soft drinks, etc.

Maria started her business a few years ago, with her own working capital. She hopes to open a big store in the future. She will use this loan to improve her business for the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, cooking oil, slippers, eggs, water, coffee, cigarettes, candles, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Geovany

texts.en:
Fredy is 28 years old, he barely completed primary school. He started working at early age. Nowadays He is an adult, married and works raising pigs and chickens. He lives in a small property far away of the city. The property’s owners let him use the infrastructure to start his entrepreneurship but he needs to fix some stuff of the installations. 

This loan will help him to buy pigs, chickens, chicken feed and medication necessary for the animal growth. Fredy invests the loan in some things to let him improve the piggery. So he could earn more money for his family. He knows that in this moment he has to work hard because his wife is pregnant and they want to give a better future to their son. 
He starts to work at 4am until 5pm however his salary is reduced. For this reason it will be a big opportunity to start his own job and it will bring him better opportunities to grow.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, chicken feed and medication necessary for animal growth.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 48-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is the mother of five sons and her elder son has been doing his own livestock business for the past 16 years. Her son is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Yasmeen's son wants to purchase buffalo for his livestock business purposes but due to financial constraints her son is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore Yasmeen has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also be good for him to earn a maximum profitable income derived from his business.

For this financial assistance Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son to increase his livestock business.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children.

He works as a salesman and started farming in an area of one hectare with the support of Seva MFI. This gives him an extra income. He expanded the total area now to six hectares.

He repaid his Seva MFI loans always fully and on time. Sean wants to save for overhauling his tractor to improve his production.

He applied for a loan of SRD 5,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Victoria De Jesus

texts.es: Victoria es una mujer trabajadora de 30 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de su municipio, actividad que lleva realizando desde hace 2 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Victoria desea invertir en productos para su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, ya que en época navideña las ventas son mejores, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en verduras para su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Victoria is a very hardworking, 30 year old woman who works in the sale of vegetables in her town, an activity that she's been participating in for the last 2 year. For this reason she has many customers that buy her products. Victoria wishes to invest in products for her business and in this way improve her income, since sales are better during Christmas season. For this purpose she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in vegetables for her business and improve her income.

loans.use: To invest in vegetables for her business and improve her income

loans.name: Elmer Dagoberto

texts.es: Elmer de 26 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de sus padres, dos hermanas y un hermano. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida gracias criando conejos para la venta, además cuenta con una pequeña tienda, es así como  genera sus ingresos económicos con los que apoya a sus padres con los gastos de la vivienda. Elmer desea incrementar sus ingresos económicos adquiriendo nuevos productos para surtir su tienda, además de comprar más concentrado, vitaminas y materiales para mejorar los corrales donde tiene los conejos para hacer crecer su crianza y poder ofrecerles a sus numerosos clientes conejos saludables, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: concentrado para conejos, vitaminas, madera, lamina, clavos para su granja de conejos.
texts.en:
Elmer is 26 years old and lives in his family's house with his parents, two sisters and one brother. He is a hardworking man who makes a living by raising rabbits for sale. He also has a small store; this is how he earns the income that he uses to support his parents with the household expenses.

Elmer wants to increase his earnings, acquiring new products to stock his store in addition to buying more concentrate, vitamins and materials to improve the hutch where he has the rabbits to grow his business and to be able to offer his numerous customers healthy rabbits. This is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in concentrate for rabbits, vitamins, wood, sheet metal, and nails for his rabbit hutch.

loans.use: to invest in concentrate for rabbits, vitamins, wood, sheet metal, and nails for his rabbit hutch

loans.name: Yanira Marisol

texts.es: Yanira de 22 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su abuelo, su padre, 2 hermanos y su hija de 2 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta y cultivo de hortalizas negocio con el cual genera sus ingresos económicos con los que proporciona todo los insumos básicos necesarios para su pequeña hija, así como también los gastos de servicios básicos y alimentación para su hogar, además de recibir el apoyo con algunas cosas de parte de sus hermanos. Yanira desea invertir en la compra de materiales para mejorar su vivienda ya que esta presenta algunos daños en el techo por donde se filtra el agua y otras que dejan ver al interior de la vivienda ella desea poderle así brindar más privacidad, seguridad  y comodidad a su familia es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: laminas, madera, clavos, etc. Para realizar las reparaciones de la vivienda.
texts.en: Yanira, 22 yeas old, lives in her own habitation with her grandfather, father, 2 brothers and her 2 year old daughter. She is a hard working woman who works in the sale and cultivation of vegetables, with which she generates her income to provide for the basic needs for her little daughter, as well as basic service and nutritional costs of her household; additionally, she receives help with some costs from her brothers. Yanira wishes to invest in materials to improve her habitation, which is showing damages in the roofing, through which water percolates, and other parts of the house which reveal the interior, she wishes to be able to provide more privacy, safety, and comfort to her family and for this reason she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, wood, nails, etc to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To invest in: sheeting, wood, nails, etc. In order to repare her habitation

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad quien es madre de dos hijos de 6 y 15 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la compra y venta de mariscos, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace 25 años lo que le permite contar con un número bastante grande de clientes. Gracias a ello puede mantener la economía de su humilde hogar y así también gracias a la ayuda que le brinda su compañero de vida. En vista que el mercado cambia constantemente y la demanda sube, es necesario invertir aún más y es por lo que Rosa solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camarones, cangrejos, almejas, etc. para aumentar las ventas de su negocio y así también sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 47, is the mother of two children, ages 6 and 15. She is a hardworking woman who sells shellfish, a business she has worked in for 25 years. She has a very large customer base. Thanks to this, she is able to care for her humble home, along with help from her husband.

Since the market demand is constantly increasing and changing, she needs to invest yet again, and so she asks for a loan from FUSAI to buy: shrimp, crabs, clams, etc to increase her sales and therefore her profits.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crabs, clams, etc to increase her sales.

loans.name: Florina

texts.en: Florina is 42 years old.  She is married and has school-age children. She is engaged in the rice production business in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur.  She is an active member of Paglaum MPC where she nurtures her membership, evidenced by no defaults. Recently, she approached the cooperative for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparation and to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation and to  purchase of bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 31 years old single living with his parents in Banadero, Ozamiz city, Jeffrey has been providing transportation services to earn a living. He does this in order to support the financial needs of his parents.

Jeffrey successfully repaid his previous loan used for buying a motor and paying for body repair and maintenance. To make his services safe and secure, he took a new loan recently to purchase a new set of tires and to pay for maintenance.

Maintaining good services has allowed him to engage in this business with dignity and determination. He plans to acquire another vehicle for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 61 years old and widowed. She has five children. Angela works very hard to provide for them.

Angela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. Angela has been in this business for 35 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rita Arely

texts.es:
Rita, ejecuta diferentes actividades para tener recursos económicos, las cuales son administrar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, comercialización de gallinas y destazo de cerdos, el destazo lo aprendió de un familiar y lo practica desde hace 10 años, la venta de gallinas la inicio hace 7 años y la tienda la abrió hace 7 meses; vive con su compañero de vida y tres hijos, en ocasiones recibe ayuda de algunos parientes.
El préstamo será de ayuda para fortalecer su negocio con la compra de gallinas, golosinas, lejía, bebidas, granos básicos, etc., podrá establecer mejor la tienda y atender las necesidades que sus clientes tienen diariamente, espera que las ventas e ingresos vayan aumentando.
Sus objetivos son ampliar su negocio, construir su casa y salir adelante con su familia
texts.en:
Rita does various things to earn money, including running a store selling basic goods, selling hens, and butchering pigs. She learned to butcher from a relative and has been doing it for 10 years. She started selling chickens 7 years ago, and opened her store 7 months ago.

She lives with her partner and 3 children; they sometimes receive help from relatives. This loan will be used to strengthen her business with the purchase of hens, snacks, bleach, drinks, basic grains etc. She wants to better establish the store and meet the daily needs of her customers. She hopes that her sales and profits will increase.

Her goals are to grow her business, construct a home and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy hens, snacks, drinks, basic grains etc so that she can better establish her store and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Elvis Humberto

texts.es:
Elvis es padre de 5 hijos, pero actualmente de él solo dependen los tres más menores de edad, es casado, vive con su familia, tiene como negocio principal una tienda de productos varios y también ofrece diferentes medicamentos de origen natural, atiende a sus clientes de seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde, su mayor dificultad sería que no venda los productos a buen precio.
Requiere de un crédito para realizar la compra de granos básicos, bebidas, boquitas, sal, entre otros productos para la tienda, también hará la adquisición de analgésicos, vitaminas, pomadas, etc., de esta forma su negocio mantendrá su continuidad y podrá mejorar su inventario.
Elvis tiene como visión fortalecer el negocio, atender a más clientes, incrementar sus ingresos para seguir ayudando a que su familia tenga un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Elvis has five children, only three of whom still live at home. He is married and lives with his family. His main business is a grocery store where he sells produce as well as a variety of natural medicines. He is open from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.

He is requesting a loan to purchase basic grains, drinks, salt, and other products for his store. He will also buy analgesics, vitamins, pomades, etc. This will allow him to keep his business going and improve his inventory.

Elvis' vision is to strengthen his business, reach more customers, and increase his income so that he can continue supporting their family and they can have a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy groceries and natural medicines for his store.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es una mujer de 35 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en una comunidad de Sololá. 

Ella es una mujer con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, todos los días busca la manera de superarse, es por ello que tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de mostasia,  este negocio se ubica en el mercado regional de una comunidad circunvecina. Desde hace varios años se ha estado esforzando para poder obtener mejores ingresos y a si comprar una cuerda de terreno para contar con un lugar donde poder cultivar, a pesar de todo su esfuerzo esto no ha sido posible por esa razón solicita un préstamo  para poder al fin adquirir su terreno.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar sus ingresos económicos y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Berta is a woman of 35 years of age. She is single and lives together with her parents and siblings in a community in Sololá. She is a woman with great aspirations in life, and everyday she looks for a way to move ahead, and it is for this reason that she has dedicated herself to the buying and selling of mostasia for 20 years. This business is located in the regional market of a neighboring community. Since many years ago she has been fighting to be able to obtain better income to buy an acre of land some day to be a place where she can cultivate. Despite all her effort it has not been possible, and for this reason she requests a loan to be able to finally acquire her land. Her biggest desire is to improve her economic income and hence be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivation.

loans.name: Grupo Patzaj 3 Group

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 58 años de edad es casado con una familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 15 y 25 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel (el primero del lado derecho de camisa rojo, con sombrero y jerga típica pues es su traje típico regional de los hombres) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la producción de café, con esta actividad lleva 25 años de realizarlo.
Manuel junto a un grupo de personas solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café pues el ahora no cuenta con dinero suficiente para poder cubrir esta necesidad. Él tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para obtener una buena cosecha y también mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 58 years old. He is married and has a family of three children, ages between 15 and 25 years old. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

In order to earn an income and move forward with his family, Manuel (first from the right in the photo, wearing a red shirt, hat, and is wearing dress that is typical in this region for men) grows coffee. He has been doing this work for 25 years.

Alongside a group of others, Manuel is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies to look after his coffee crops.He does not currently have the necessary capital to cover the costs of these products. Manuel hopes to receive this loan in order to harvest a good yield, and to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to look after coffee crops.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a maize farmer from Jalawa village. As a member of Babban Gona, Habila is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support she has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, 

Habila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Habila can store her maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Habila is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use her increased earnings to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer from Gambo village. As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to yield up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maryamu had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Maryamu can store the maize she harvests and sell it later in the season when she can earn up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Maryamu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the potential to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Maryamu hopes to realize better yields and plans to use her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Emmanuel has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Emmanuel can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Emmanuel is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer from Lado village. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ayuba no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ayuba hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abba

texts.en:
Abba is a maize farmer from Barangwaje village. As a Babban Gona member, Abba is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Abba can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Abba no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Abba hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Markus has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Markus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Markus can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Markus will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Markus is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Salmanu

texts.en:
Salmanu is a maize farmer from Sarkin Huda village. As a Babban Gona member, Salmanu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to yield up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Salmanu had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Salmanu can store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until later in the season when he can earn up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Salmanu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Salmanu hopes to realize better yields and plans to use his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Audu

texts.en:
Audu is a maize farmer from Lado village. As a Babban Gona member, Audu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Audu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Audu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Audu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Audu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides de 45 años de edad vive al lado de su compañera de vida, su hijo de 7 años y sus hijas de 15 y 17 años de edad. Él es un padre responsable que con el fin de mantener la economía del hogar presta sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra en las afueras de su comunidad y gracias a ello puede ofrecer a sus hijos todo lo necesario. Alcides busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cables eléctricos, caja termina y demás herramientas necesarias para la instalación de energía eléctrica en su hogar, pues actualmente le comparten este servicio.
texts.en:
Alcides, 45, lives with his wife, their 7 year old son, and their daughters, ages 15 and 17. He is a responsible father who earns money for the household by working in a business on the outskirts of they community. Thanks to this job, he is able to give his children everything they need.

Alcides wants to improve their quality of life, which is why he asks FUSAI for a loan to buy electrical cables, a fuse box and other tools needed to install electricity in their home. Currently they are sharing this service.

loans.use: to buy electrical cables, a fuse box and other tools needed to install electricity at home.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando ropa de segunda mayor por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo trabajar normalmente. Actualmente su negocio creció porque agregó una nueva línea de productos a la venta como son ollas, latas para hornear y también utensilios de cocina, como uslero, pinzas, cucharones y otros, “mi mayor dificultad es contar con la mercadería suficiente para ofertar, porque los clientes que no encuentran lo que buscan, y ano vuelven…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mercadería es de segunda mano y por eso el precio es accesible a gran público. La desventaja es la falta de mercadería para oferta. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y de su hijo, ella desea comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor así como utensilios de cocina para hornear. Esta es la 6 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Bertha solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa de segunda mano por mayor así como utensilios de cocina para hornear.
texts.en:
Bertha continues with her business of selling second-hand clothes. The credit that she obtained [from her previous Kiva loan] was invested to buy second-hand clothes wholesale, and she paid her contributions in a timely way because she was able to work normally.

Currently, her business has grown because she added a few new product lines, such as pots, baking tins, and kitchenware, such as rollers, tongs, ladles and so forth. The advantage of her business is that her merchandise is second-hand, and therefore affordable for the general public. The disadvantage, however, is the lack of merchandise to sell. "My biggest difficulty is having enough merchandise to sell, because when customers don't find what they are looking for, they don't come back," she says. 

Her dream is to improve the quality of life for her family and her son. This is her 6th loan from this lending institution [Emprender] in her 20 years of work. It is for these reasons that Bertha is requesting a loan to buy second-hand wholesale clothing and kitchen utensils for baking.

loans.use: to buy used clothes wholesale as well as kitchen utensils for baking.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
To earn a living, Jasmine and her husband own a motorcycle known as “habal-habal” to locals. It is called “habal-habal” because of its extended seat that can accommodate more passengers. “Habal- habal” is a common mode of public transportation in remote areas of the Philippines. Jasmine’s husband has been driving this for four years to support their children.

They have seven young and teenage children. That is why they need to improve their livelihood. To do this, Jasmine is asking for a loan for motorcycle maintenance. Specifically, she and her husband will buy spare parts and will change the oil in order to maintain its good condition and to be able to drive continuously.

Aside from this, they plan to buy piglets and pig feed as well. Definitely, they will raise pigs for additional income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and motor vehicle oil, and to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a mother with two children from Trinidad, Bohol. They are aged nine and fifteen. Evangeline is dependent on her rice farming and hog raising businesses to raise her children. Her husband is also engaged in farming and together they work hard for their family. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops and additional piglets to raise. Evangeline is optimistic about the impact of the loan on her businesses.

While maintaining her businesses, she also makes her children's education her priority. In the future, Evangeline plans to make house renovations so she and her family can live in a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Victoria has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer. Victoria wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for 10 years. She is 68 years old and a widow from Ramon Magsaysay, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a member of good standing with the Co-op, which is why she is always given priority on all of her loan applications. Recently, she asked for a loan from the Co-op to pay for medical bills.

loans.use: to pay for medical bills

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives. As a farmer in Pagadian City, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Alicia feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to start her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Alicia wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, and sells merchandise like pouch vinegar, eggs, sugar, edible oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, soap, shampoo and toiletries.
She is married and has five young children. Her oldest child is 15 while the youngest is four. Her income goes for food and school fees. Her husband also has an income that can help defray the family's daily expenses. Virginia also offers tailoring services as another means of earning a living.

She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for 14 years now. She is applying for a Kiva loan to have additional funds to maintain its inventory and to continue the flow of funds of the business cycle.

Virginia wants to purchase additional stock like canned goods and supplies of clothing. These will attract more buyers and she can continue improve her business.

For the future, she is hoping that she can improve the present condition of her family, heading towards progress and sustainability.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, like canned goods and supplies of clothing.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is an operator of a tricycle (rickshaw), where the income goes toward the expenses of the entire household. She is a 56-year-old woman and has six children, one of whom is still attending school. To have an additional source of income, she also raises and sells pigs.

She has requested a loan to buy tires and motorcycle parts, pay for maintenance and buy pig feed. These resources are vital for the improvement of her business. It enables her to raise quality hogs. In the long run, she would be able to gain higher earnings and continue to finance the education of her child.

In the future, Vicenta is hoping that she will become successful in handling her business to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy tires and motorcycle parts, pay for maintenance and buy pig feed.

loans.name: Abigumije Group

texts.fr:
Imelde  fait partie du groupe  Abigumaniye et  habite à  Ngozi. Elle a 30 ans et est mariée à Ntunga ,un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 8 à 12 ans, tous étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce d'habits  depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est son  à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Imelda is a member of the Abigumaniye group and lives in Ngozi. She is 30 years old and married to Ntunga, a salesman. They have three children aged between eight and 12 years old, they all go to school.

She has been selling clothing for 15 years.

This is her sixth loan from Turame. With the KIVA that she requests, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing for resale to earn more.

In the coming years, she hopes to see her children through their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing for resale to earn more.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gelyn is 47 years old and all four of her children are still in school.

Gelyn has a buy and sell of personal products business in the Philippines. Gelyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products like body lotion, beauty soap, beauty kits and other personal care products.

Gelyn has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like body lotion, beauty soap, beauty kits and other personal care products.

loans.name: Unguke Group

texts.fr:
Agrippine fait partie du groupe  Unguke et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 51 ans et est mariée à protais ,un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 9 enfants ,dont  4 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière et de limonade depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est son à troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de bière et de limonade à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Agrippine, age 51, is a member of the Unguke group and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a mason named Protais and they have 9 children, 4 of whom go to school.

Agrippine has been selling beer and lemonade for 20 years. This is her 3rd loan cycle with Turame, and this credit will help to bolster her capital. She plans to buy a large supply of beer and lemonade to increase her sales and revenue.

loans.use: to bolster her capital and purchase a large supply of beer and lemonade to increase her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Tugumane Ii Group

texts.fr:
Christian fait partie du groupe Tugumane .II habite à Gitega et est marie à A. Marie une commercante.Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 14 à 23 ans et tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de farine de manioc depuis 3 ans.


Il est a son troisième crédit à Turame.Avec le crédit Kiva qu;il obtient,il va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc sec à transformer en farine,  à vendre,pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Christian is a member of the Tugumane Group. He lives in Gitega and is married to Marie, who earns a living as a shopkeeper. Together, they have four children aged between 14 and 23 years old. All of their children are currently receiving an education.

Christian has been making and selling cassava flour for the past three years. This will be his third loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will be able to increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of dried cassava, which will be ground into flour then resold at a profit.






Il est a son troisième crédit à Turame.Avec le crédit Kiva qu;il obtient,il va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de manioc sec à transformer en farine, à vendre,pour gagner plus.

loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase a large quantity of dried cassava, which will be ground into flour then resold at a profit.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: Santos de 41 años de edad es un hombre responsable y muy trabajador quien cuida de sus hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad. Ser padre soltero no le impide hacer todo lo posible por llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos  y estar al pendiente de sus necesidades, esto lo logra gracias a que desempeña la labor de pescador artesanal desde hace 25 años, lo que le permite ser bien reconocido en el mercado. Santos se esfuerza día con día ya que sabe que es un esfuerzo para sus seres queridos. Santos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pala, azadón, piocha, y demás herramientas para la construcción de la base para su vivienda, ya que actualmente su hogar está construida con láminas y él quiere brindarle una mejor forma de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos, 41, is a responsible and hardworking man who takes care of his two children, ages 6 and 7. Being a single father doesn't stop him; he does everything he can to bring home the daily bread for his kids and meet all of their needs. He achieves this thanks to his hard work as a fisherman for the last 25 years. He is well known in the markets.

Santos works hard day in and day out because he knows his efforts are for his loved ones. He asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in a shovel, hoe, pickaxe and other tools to build the foundation of his house. Currently his home is made out of tin sheeting and he wants to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a spade, pickaxe, hoe, and other tools to build the foundation of his house.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 42 years old, is a farmer in the rice field who lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of five children, one married. Her husband, Chann, 43, is a fisherman. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 13 a day.

During this time, Heang is facing a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy some farming materials, but yet she can’t afford them. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan. She has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and other related farming materials and to buy a water pump machine to use on their rice field. She is thankful to all lenders for supporting their finances.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other related farming materials.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora is a woman with a happy countenance from the town of Trinidad in Bohol. She is 49 years old and married and with three dependents aged 15, 16 and 17. Teodora and her husband have been farming rice for ten years now to support the needs of their children. She is asking for a loan to pay for her children's tuition fees and fertilizer for her farm. Teodora makes her children's schooling her priority. She hope that in the future, her children will become professional.

loans.use: to pay for her children's tuition fees and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Kesia

texts.en:
Kesia is 53 years old married and has four children.

She sells cook stoves and has taken a loan to purchase additional improved cooking stoves which she will sell at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Kesia will be able to educate her children as well as repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams in the future are to assist her husband to meet the basic needs of her family as well as be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase additional improved cooking stoves

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 32-year-old man from Kisumu. He is married and is supporting six people in his family. 

He operates a motorcycle transport business, which he has been for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

He has applied for his second loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which he will use to purchase a motorbike tacking system to help him secure the motorcycle against theft as well as service his motorcycle. 

He is planning to use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike tacking system to help him secure the motorcycle against theft as well as service his motorcycle

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is married. He has been dealing in the produce business for three years now, plus doing events management to supplement his income.

He has the responsibility of paying school fees. He has a challenge of little capital to invest in his business during the peak season on top of unpredictable weather changes which limit his work and profits at large.

He wants to build a residential dream house to always be memorable in terms of his hard work. He requests a loan to buy material, like iron sheets and bricks, for building his house.

loans.use: to buy material, like iron sheets and bricks, for building his house.

loans.name: Jenit

texts.en:
Jenit is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jenit has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jenit has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jose Rudy

texts.es:
José necesita de un nuevo crédito para fortalecer aún más su fuente de ingresos para subsistir con su familia, comprara los insumos agrícolas necesarios para que su cultivo de maíz de una cosecha mucho más abundante, así espera tener uno de los alimentos básicos para su familia y también satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le permitió tener una buena cosecha de maíz y pipianes, pues fue un aporte muy valioso para realizar sus actividades agrícolas en el momento justo, últimamente ha presentado problemas para pagar debido a que un miembro de su familia se enfermó gravemente y le genero gastos que no tenía previsto.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan to further increase his source of income to take care of his family. He would like to buy the necessary agricultural supplies to produce a better corn harvest, so that he can provide the basic food necessities to his family, and also meet the needs of his customers.

His previous loan allowed him to have a good harvest of maize and pipianes [a type of squash], which was a very big help to carrying out his agricultural work at the time. Lately, though, he is needing more income, as a family member is seriously ill and he now has expenses that he did not have previously.

loans.use: to buy the necessary agricultural supplies to produce a better corn harvest.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is married with children. He has operated a butchery business for five years. He also does crop farming for extra income. He is the breadwinner of his family and he is managing due to his hard work. Despite his progress, Moses complains of high license fees and his lack of a preservative machine to keep the meat fresh. He is requesting a loan to buy goats for his butchery business to sell at Christmas.

loans.use: to buy goats for his butchery business.

loans.name: Jose Everardo

texts.es:
Everardo, de 28 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casado, su esposa está embarazada de su primer hijo y por lo tanto están realizando todos los preparativos y viven juntos en una casa que un amigo y compañero de trabajo le ha dado para que habite.

Everardo, es empleado de una empresa que se dedica a sembrar caña de azúcar para venderla a los ingenios azucareros y es el encargado de dirigir el trabajo de 24 agricultores en planilla y también se ha dedicado a la siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos desde que era pequeño.

Everardo, necesita el préstamo para comprar una bomba achicadora para regar desde un pozo, los cultivos de pipian y de maíz.

Everardo, sueña con llegar a tener su casa propia en donde pueda vivir junto a su esposa y sus futuros hijos y también sueña con tener una gran ganadería como la tuvo su papá.
texts.en:
Everado, who is 28 years old, is a very hardworking person. He studied up to high school, is married, and his wife is pregnant with their first child and for this they are making preparations. They live together in a house that a friend and co-worker has given him to live in.

Everado is employed by a company that plants sugar cane to sell to sugar refineries. He is in charge of directing the work of 25 farmers on the payroll and also has worked in the cultivation of vegetables since he was little.

Everado needs a loan to buy a water pump to irrigate Pipián (a type of squash) and corn crops from a well. 

Everado dreams of having his own home in which he could live with his wife and their future children and also dreams of having a large cattle ranch like his father did.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to irrigate squash and corn crops from a well

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta primer grado, es madre soltera y vive junto a un hija.

María, es bastante emprendedora, se dedica a vender tostadas, enredos, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales y muchos otros platillos típicos todos los días, ella vende sus platillos al medio día cuando ya ha finalizado todos los quehaceres del hogar; pero aparte de eso también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bovino y a sembrar maicillo para alimentarlos en el verano.

María, necesita el préstamo para pagar mano de obra y equipo de trabajo para la elaboración de un silo que va hacer construir con el maicillo que tiene sembrado en un terreno cercano a su vivienda. 

María, sueña con seguir trabajando e ir adquiriendo más animales para obtener leche y dedicarse a la elaboración de productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old. She is a very hard-working woman who went to school up to the first grade. She is a single mother who lives with her child.

Maria is very entrepreneurial. She works selling plaintain chips, fried yucca, "enredos" [fried yucca in threads], "empanadas" [pastry turnovers], tamales and many other typical dishes every day. She sells her dishes at midday when she has finished all the domestic chores. Apart from this, she also raises cattle and grows sorghum to feed them in the summer.

Maria needs the loan to pay for labor and equipment to make a silo that she is going to construct for the sorghum that she grows on land near her house.

Maria's dream is to continue working and to acquire more animals in order to get milk and work making dairy products.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and equipment to make a silo that she is going to construct for the sorghum that she has growing on land near her home.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a Babban Gona maize farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Ahmed can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ahmed has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Ahmed is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Henri Hanitra

texts.fr:
