Henri Hanitra vous remercie pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé, ainsi que son mari. Le crédit lui a permis d'acheter des matières premières pour la confection des trousses: des tissus, éponges, fermetures, fils à coudre supplémentaires et elle a pu augmenter sa capacité de production qui entraine automatiquement l'augmentation de revenu même un tout petit peu. Elle a trouvé de nouveau client. En outre, le temps de va et vient pour l'approvisionnement a ainsi diminué.
L'objectif d'ouvrir un atelier n'est pas encore atteint donc, il faut encore continuer à travailler beaucoup plus qu'auparavant selon elle, produire encore plus, chercher encore d'autres marchés.
texts.en:
Henri Hanitra thanks you for the loan that you granted her, as does her husband. The loan allowed her to buy materials for making small bags: fabric, sponges, fasteners, and extra sewing thread. 

She was able to increase her production capacity which automatically leads to an increase in income - even if just by a little bit. She has found new clients. Furthermore, the time going back and forth to get supplies has been reduced. 

Her aim to open a workshop has not yet been achieved. Therefore, according to her, she must work much more than before, produce even more and look for even more markets.

loans.use: to buy fasteners, sponges, linings, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Nebo Angwan Group

texts.en:
Everline, the lady raising her hand in the photo, is 30 years old, married and blessed with four children. She is a member of Nebo Agwan Group.
After joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa she received training on business and financial management. She started a kiosk business which has enabled her to provide a better education to her children.
Everline is taking out a Kiva loan to buy sugar, soap, cooking fat, kerosene, maize flour and beverages for her kiosk in order to expand it further. She appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the help and support, and has promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking fat, kerosene, maize flour and beverages for her kiosk.

loans.name: Hamida A

texts.en:
Hamida is 20 years old and lives in Bagamoyo district. She is volunteering as a Camfed learner guide.

Hamida is requesting a Kiva loan to start a business selling clothing. She plans to use the profits she earns to help her family and support children in need in her community.

Her “social-interest” loan will be repaid through Hamida's weekly two and a half hours of volunteering.

loans.use: to start a business selling clothing.

loans.name: Bushiratu

texts.en: Bushiratu is 21 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in the West Gonja District. She trades in refrigerated sachet water and is requesting a loan in order to add to the sales of textiles and Islamic veils to her Muslim dominated community. She plans to use the profit she earns to support in paying her school fees. She also volunteers as a Camfed alumna, giving her time each week to mentor younger members through a range of personal and entrepreneurial issues. Bushiratu's dream is to continue her education in nursing training college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of textiles and Islamic veils

loans.name: Salim

texts.ru: Салиму 48 лет. У него есть маленький магазин, где сам продает антифриз, автомобильное масло и автозапчасти. В этом бизнесе у него 15 летний опыт. И этим же бизнесом он кормит всю семью. Салим решил привести зимний товар с новым ассортиментом. Закупка и привозка товара стоит денег, и он полагается на кредит. Помогите Салиму осуществить задуманное.
texts.en: Salim is 48 years old.  He runs a small shop where he sells antifreeze, motor oil and spare-parts.  He has 15 years of experience in this business and he feeds his entire family thanks to this activity.  He has now decided to bring in a new inventory of goods, including winter products.  However, ordering and bringing in new merchandise is costly, so he is relying on a loan.  Please help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy motor oil, antifreeze, and spare parts.

loans.name: Lideres De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “LIDERES DE SANTA ROSA” está conformada por 06 socias trabajadoras. Este es el caso de TEODORA de 54 años de edad, soltera con 1 hijo independiente. Teodora es una madre empeñosa con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace más de 15 años que tiene dicho negocio Solicito el crédito para la compra de polos y pantalones. El grupo “líderes de santa rosa” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Teodora se encuentra sentada al lado izquierdo viste polo color marrón claro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Lideres de Santa Rosa" [Santa Rosa's Leaders] is made up of six hard-working members. This is the case of Teodora, 54, who is single and has one independent child. Teodora is a diligent mother with a desire to improve her quality of life. She makes a living selling clothes and she has had this business for more than 15 years. She requested the loan to buy shirts and pants. 

The group "Lideres de Santa Rosa" thanks Kiva for the help offered. Teodora is sitting on the left side wearing a light brown shirt.

loans.use: to buy shirts and pants.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is aged 55, married to a construction worker and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a hog raising business for almost eight years and earns a net income of PHP 2,500 per hog. Due to insufficient capital for her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hogs to raise and hog feed. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hogs to raise and hog feed.

loans.name: Braulo

texts.en:
Braulo and his family live a simple life in the town of Mahaplag in Leyte, Philippines. He is 57 years old and has earned a living for 15 years by selling food (snacks) to the community. He supports his five children; four adults and one school-aged with this livelihood. In addition to this, he also raises pigs for additional income.

With this, he needs capital to operate his food selling and hog raising businesses continuously and to be able to improve their livelihood in the future. Now he needs a bigger amount of loan to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, powdered milk and fruits. Another part also of their loan amount is to buy feed for their pigs.

loans.use: to buy  food ingredients such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, powdered milk, fruits and feed.

loans.name: Asdrubal

texts.es: Don Asdrubal es un agricultor que se dedica a la venta de aguacate en forma de almacigo y en fruta, actividad de la cual dependen sus ingresos familiares. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de fertilizantes agrícolas y pago de mano de obra necesarios para el desarrollo de dicho proyecto.
texts.en: Asdrubal is a farmer who works selling avocado in the form of seedlings and fruit.  His family depends on the income from this occupation.  He is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 CRC to buy agricultural fertilizers and to pay for the labor necessary to carry out this project.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to sow and grow avocados

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Teresita has been engaged in cooking and selling street foods in her community for almost two years now. She is 43 years of age and blessed with four children. Her husband, Alvin, works as a market collector and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Teresita plans to build her own stall since she is still renting a space, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional raw products like pork and chicken and seasonings that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Teresita dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To build her stall and purchase additional raw products needed for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Mary with her son, Prine Niño, who is 17 years old and is the first of three children in the family.

Mary is borrowing 7,500 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Prine Niño, who is studying for a Bachelor of Arts degree. Prine Niño is currently in his first year of this four-year course.

When he graduates, Prine Niño plans to be a teacher and help his mother send his younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Sameera is a 51-year-old widowed mother of four who has struggled since her husband passed away to raise and teach ‎her children to make sure that they can have a better life. Sameera is well-known in her region because she opened a ‎grocery in her home. She is a hard worker who puts so much effort to expand her working sector and develop her ‎family's living.
Her business income is barely enough to cover her family's daily living needs, therefore she decided to expand her business ‎and request a loan from Kiva to help her buy more groceries such as chips, juices, candies and more.‎
She hopes to stay in good health and continue supporting her children. Sameera admits that being both the hardworking father ‎and the caring mother is hard, but she has managed to overcome the hardest issues that anyone might face.‎

loans.use: to buy more groceries such as chips, juices, candies and more.

loans.name: Yolanda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 26 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad.     

Yolanda, se dedica a comercializar todo tipo de productos de consumo, pero en está ocasión venderá productos navideños de la época, por esa razón está solicitando ayuda para la realización de su proyecto.

Yolanda, necesita el préstamo para comprar adornos navideños y pólvora para vender.

Yolanda, sueña con seguir trabajando y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yolanda, 26, is married and has two children, ages 4 and 5. Yolanda sells all type of consumer goods, but on this occasion she wants to sell seasonal Christmas products. She is asking for loan to buy Christmas ornaments and fireworks to sell. She dreams of continuing her work and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy Christmas decorations and fireworks to sell.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura, sus 4 hijos viven con ellos pues aún son menores de edad.

Reina, desde hace un año tiene una tienda, ella tomó la iniciativa de comenzar con esta negocio por decisión propia y sus hijos le ayudan; pero también tiene como fuente de ingreso la venta de pan que tiene desde hace 7 años.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, pan, detergentes, azúcar, entre otros productos para su tienda.

Reina, sueña con tener una tienda grande y que se encuentre bien surtida para ofrecerle diversidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reina, 44, has a 3rd grade education.  Her husband is a farmer, and they have 4 minor children who live with them.

Reina has had a store for a year.  She took the initiative to start a business, and her children help her.  She also generates income by selling bread; she's been doing this for 7 years.

Reina needs a loan to buy rice, beans, bread, detergents, sugar, and other products for her store.  She dreams of having a big store that is well-stocked where she could offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy products for her store.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Мастона молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 31 лет. Она вдова. Она одна воспитывает двоих детей. Она живет в сельской местности. У нее, также имеется домашний скот, за которым она ежедневно ухаживает.
 Мастона социальный работник. Она работает в   реабилитационном центре для детей инвалидов.  Она любит свою работу. Ухаживая за детьми с ограниченной ответственностью, она чувствует свою значимость в обществе. Кредит Мастона берет для проведения маленького семейного мероприятия. 
Мастона хочет провести мероприятие по обрезанию своего сына. Но у неё не хватает собственных средств. Она узнала о финансовой поддержке МДО Арванд и обратилась за кредитом. 
Мастона заранее благодарит МДО «Арванд» за предоставленную помощь и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Mastona is a young and hardworking woman of 31. She is a widow and raising two children on her own. She lives in a rural area and has livestock, which she cares for every day. She is also a social worker and works in a rehabilitation centre for disabled children. She loves her work. In caring for children with limited capabilities, she feels useful to society. 

Mastona wants to take out a loan to put on a small family event. She wants to celebrate her son's circumcision, but doesn't have enough money. She found out about financial support from Arvand and is requesting a loan. She thanks Arvand in advance for the support they are offering and hopes for further cooperation.

loans.use: for personal expenses

loans.name: Altha

texts.en:
Altha is a strong, hardworking woman who is devoted to her family. She lives in a modest home close to her loved ones, and she is proud of what she has accomplished throughout her life, including raising her children on her own.

This year has been a difficult one for Altha. She works hard to make ends meet, but when she comes home; she is unable to enjoy her time to herself due to the unbearable heat. Altha’s air conditioner stopped working months ago, and she has been unable to replace it with a new unit as she does not have the funds available to pay for it out of pocket. 

She welcomed a new granddaughter recently, but sadly she has been unable to see her often due to being too exhausted from living in a sweltering house.  She would love to have her granddaughter stay the night with her; however, she is concerned for her granddaughter's comfort if she were to stay the night in the home with her. During the summer months, the temperature inside Altha’s home has been hotter than the outdoor daytime high temperatures, and this has begun to affect her health. 

Altha has not utilized credit in the past, and this has resulted in a nearly non-existent payment history. Altha is hoping to not only help improve her quality of life with the installation of a new high efficiency air conditioner, but to also improve her credit score as she repays her loan through SELF. 

Altha will use her loan to purchase a new high efficiency air conditioning unit which will greatly improve her quality of life and preserve her health.

loans.use: to buy a new high efficiency air conditioning unit which will greatly improve her quality of life and preserve her health.

loans.name: Eli

texts.en: Eli is a maize farmer from Gambo village. As a Babban Gona member, Eli is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Eli would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Eli can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Eli no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Eli hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Burkina Group

texts.fr: Marie, est une femme âgée de 31 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants. Marie exerce son activité 05 ans dans le tissage des pagnes. Ce qui marcher son activité c'est dynamisme , son courage, sa bonne relation, son travail bien fait son fort c'est la beauté beauté et la diversité de ses pagnes. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter du fil à tisser, acheter de la teinture, acheter du bois afin de préparer la teinture. L'utilité du prêt c'est de pouvoir s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour renforcer son activité. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt une fois et à rembourser à la date prévue.
texts.en:
Marie is a 31 year-old woman and the mother of three children. She has been weaving pagnes (traditional wraparounds) for five years. What makes her business work is her dynamism, her courage, her relationships, and her quality work. Her forte is the beauty and the diversity of her pagnes.

She would like a loan to buy thread for weaving, dye, and wood to prepare the dye. She will use the loan to buy her supplies in large enough quantities to bolster her business.

She already received one loan, which she repaid by its due date.

loans.use: buy thread for weaving, dye, and wood to prepare the dye.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a strong, hardworking single woman who has managed to raise her daughters on her own.  She works a full-time job to make ends meet, and she is currently working toward repairing her credit. Mercedes' credit is not damaged, but she has very little payment history which has resulted in a low credit score. Mercedes has raised her daughters on her income without the use of credit. 

For the past three years, the air conditioning unit on Mercedes’ home has required repair every summer. The unit is old and very inefficient, and it has become quite costly to repair and operate. This year, the unit began to emit smoke before it stopped working, and this has resulted in her decision to replace the unit. Mercedes does not have the funds to pay for this replacement out of pocket, and her low credit score prohibits her from being able to finance a new unit through a bank or repair store. Mercedes is now hoping that SELF and KIVA will help her purchase a new high efficiency air conditioner that is reliable and will save her month on her utility bills. 

Mercedes is hoping to use to her KIVA loan to purchase a new high-efficiency air conditioner to improve her family's quality of life, reduce operating costs, and help rebuild her credit.

loans.use: to buy a new high-efficiency air conditioner to improve her family's quality of life, reduce operating costs, and help rebuild her credit.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años de edad que vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos, ya que el mayor hizo su propia vida. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos por las tardes, ya que en las mañanas se dedica a la agricultura, lo cual le permite sacar adelante a su familia. María desea instalar energía eléctrica en su hogar, anteriormente solicito un crédito con el cual construyo el servicio sanitario en su vivienda, por lo que buscando la manera de continuar mejorando su hogar, solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre eléctrico, caja térmica, toma corriente, etc., para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working, 38-year-old woman. She lives with her life partner and their three children; the oldest already made his own life. She makes a living providing domestic services in the afternoons because in the mornings, she works in agriculture, which allows her to raise her family. 

Maria wants to install electric energy in her home. Previously, she requested a loan with which she built a bathroom in her house. Because she is looking for a way to continue to improve her home, she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to invest in electrical wire, a breaker box, an electrical outlet, etc. in order to install electricity in her house.

loans.use: to invest in electrical wire, a breaker box, an electrical outlet, etc., in order to install electric energy in her house.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en: Apolinaria resides in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She and her husband are into farming vegatables such as okra, string beans and bananas. In addition to farming, she is also engaged in buying and selling bananas and root crops like sweet potatoes. This farm produce is something that she buys from other farmers and sells in the town proper for a profit. This has been her source of income for a decade now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and more sweet potatoes and bananas from farmers. Apolinaria's income is utilized for their food and school fees for her children who are aged 11 and 17.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more sweet potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Chhoeurn

texts.en:
Chhoeurn, 61 years old, is a farmer in the rice field who lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province. She is a hardworking mother of two children, one married. She can make a net profit of approximately USD 5 a day.

During this time, Chhoeurn is facing a financial issue in her family. She needs some money to buy some farming materials, but yet she can’t afford them. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan. She has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and other related farming materials and to buy some rice seeds to use on her rice field. She is thankful to all lenders for supporting their finances.

loans.use: to buy some farming materials

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her establish her business. That loan enabled her to purchase additional grocery products to increase her product inventory. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Chona is very positive that she can further improve her business with another 50,000 PHP loan. This new loan will be used to purchase additional stock including varieties of beverages and assorted grocery goods. By offering more items for sale, Chona's customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Chona to sustain her family's needs.

In addition to her variety store, Chona offers travel and tour services and she dreams of expanding this livelihood she has now. She aims also to help her aging parents. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  beverages and grocery goods to sell and to finance her tours and travel business.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es: Luis es un hombre humilde y trabajador de 42 años, habita en Madrid un municipio de Cundinamarca en  compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, él ama las labores del campo y decidió hace cinco años dedicarse exclusivamente a la producción lechera y su comercialización. Su experiencia en empleos anteriores en fincas del municipio, le permitieron contar con el conocimiento para emprender su propio negocio con el que ofrece a su familia un sustento seguro y sus expectativas de crecimiento están sujetas a la adquisición de mucho más ganado lechero, es por ello que aplicó a un credikiva, alternativa para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar ganado a precio de oportunidad. Esta inversión le permitirá entregar mucha más leche a las empresas recolectoras y con ello sus ingresos serán mayores, lo que lo acercará más pronto a su meta familiar de tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is a modest, hard-working man of 42. He lives with his wife and two children in Madrid, a municipality in Cundinamarca department. He loves farm work, and decided five years ago to devote himself exclusively to producing and selling milk. His experience in previous jobs at farms in the municipality allowed him to have the knowledge to launch his own business, with which he offers his family a secure source of income.

His prospects for growth are tied to the acquisition of many more dairy cattle. this is why he applied for a credikiva loan, as a way to link himself to the world of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and buy cattle at the best available price. This investment will allow him to deliver much more milk to the dairy middlemen and in this way his income will be greater, which will help him reach the family's goal sooner, that of owning their own home.

loans.use: to buy cattle at the best available price.

loans.name: Manuel Guillermo

texts.es: Manuel de 65 años es un emprendedor que desde joven tomó la decisión de contar con un ingreso adicional para sus años de madurez, fue entonces que con sus ahorros a partir del año 1990 adquirió un apartamento que lo suministra en arriendo.  Todos los meses su inquilino le entrega el canon de arrendamiento, con el cual solventa sus necesidades y las de su cónyuge, sin embargo su deber como arrendatario es mantener el inmueble con buenas condiciones de habitabilidad y en el momento no cuenta con recursos que le permitan realizar mejoras en el apartamento, es por ello que aplicó a un credikiva, alternativa para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y llevar a cabo dicho proyecto, recursos con los que financiará la compra de materiales como pintura, estuco, tuberías, material cerámico y cancelará la mano de obra de los trabajadores. Manuel es un hombre mayor de edad que desea pasar sus últimos años con buena salud y tranquilidad, y su meta muy pronto se hará realidad gracias a esta financiación: mejorar la presentación de su apartamento.
texts.en:
Manuel is 65 years old. He is an entrepreneur, and when he was young he decided he wanted to be able to rely on an extra income in his older years. So in 1990 he decided to spend some of his savings to purchase an apartment, which he rents out. 
Each month his renter turns in the rental payment, which helps Manuel pay for his own living expenses and those of his partner. It is, of course, Manuel's responsibility to keep the apartment in good living condition, and at this time he doesn't have the money to make improvements to the apartment. For this reason he has applied for a Kiva loan, which is one way to link up to the financial offerings of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and to carry out this project. 
With these resources, Manuel will finance the purchase of materials such as paint, stucco, plumbing and tile, and will also pay laborers for the work. 
Manuel is an older gentleman who wants to spend his later years in good health and in peace. He will be able to achieve this goal very soon thanks to this loan, which will improve the look of his apartment.

loans.use: to purchase materials and pay laborers.

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Norlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 6 years now, and she earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Norlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell in her store.

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es:
Blanca es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos ya son adultos y la menor está estudiando a nivel de bachillerato, todos viven en una misma casa, desde hace siete años ella vende frutas y verduras, tiene su puesto en el mercado municipal de la ciudad, su jornada de trabajo es de 7:00 am. a 5:00 pm., es así como ella puede tener el dinero suficiente para cubrir los gastos familiares.
El mercado ha sido remodelado en general, pero cada persona debe aportar al mejoramiento de su propio puesto, Blanca está solicitando un crédito para poder pagar reparaciones y cambio de pintura a su local, de esta manera tendrá un negocio con mejor presentación, tiene la finalidad de dar un buen servicio, cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes para así generar más ingresos con los cuales podrá ir cancelando las cuotas del crédito.
Como jefa de su hogar ella desea seguir trabajando arduamente para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y que también sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Blanca is a single mother with 3 children.  Two of her children are now adults, and the youngest is in high school.  They all live together in the same house.  For 7 years, Blanca has been selling fruits and vegetables.  She has a stall in the municipal market in her city.  She works daily from 7am until 5pm. This is how she generates the money to pay for the family's expenses.

This market has been generally remodeled, but each person has to pay for the improvement of their own stall. Blanca is requesting a loan to pay for repairs and to paint her stall.  This way she can improve the appearance of her business.  Her objective is to provide good service and meet the needs of her customers so that she can generate more income.  This way she will be able to make the payments on her loan.  

As the head of her household, she wants to continue to work very hard so that her children can have a better future, and so that they can continue with their education.

loans.use: to make some improvements to her business locale

loans.name: Franklin Jose

texts.es:
Franklin es un hombre soltero de 35 años de edad, que trata de preservar su negocio de cría de cerdos  el cual está un poco caído por la falta de capital para invertir.
A pesar de poner todo su empeño y dedicación en sus labores el bajo precio de venta del cerdo fue lo que le genero ciertas perdidas, pero no desiste de su deseo de triunfar en las actividades, de su negocio depende no solo él, sino sus dos hijos, una razón más para luchar por conservar algo que con tanto esfuerzo ha logrado.
El cliente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y reforzar las chiqueras que están en mal estado, cree firmemente en recuperarse.
texts.en:
Franklin is a single man, 35, trying to preserve his pig raising business which is slightly down due to lack of capital to invest.

Despite putting forth all of his effort and dedication into his work, the low price of pork caused him to experience some losses but he did not give up on his desire to triumph in his work. Not only does he depend on his business but also his two children, one more reason to fight to conserve something that he has achieved with so much effort.

The client is requesting a loan to buy pigs and reinforce the pigpens that are in disrepair. He believes strongly that he will recover.

loans.use: to buy pigs and reinforce the pigpens that are in disrepair.

loans.name: Maria Marinela

texts.es:
Con una sonrisa dibujada en el rostro, siempre con optimismo y dispuesta a dar lo mejor de sí, sale la señora María a vender su mercancía, Bolsas plásticas. 
Ella es una empresaria activa que busca los ingresos en la calle, perseverante, no se da por vencida, recorre largas distancia, busca compradores, sabe ganarse su dinero.
María siempre busca vender mayor número de mercancía, espera en un futuro generar empleo y tener vendedores ubicados en diferentes sitios.
La temporada de diciembre para ella es donde se generan mayores ventas puesto que los compradores necesitan una bolsa plásticas para llevar sus compras y ella quiere ser quien les brinde dicha insumo, por ende solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido al por mayor.
texts.en:
With a smile drawn on her face, always with optimism and ready to give the best of herself, Maria comes out to sell her merchandise, plastic bags.

She is an active entrepreneur who looks for income in the street. Persistent, she doesn't give up, she travels long distances, searching for buyers knowing how to earn her money.

María is always looking to sell more goods. She hopes in the future to create employment and to have sellers located in different places.

The season of December is when she generates the most sales since the buyers need plastic bags to carry their purchases and she wants to be someone who provides said resource. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy stock at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags in bulk.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Marta Regina

texts.es:
Marta es una empresaria de 54 años de edad la cual tiene una cafetería, trabaja en ella 10 horas diariamente, inicio con su negocio en octubre del presente año, llena de entusiasmo e ilusión emprendió este camino, tomó un negocio en mal estado y quiere hacer de este una reconocida cafetería, distinguida por su estilo y sabor.
Actualmente el negocio está en mal estado, pide apoyo de la comunidad kiva para comprar todos los materiales que necesita para tener la cafetería de sus sueños.
Con el préstamo comprara pintura, momposteria, surtido, vitrinas, sillas, muebles.
texts.en: Marta, 54, is a businesswoman who runs a cafeteria, where she works for ten hours every day. She opened this business in October of this year, full of enthusiasm and hope. She took over a business in poor shape and wants to make it a popular cafeteria, known for its style and taste. Right now the business is in bad shape. She is asking for help from the kiva community to buy all the materials she needs to make it into the cafeteria of her dreams. With the loan she will buy paint, building stones, stock, windows, chairs, and furniture.

loans.use: to buy paint, building stones, stock, windows, chairs, furniture.

loans.name: Gilma Rosa

texts.es:
Gilma es una productora agropecuaria de 39 años de edad,  se dedica a la cría y venta de aves, actividad que desarrolla hace varios años pero en los últimos días ha intensificado y aumentado su producción debido a que se separó de su esposo, quedando como madre cabeza de familia de un hogar que lo termina de conformar 4 hijos de 5, 10, 13, 15.
Su principal objetivo es generar los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar y alimentación de su familia, pero sueña con poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, lo cual podrá lograrlo si mejora sus ventas y tiene mayor número de clientes.
Por lo pronto la señora Gilma solicita un préstamo para compra de pollos, alimento y remodelaciones al galpón, todo ello pensando en el aumento de venta y generación de ingresos.
texts.en:
Gilma is an agricultural producer who is 39 years old. She is dedicated to raising and selling poultry, work that developed many years ago but has intensified in recent days and she has expanded her production since she separated from her husband, leaving her as a mother and head of a family of four children who are 5, 10, 13, 15.

Her main objective is to earn enough resources to support her home and to feed her family but she dreams of being able to improve the conditions of her house which she will be able to achieve if she improves her sales and has a greater number of customers.

For now, Gilma is requesting a loan to buy chickens, feed and to repair the shed, keeping the expansion of sales and revenue in mind.

loans.use: to buy chicken, food and to repair the shed.

loans.name: Veronica Johana

texts.es:
Verónica es una joven emprendedora de 24 años de edad, la cual trabaja incansablemente por mejorar su situación económica, reformar su hogar, estudiar, darle una vida ejemplar a su hija de 6 años de edad.
Tiene dos negocios, una tienda donde vende principalmente snacks, vende alimentos, abarrotes, ella realmente se rebusca el dinero para cumplir sus sueños. Hoy la joven necesita de tu apoyo para tener una nueva actividad productiva, que será la venta de arepas de queso, para lo que necesita un préstamo con el cual comprara un carro de comidas bien equipado e insumos para realizar las arepas. 
Todo este fuerzo, laboral tanto tiempo lo hace solo con el propósito de salir adelante, ella no ha tenido grandes oportunidades, lo que tiene se lo ha ganado con esfuerzo y trabajo, quiere seguir generando posibilidad para tener un mejor presente y un próspero futuro.
texts.en:
Verónica is a young businesswoman of 24 years of age who works tirelessly to improve her economic situation, refurbish her home, study, and give her 6 year old daughter an exemplary life.

She has two businesses; a store where she sells primarily snacks and she sells foods and groceries. She truly seeks the money to fulfill her dreams. Now she needs your support to have a new productive activity, which will be the sale of cheese arepas, for which she needs a loan with which she will buy a well equipped food cart and supplies to make the arepas.

All of this effort, both labor and time, she does only with the goal of moving forward. She has not had great opportunities; what she has she has earned with effort and work. She wants to continue creating opportunity to have a better present and a prosperous future.

loans.use: have a new productive activity.

loans.name: Bety Regina

texts.es: La señora Bety necesita de tu ayuda para comprar una máquina filetedeadora, ella es una mujer de 44 años de edad la cual tenía el dinero para dicha máquina pero debido a que su hijo lo mataron prestando servicio militar tuvo que usar el capital para cubrir todos los gastos, es por ello que solicita de su apoyo, porque en verdad necesita de tu apoyo.
texts.en: Bety needs your help to buy an industrial sewing machine. She is a 44-year-old woman who had the money for this machine, but since her son was killed while providing military service she had to use the capital to cover all of the funeral expenses. This is why she is asking for your support, because she truly needs your support.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz Adriana una mujer de 34 años de edad la cual se dedica principalmente a las actividades domésticas inicio con un negocio de cría de cerdos.
La cliente inició sus actividades buscando la libertad financiera, pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener dinero para satisfacer sus necesidades y deseos.
Para la cliente la mayores dificultades que ha presentado en su negocio son la fuerte competencia, necesita tener mayores animales para competir con los precios, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en una cerda de cría, adicional una planta para alimentar los que tiene y los que nazcan y pro último ampliara la porqueriza para las futuras crías.
texts.en:
Luz Adriana is a 34 year old woman who devotes herself mainly to household work and who has started a business breeding pigs.

The client started her activities looking for financial freedom, to pay for her children's education, to improve her housing conditions and to have money to fulfil her needs and wishes.

According to the client, the greatest challenge facing her business is the strong competition. She needs to have more animals to compete in pricing. That is the reason to request a loan, which she will invest in a sow, and additionally a plant to feed the ones she owns and the ones that will be born. Lastly, she will enlarge the pigsty for the piglets to come.

loans.use: to invest in a sow and additionally a plant to feed the ones she owns and the ones that will be born.

loans.name: Nilson Miguel

texts.es:
12 horas diarias dedica el señor Nilson a su negocio de ebanistería, el un hombre de 39 años de edad que trabaja incansablemente por triunfar como empresario, tiene un negocio de ebanistería.
LA historia de Nilson es la de un hombre luchador el cual guiado por su deseo de ser independiente inició con un modesto negocio y se siente orgulloso de ver el crecimiento que ha obtenido hasta ahora. 
Con el ánimo de seguir creciendo, de involucrar a sus hijos en este negocio para que en un futuro lo operen, el señor Nilson solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera con la cual elaborara muebles para la venta, pensando en la temporada de fin de año, donde algunos hogares renuevan sus muebles y quiere ser él quien los provea.
texts.en:
Twelve hours daily Nilson Miguel dedicates to his cabinet-work business. He is a 39-year-old man who works tirelessly for the success of his business. Nilson Miguel has a cabinet-working business.

Nilson Miguel's history reveals a combative man who is guided by his desire to be independent. He began with a modest business and is proud to see the growth he has achieved up to now.

With the spirit to continue growing, he is involving his children in the business, so that in the future they may operate it. Nilson Miguel is requesting a loan to purchase wood for making furniture to sell, thinking of the end-of-the-year season when some families renew their furniture. He wants to be the person who provides that furniture.

loans.use: buy wood for making furniture to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Edy Yomara

texts.es:
Edy es una joven de 22 años de edad, madre de un pequeño que tiene 6, vive en unión libre con su pareja y se dedica principalmente a vender productos de consumo personal, pero es un trabajo más como impulsadora, entendiendo que maneja su propia mercancía a través de una empresa reconocida.
Edy trabaja por alcanzar un sueño, el cual es la libertad financiera, quiere ser una importante vendedora, que tenga empelados, un local comercial, dinero suficiente para pagar la educación de sus niño y comprar una vivienda propia. 
Pensando en aumentar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, tener mejor utilidad, formalizar su negocio, y presentar un catálogo más amplió, la joven solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de consumo personal que sirven como complemento alimenticio.
texts.en:
Edy is 22 year old young woman. She is the mother of a 6 year old. She lives in a common law marriage with her partner. She works primarily in the sale of personal care products, but she is more than a promoter, as she manages her own merchandise through a well known business. Edy works to reach her dream, which is to have financial freedom. She wants to be an important seller, with employees, a commercial locale, and sufficient money for the education of her child and to buy her own house.

As she thinks of increasing her sales, increasing her customers, obtaining more profit, formalizing her business and presenting a wider catalog of products, she seeks a loan to buy personal care products that serve as nutritional supplements.

loans.use: to buy personal care products that serve as nutritional supplements.

loans.name: Noi's Group

texts.en:
Noi, born in 1979, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s income comes from animal breeding and cultivation. Each year her family can sell a few pig herds with the income being about 60 to 65 million VND. It is just enough to cover the family's living expenses. She really wants to expand the pig-breeding model but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in breeding at high productivity levels. When she sells the next pig herd it shouldl bring her family a considerable profit. For herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to expand the pig-breeding model

loans.name: Arc-En-Ciel (Mc)

texts.en:
Carline, aged 30, has been spending years in selling over the counter at her sister's drugstore. She realized that she could earn more if she had another economic activity.

In 2013, she gathered 24 people in her community to create a savings group. Carline managed to find trainings to help her group. Now, they have raised $1,000 over a year. Upon reflection, Carline would like to be connected with a microfinance institution for two reasons: first, she would make term deposits to earn more profits and her group would have access to more capital.

When she heard about Zafen, she was excited to take part in the program. Therefore, she requests a loan to buy more medicines and some racks of beverages to retail among the members. in the end, that loan will increase the group's economic capacity and build more solidarity.

The committee board is pictured with their big piggybank in front and their description is as below:

Maxo (first on right) is the treasurer.
Carline (second from right) is the president, the leader.
Marie-Landy (third from right) wears a white-patterned blouse.
Pouchon wears a purple teeshirt and he is the secretary.

loans.use: to buy some medicines and some beverages to retail.

loans.name: Phanh's Group

texts.en:
Phanh, 43 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman who joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2001. She currently lives with her husband, her son and her son’s wife in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is pig breeding and cultivation. Each year she can sell more than one ton of pig meat with a revenue of about 55 to 60 million VND. The income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount. She wants to raise sows but the saved amount is not enough to do so. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have favorable conditions to invest well in the pig breeding. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise sows

loans.name: Nairo

texts.es:
Nairo es un hombre humilde, honesto, sonriente de 26 años de edad el cual se encuentra solicitando un apoyo económico para iniciar un negocio de turismo en moto en el municipio de turbo, cuenta con el transporte pero el dinero del crédito será usado en la compra de una ruta de vereda para operar con toda tranquilidad y acobijarse a la ley.
Vive en unión libre con su pareja, espera con este negocio pueda crecer económicamente y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nairo is an honest, humble, smiling 26 year old man. He finds himself requesting financial support to initiate a motorcycle tourism business in the municipality of Turbo. He has the transportation but the money from the loan will be used to buy a municipal route to operate with total tranquility and be protected by the law.

He lives in a common-law relationship with his partner. He hopes that with this business he can grow economically and enjoy a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a municipal route to operate with total tranquility, offering tourist services.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto es un hombre de 40 años de edad, el cual se dedica a la venta de ganado, negocio con el cual genera el sustento para su familia conformada por su pareja con quien vive en unión libre y sus dos hijos de 6 y 8.
Aunque vive en un humilde hogar el cual es alquilado es feliz, su sueño es comprar una vivienda, pero mientras su familia sonría, tenga un alimento y la oportunidad de estudiar  es feliz.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de terneros, quiere seguir teniendo una regularidad en ventas y crecer a pequeños pero seguros pasos.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto, 40, sells livestock for a living. This generates enough income for him to look after his family. He is married and has two children aged six and eight.

Although they live in a modest rented home, he is very happy. He dreams of buying his own home, but so long as his family keep smiling, he has food on the table and he can pay for education, then he is satisfied.

He is asking for a loan to buy cows, so he can keep up his sales and slowly but surely expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cows to boost  his sales.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a resident of the town of Talibon. She is a 44-year-old woman and has two children, both of whom are still attending school. Her means of living is by engaging in buying and selling coconuts, bananas and mangoes. She has been in that kind of livelihood for 11 years now.

Due to high demand and because she has very minimum purchasing ability, Naomi decided to access a loan from CEVI. She is excited and overwhelmed to improve her business.

Naomi has requested a loan and wants to acquire capital to purchase a variety of supplies like coconuts, bananas and mangoes. With these, slowly, it could help boost her income, and enable her to continue to use the additional revenue to supplement the needs of her children.

She is determined to support her children's respective studies for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of supplies like coconuts, bananas and mangoes.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda is a 65-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Mahaplag, Leyte. Her husband operates their farm, while Leonarda is running a sari-sari (variety) store business. She has been doing this for five years. Leonarda and her husband work hard to raise their big family. They have seven children: six adults and one school-aged child. She is asking for a loan to buy commodities to sell such as drinks, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, and rice. She will also buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of their plants. Leonarda is determined to increase her family's livelihood for their future needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, candies, toiletries, salt, sugar, rice, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mabel works hard to support her family. She has an auto repair shop business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials like spare parts, gasoline, engine oil and maintenance for her business.

Mabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like spare parts, gasoline, engine oil and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analyn is 43 years old and both children are currently in school.

Analyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Analyn has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: Mateene est une femme d’affaires, vendeuse des matériaux de construction, membre de la banque villageoise «Asifiwe», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 37 ans et mère de 4 enfants parmi eux, 3 étudient et 1 encore gosse. Elle va acheter 350 planches pour renforcer ses activités. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu d’un crédit depuis 3 ans. Elle compte acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
Mateene is a business woman, a construction materials saleswoman, a member of the banque villageoise "Asifiwe", and a client of the MFI Hekima. She is a 37-year-old widow with four children, of which three are studying and one is still a child. 

She is going to buy 350 planks of wood to strengthen her business. She started her business using capital received from a loan over the past three years. She plans on buying a plot of land, and paying to school and feed her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support they provide to "unbankable" business people.

loans.use: to buy 350 planks of wood.

loans.name: Grupo Chuachinup Mujeres Group

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 53 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia, ellos habitan en una comunidad de la aldea Chuachinup.
Catarina con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, ella lleva 6 años de realizar este negocio, su negocio se ubica en el mercado central de su comunidad.
La amabilidad, simpatía y respeto que caracteriza a Catarina ha logrado que su clientela la busque con mucha frecuencia,  a raíz de esta demanda ella se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo  para la compra de más productos de ropa típica como; güipiles, fajas y cortes. Ella busca con esta inversión darles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Su esperanza de vida es seguir  fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 53-year-old woman and is married with a beautiful family. They live in the community of the Chuachinup village. Catarina is eager to earn income to help get her family ahead, and to do this by working buying and selling traditional clothing. 

She has worked doing this for 6 years, and her business is located in the central market of her community. The kindness, sympathy and respect that characterise Catarina have helped her obtain clientèle that buy from her regularly, and as a result of this demand she is requesting a loan to purchase more traditional clothing products, such as güipiles [tunics/blouses], fajas [sashes] and cortes [skirts]. 

With this investment she plans to provide an even better service to her customers. Her life dream is to continue strengthening her business and improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing such as blouses, sashes and skirts.

loans.name: Quyet's Group

texts.en:
Quyet is a Thai ethnic woman who joined in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January 2008. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family's lives are mainly based on animal breeding and cultivation. The income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and to pay for her son’s education fees. She wants to raise a breeding cow but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in raising a breeding cow effectively, and then next year the breeding cow will give her family a lovely calf.

loans.use: to raise a breeding cow.

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en:
Tanveer is a 41-year-old married woman living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession and drives a rickshaw in Lahore city, which is a very populated area. A few days ago, he was in a road accident; he was looking for a passenger standing beside the road and a speedy car collided with the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any fractures but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged and needed to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new rickshaw body but is looking for a lump sum amount.

Therefore, Tanveer has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy a new rickshaw body.

Tanveer is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this support.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, blocks and to pay for labor for the construction of a perimeter wall

loans.name: Gloria Bersabe

texts.es: Gloria tiene 41 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 18 años de edad a la que han sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de champú artesanal, actividad que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia desde hace 2 años. Gloria desea comprar el terreno que se observa en la fotografía y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el terreno que está a la par de su vivienda y de esta manera contar con un lugar propio.
texts.en: Gloria is 41 and lives with her partner and her 18-year-old daughter who she has raised with a lot of hard work. She is a hardworking woman who earns her living making shampoo, which has allowed her to bring in an income for her family for the past two years. Gloria wants to buy the land that is seen in the photo. She has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy the land so that she can have a proper home.

loans.use: to purchase land to construct her own home

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married with five children. With two of her children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like biscuits, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Gemma has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorena is 42 years old.

Lorena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell in her store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell in her store.

loans.name: Geozel

texts.en:
Geozel is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geozel is 26 years old.

Geozel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in her market.

In the future, Geozel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in her market.

loans.name: Divine Group

texts.fr: Chigangu est un entrepreneur qui commerce de friperie dans un marché de la ville, membre du groupe de crédits «Divine», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée 35 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient et 2 sont petits. Elle va s’approvisionner en un ballon de friperies. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité, avec le premier capital reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Chigangu is an entrepreneur who sells used clothing at a market in town. She is a member of the loan group “Divine” and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. Aged 35, she is the married mother of five children, of whom three are students, and two are very young. For two years, she has operated this business with initial capital from a loan. Her wish is to purchase a parcel of land and provide schooling for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with a bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Tupatane Group

texts.fr: Miahitse est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Tupatane», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 45 ans, mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des boissons sucrées au domicile depuis 8 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 15 caisses de sucrées. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite augmenter son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Miahitse is a merchant, the president of the loan group “Tupatane”, and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. Aged 45, she is the married mother of eight children, of whom all are in school. For eight years, she has sold soft drinks out of her home. She began her business with funds from a loan. Her wish is to increase her business and provide food and schooling for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 15 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Blanca Luz

texts.es:
Blanca, de 51 años de edad, se dedico a estudiar cosmetología, está acompañada, su pareja atiende su propio negocio el cual consiste en una tienda donde vende todo tipo de productos de la canasta básica y con ellos vive una hija.

Blanca, tiene una sala de belleza y peluquería para ambos sexos, en donde brinda servicios de alisado de cabello, planchados, corte de cabello y tintes, esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 20 años, este negocio lo tiene en la misma casa de habitación y su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo de 8:00 a.m. a hasta las 5:00 p.m.

Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar mobiliario y equipo para su sala de belleza, porque necesita adquirir un lava cabezas que sirve para clientes que se les brinda el servicio de planchado y para comprar nuevas sillas y espejos.

Blanca sueña con tener su Sala de Belleza con todo el mobiliario y equipo adecuado, para brindar todos los servicios que le solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca, 51, studied cosmetology. She is in a relationship and her partner runs his own business, which is a store that sells all kinds of basic grocery products. They have a daughter that lives with them.

Blanca has a beauty parlor and a barbershop for both sexes. She does hair straightening, perms, haircuts, and hair color. She has done this work for over 20 years. She runs her business out of a room in her house and her working hours are Monday-Sunday 8 am to 5 pm.

Blanca needs to buy furniture and equipment for her beauty salon because she needs a basin to wash her clients' hair, new chairs, and mirrors to better serve her clients.

Blanca dreams of having her own beauty salon with all the furniture and appropriate equipment for all of the services that her clients request.

loans.use: to buy furniture and equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 34-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching embroidered dresses and selling them in nearby towns for many years.

He has been recruiting skilled persons to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some material home for Shabana because she helps him in embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his artistry and appreciate his efforts.

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance, to have in stock. He requires some capital to buy the desired items but does not have sufficient cash on hand.

Therefore, Shabana humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, her husband will be able to buy the threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors that he needs.

Shabana is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.en:
Oygul is 45 years old. She is an industrious woman who is married and has four children. Oygul lives with her family in a village of South Tajikistan. She is a repeat client of IMON and she is a very responsible woman who makes her payments on time.

Oygul has been busy with animal husbandry more than eight years. She mainly feeds cows. She sells milk and milk products in a local market. Her buyers are glad to buy such kinds of ecology soft products.

She is going to increase the number of cows she feeds, so she is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni (TJS) with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a cow for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda se dedica a la crianza de pollos por mayor, la socia es muy trabajadora y emprendedora así logro sacar adelante su negocio y su familia.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar maíz y alpiste.

La socia está contenta con el préstamo que le otorgaron y esta agradecida con los inversionistas de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella. Además la socia se compromete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Yolanda earns her living raising chickens in large quantities. She is hardworking and entrepreneurial. She supports her business and her family.

She has requested a loan to buy corn and birdseed. She is happy that her loan will be granted and is grateful to Kiva lenders for trusting in her. She agrees to repay on time.

loans.use: to buy corn and seed to feed her chickens

loans.name: Junela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Junela works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Junela is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Junela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a single woman, 54 years old with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Liberty has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liberty requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, flour and other materials for her food production business.

Liberty has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, flour and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 52 years old and married with one child, who is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

May has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Yoenis Luz

texts.es:
Yoenis es una mujer de 20 años de edad la cual se desempeña como madre amorosa y como agricultora, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres y es la cría y venta de cerdos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su.

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de cerdos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más cerdos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposo.

Apoya con un préstamo a una campesina del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Yoenis is a woman of 20 years who is a loving mother and a farmer. Her income is not enough to meet household expenses so she began her business in her spare time. Her business is the breeding, fattening, and sale of pigs that she does trying to improve her life conditions.

She has sought a loan for the purchase of pigs for this reason. She wants to improve her sales and increase her activity, taking more on in her micro-business and making it more visually appealing to customers because she will have more pigs to offer them.

Her main dream is to generate a good income so that her family does not want for necessities. For this very reason, she works tirelessly for her children and her husband.

Support a Colombian farmer with big dreams for her family!

loans.use: to purchase pigs to fatten and sell and grow her business

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is a single woman who has no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 40-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single income earner, her husband drives an auto rickshaw which is their single source of income.

She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total. Therefore, Shaheen wants a loan for her son so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her son, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for their family.

Shaheen hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional rickshaw for her son so he can also contribute to their daily income just like his father.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una mujer  de 28 años de edad es soltera con una familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 7 y 13 años, esta familia habita en una comunidad del caserío Xecac.
Francisca sabe que sin esfuerzo y sin dedicación es imposible superarse, por esa razón todo su empeño y toda su dedicación esta puesta en su actividad económica que es la producción de banano, ella lleva 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad.
Francisca con el afán de seguir prosperando se ha propuesto a comprar un terreno para aumentar su cultivo, ahora se le ha presentado la oportunidad pero su mayor obstáculo es no contar con suficiente capital, por esa razón acude a un préstamo para la compra de  terreno para cultivo. Su más grande anhelo es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is 28, single, and lives with her family of three children aged 7 to 13 years in the village community of Xecac.

Francisca know that it is impossible to succeed without effort and dedication, which is why all of her effort and dedication was necessary to start her business of producing bananas. She has grown bananas for eight years.

Francisca, in an effort to continue to thrive, has proposed to buy new land to increase her cropland. She has a chance but her biggest obstacle is not having enough capital. She has come to request a loan to purchase land for farming for that very reason. Her greatest wish is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase an acre of land for farming

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Esther's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. She hopes that in the future she will operate a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and has two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. Julius has been involved in this business for five years.

His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Julius will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items for his business. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 54 years old and married with three children. Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, chocolate drinks, etc. to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, chocolate drinks, etc.

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, cereals, coffee, chocolate drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 47 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elma has been in pig fattening for 15 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a 49-year-old married mother of five children, two still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Fe has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell in her stall.

Fe has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 46-year-old married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Gina has a buy-and-sell used shoes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old and has three children. Virginia is widowed and has one child still in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Virginia has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Lumière Group

texts.fr: Maheshe est commerçante, présidente du collectif de crédits «Lumière», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 42 ans, mère de 6 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 2 sont grands. Elle est vendeuse des pagnes dans un marché du bidonville depuis 7 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 5 pièces de pagnes. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite augmenter son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Maheshe is a retailer, president of the loan group "Lumière" [Light], and a client of the MFI Hekima. She is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of six children, of whom four are in school and two are grown up. She has sold pagnes [tradition cloth] in a shantytown market for seven years. 

She is going to stock up with five pieces of pagnes. She started her business with funds received from her husband. She wishes to increase her activity, and pay to school and feed her children. 

Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support it provides to "non bankable" business people.

loans.use: to stock up with five pieces of pagnes (traditional fabric).

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
