With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase a stock of trousers for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of trousers for resale.

loans.name: Alfredo De Jesus

texts.es:
El es Alfredo, un hombre de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.
El decidió por iniciar con un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace aproximadamente 8 años en una pequeña carreta. 
Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por las ventas, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar surtido de plátano, yucas y frutas en general.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.
Es un hombre que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a man of character and good will with the desire to progress and move forward with his family.

He decided to start a business selling fruits and vegetables about 8 years ago, from a small cart.

He learned how to do this through doing it, with the necessity and the pleasure in sales. This has allowed him to get a lot of experience.

Now he wishes to give a small boost to his business with the help of the Kiva lenders and the Corporacion Interactuar. For this reason he is requesting a loan to buy a supply of bananas, yucca and fruits in general.

With this loan he will be able to sustain his business and make it grow more every day.

Alfredo is a man who takes on challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: to buy supplies of bananas, yucca and fruits in general

loans.name: Alh. Ibrahim

texts.en:
Alh. Ibrahim is maize farmer from Chidau village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alh. Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
Alh. Ibrahim is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Efrain Natanahel

texts.es:
Efraín es un hombre de 34 años de edad es casado con una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 7 y 13 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.

Efraín para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja como sastre desde hace 10 años, gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio ha logrado ser un sastre muy reconocido.
Efraín  se ha esmerado mucho para poder darle a su familia un hogar más digno de ellos, a Dios gracias su casa ya está pero le hace falta balcones para las ventanas para que estén más seguro, pues la delincuencia a razado mucho en su comunidad, pero él en estos momentos no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder compararlos por esa razón a optado por solicitar un préstamo para la compra de los balcones.
Su esperanza es mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Efrain is a 34 year old man. He is married with a beautiful family and two children of 7 and 13 years of age. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

In order to generate income and get his family ahead, Efrain has worked as a tailor for 10 years. Thanks to his commitment to the business, he has managed to become a well known tailor.

Efrain has been diligent in order to give his family a more deserving home. Thanks to God his home is now ready but it is missing bars for the windows to make it safer since crime has risen a lot in his community. At this time he does not have enough money in order to buy them. For this reason, he has decided to request a loan in order to buy the bars.

His dream is to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy window bars for his home.

loans.name: Alh. Sani

texts.en:
Alhaji Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Vololonjanahary Andrianiaina

texts.fr:
Vololonjanahary vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé. Le crédit lui a permis de ravitailler les marchandises et les produits de vente. L'activité évolue et s'agrandir petit à petit.
Une tragédie s'est survenue au sein de la famille, elle vient de perdre un enfant, son ainé il y a 2 mois. L a déception de cette perte était très dur mais n'a quand-même pas bloqué le déroulement de son activité, Elle a pu se réapprovisionner en plus, ne parlons que la hausse des clients à la campagne. Elle est en pleine amélioration du lieu de stockage de ses produits car c'est la saison des pluies, au risque de la montée des eaux.
texts.en: Vololonjanahary says thank you very much for the loan you granted her. The loan enabled her to renew her merchandise and products for sale. Her business is improving and expanding little by little. A tragedy arose within her family. She just lost a son, her oldest, two months ago. The disappointment from this loss was very difficult but nevertheless did not stop her business progressing. She was able to restock up, not to mention a rise in customers in the countryside. She is in the middle of improving her stockroom of products, since the rainy season is here, and rising waters are a risk.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of dried fish

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
For the past 4 years, Alma has been engaged in a direct selling business like MSE (a direct sales brand), selling footwear, bags and clothing. In addition to that, she also raises hogs.

She is married and has one young dependent. She resides in Talibon, Bohol.

She would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to finance her current source of living.

Alma has requested a loan to purchase various MSE products and pig feed. These could help boost her income and continue to help her improve and become productive.

loans.use: to purchase various MSE products and pig feed.

loans.name: Carmen Claudia

texts.es:
Carmen es una joven mujer de 20 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de fruta por menor.
Ella es independiente, alegre y muy divertida. Su negocio lo realiza en la populosa zona ‘Max Paredes’ caracterizada por concentrar varias fiestas patronales y eventos culturales, además es el sitio de desarrollo de una intensa actividad comercial, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Carmen es de tez morena, baja estatura y cabello negro y largo, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su tía que trabaja, sus padres fallecieron, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de fruta al menudeo, ella compra fruta fresca por mayor y la vende por menor y por peso, de forma ambulante y en su puesto de venta al aire libre, “mi tía me ayudó a independizarme y tener mi negocio propio tras la muerte de mis padres…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque la jornada laboral dura todo el día y la fruta se vende diariamente. La ventaja de su negocio es que la fruta se vende al día, la desventaja es la falta de un puesto de venta para poder trabajar en un lugar fijo. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y estabilizarlo para un futuro mejor, ella desea comprar un kiosco para vender fruta en un lugar fijo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carmen solicita un préstamo para comprar un kiosco para vender fruta en un puesto fijo.
texts.en:
Carmen is a young woman, 20 years old, single, and without children. Her business is selling fruit at retail.

She is independent, happy, and funny. Her business is located in the popular “Max Paredes” zone, characterized by its regular patron saint celebrations and cultural events, not to mention the development of a busy commercial sector. The climate is cold and dry with a maximum temperature of 12 degrees Celsius.

Carmen has a dark complexion, short stature, and long black hair. She speaks Aymara, her native language, with her family and speaks Spanish for the sake of her business and the general culture. She shares her life with her aunt, who also works. Her parents passed away, and she and her aunt live in a rented room constructed of adobe, which has potable water, electric energy, and a sewage system.

Her business is selling fruit at retail. She buys fresh fruit at wholesale, then sells it by weight at retail. She is a traveling saleswoman and has a regular spot out in the open. “My aunt helped me to become independent and have my own business after the death of my parents,” she says. Her business is successful because she works all day and sells fruit daily. The advantage of her business is being able to sell daily; the disadvantage is not having a stand where she can sell from a fixed location. Her dream is to improve her business and set herself up for a better future. She wants to buy a kiosk to be able to sell from a fixed location. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 5 years she has been in business.

For these reasons, Carmen is asking for a loan to buy a kiosk to be able to sell fruit from a fixed location.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk to be able to sell fruit from a fixed location.

loans.name: Zuhrokhon

texts.en:
Zuhrokhon is a kind and smart woman. She was born in 1988 year. Zuhrokhon is not married and lives with her parents. Zuhrokhon is a higher educated person and she has worked more than 4 years in a state organization, as an accountant. She knows her position well and has a good knowledge.

Zuhrokhon is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy medicines because she is ill. She really needs your kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.en: Tranquilina finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 57 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for healthier, heavier and more produce. In the future, Tranquilina wishes to become the supplier of rice grains in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing & harrowing and purchase of good variety of seedlings for more produce

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour, soap, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap, flour, rice and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, soap, flour, rice and other items

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jesusa is 56 years old and has one child still in school.

Jesusa has a personal care business in the Philippines. Jesusa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products like beauty soap, perfume, underwear, body lotion and other personal care products.

Jesusa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products like beauty soap, perfume, underwear, body lotion and other personal care products.

loans.name: Lovilla

texts.en:
Lovilla is 38 years old, with one child.

Lovilla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Lovilla has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from videoke rentals.

Lovilla aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: May Ann

texts.en:
May Ann is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. May Ann is 34 years old and has one child in school.

May Ann has a fish vending business in the Philippines. May Ann requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

May Ann has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, May Ann would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Franny

texts.en:
Franny is 30 years old and married with one child. Franny works very hard to provide for them.

Franny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products.

Franny has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Franny would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Ma. Marlyn

texts.en:
Ma. Marlyn is a 37-year-old married mother of eight children, four in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Marlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Marlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell .

Ma. Marlyn has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Ma. Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Luna works hard to support her family. She has a pig-raising business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF for her pig-raising business, to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Luna has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Maedie

texts.en:
Maedie is 26 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like biscuits, bread, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Maedie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, bread, snack foods, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 45 years old, married with four children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Myrna aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent and school fees.

Jackline has operated a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition in her place of operation. In addition she also operates a food kiosk that earns her another source of income.


With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Kakada

texts.en:
A 20-year-old single man, Kakada is a resident living in Chhuk district of Kampot province. Nowadays, he has been involved in his parents’ business, growing oranges and bananas for sale, for about two years. He also raises cows to earn additional income to support the family.

Unfortunately, his crop could not grow well since it was threatened by insects and having not enough working capital to pay for labor costs. Besides this, Kakada is a university student who is pursuing his studies in a specific major of marketing.

This is the first loan cycle for him with VisionFund, and he is willing to use this loan to pay for his tuition fees in order to complete his skill and pave the way for him to get a good job.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees in order to complete his studies in a specific major of marketing.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with four school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

She operates a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of competition and seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas (women's wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Marie Claire

texts.fr:
Marie Claire est une femme sérieuse dans la vie. Elle a 41 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 5 enfants à la campagne. Elle cultive essentiellement du riz, de la pomme de terre, des haricots et du maïs. Elle fait aussi de l’élevage bovin.
Elle a déjà pris plusieurs prêts chez Vahatra pour renforcer son activité d’élevage bovin. Pour ce prêt, elle compte cultiver de la pomme de terre. Pour cela, elle va acheter des semences et des engrais. 
La récolte se tiendra au bout de 3 mois. Marie Claire vendra sa récolte au grand marché. Elle économisera les bénéfices afin de pouvoir faire face aux imprévus.
texts.en:
Marie Claire is a serious woman in life. She is 41 years old and lives in the country with her husband and five children. She cultivates mainly rice, potatoes, beans and maize. She also breeds cattle.

She has already taken several loans at Vahatra to strengthen her cattle-breeding activity. This loan will serve to cultivate potatoes, and be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizer.

Harvesting will take place after three months. Marie Claire will sell her crop at the main market. She will save the profits to be able to deal with contingencies.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.en:
Rukhshona is a young and hardworking woman. She was born in 1997. Rukhshona lives with her parents. Their house is located in a village, but Rukhshona goes to town every day because she is a student and she studies at the university. Rukhshoan is a student of the first course. She studies well and dreams to be a useful specialist in the future.

Rukhshona helps to her mother in animal husbandry. She is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To pay for the university tuition

loans.name: Orm

texts.en:
As a farmer from Cheung Prey District, Kampong Cham Province, Orm, who is 36 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. She is a hardworking mother of three children.

She can earn approximately 5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than 10 years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Orm is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.

So she hopes that this requirement will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable her increase production. Her business goal is to be a large scale farmer within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable her increase productio

loans.name: Elven

texts.en:
Elven is a 37-year-old man from Catigbian, Bohol. He is married with two children. The oldest is 12 years old, while the youngest is 11 years old. He does charcoal selling to support them. He has been doing this for almost seven years.

Aside from selling charcoal, he and his wife are engaged in basket making. For this, he is asking for a loan to buy coconut shells, which are processed to make charcoal. The other part of his requested amount is to buy raw materials for baskets; specifically, they use rattan stems. (Rattan is a tropical palm.)

In the future, Elven wants to improve his family's livelihood to give them a better and more comfortable means of living.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells and rattan stems.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a tricycle (rickshaw) operator. She earns based on renting the vehicle. She is a married woman and has four children, of whom three are still attending school.

Her husband has also an income that helps support the needs of the entire family.

She is asking for a loan to buy motorcycle equipment and purchase school supplies. This will help to promote the safety of the passengers that are transported. In this way, she will be able to increase the revenue and invest in other sources of income so that she can become sustainable.

In the future, she is hoping that she will become successful in her chosen field.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle equipment and purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Phaminus

texts.en:
Phaminus is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes, kale, spinach and other crops. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big farm. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 42 years old and widowed with three children. With two of her children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell, like bread, beverages, juice, snack foods, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like bread, beverages, juice, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 54 years old and married with four children.

Alita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Alita has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Alita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Luzbella

texts.en:
Luzbella is 51 years old and married with four children, two of whom are presently in school. Luzbella works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products.

Luzbella has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, eggs, breads, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn supports the family through her pig fattening business in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Jonalyn with her son Jhonrie who is 17 years old and is the only child in the family.

Jonalyn is borrowing 5,160 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Jhonrie who is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. Jhonrie is currently in his first year of this four-year course.

When he graduates, Jhonrie plans to be a programmer and help his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is 49 years old and lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for many years and is expert in his trade.

He uses tools such as a brick trowel, buttering trowel, pointing trowel, hammer, chisel, jointer, chisel and level. His tools have been wearing out.

He wants to buy new tools to continue his construction services but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy these tools.

Therefore, Kubra has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; so that her husband can buy tools for construction.

Kubra thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy construction tools for her husband's masonry services.

loans.name: Msangani Group

texts.en:
Sina, who is in her late 30's, is single and has three children. Two are still in school and one is still small. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the food stock and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of the group, which is doing fine. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy food ingredients like rice, sugar, beans, flours, meat, etc. for the food business. She dreams of becoming an international business women.

Sina will share this loan with her loan group, Msangani, which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients like rice, sugar, beans, flours, meat, etc. for the food business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a Kiva borrower. He has four children. He describes himself as faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items.

He has been involved in this business for 18 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

This is Julius' fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items to sell, and he will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

He hopes that in the future, he will further expand the business. His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, bread, soap, flour, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Elliys

texts.en: Elliys is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and handbags. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely is a single woman; she is 63 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nely has a food vending business in the Philippines. Nely requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as bread, flour, milk, fruits, and other materials for her food production business.

Nely has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as bread, flour, milk, fruits, and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Anna Fe

texts.en:
Anna Fe is 29 years old and has three children. Anna Fe is married and has one child in school.

Anna Fe is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Anna Fe requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Anna Fe has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anna Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with three children, all of whom are still too young to attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo pues a sus 53 años de edad trabaja incasablemente de jueves a domingo en su negocio de bar.
Madre de 5 hijos que depende totalmente de ella ve una oportunidad de una entidad que le brinda la confianza de tener un crédito para mejorar su negocio.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido de cervezas, gaseosas, sillas y mesas. 

Con la ayuda de este crédito la señora Martha podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Martha is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. Though she is 53 years old, she works tirelessly from Thursday to Sunday in her bar.

A mother to 5 children who entirely depend on her, she sees an opportunity from an organization which will give her the security of being able to take out a loan to improve her business.

She is asking for a loan to buy a variety of beers, sodas, chairs, and tables.

With the help of this loan, Ms. Martha will be able to offer a better service.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beers, sodas, chairs, and tables.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman and has been blessed with four children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over six years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan, her two children, and her husband live in Azatamut village of Tavush region. With a Bachelor's degree from the university, Ruzan has already been involved for many years in farming. The family's income comes from selling milk, cheese, meat, eggs, and other products gathered from their farm.

To be able to add to the family's livestock, Ruzan requested this loan. She plans to purchase a sow, three piglets, and forage for feeding the livestock so as to sustain the farm.

Ruzan and her whole family will be grateful to receive lenders' support and improve their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for a sow, three piglets, and forage for feeding the livestock to sustain the farm.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two daughters and three sons.

She has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. In fact, her husband remains jobless most of the time and unable to generate income. To cherish her children and to meet household expenses, she started embroidery at home. A supplier comes to her home and provides her with all the raw materials for knitting embroidery; she, along with her daughters, completes her tasks over a wooden frame.

She wants to sells knitted embroidery directly in the market so that she can earn more profit for her family. She has become expert in her arts and wants to buy raw material of her own so that she can sell her handmade embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Saima has requested a Kiva loan to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can knit more embroidered dresses to sell and could generate maximum income. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw material and wooden frames so she can knit more embroidered dresses to sell and can generate maximum income.

loans.name: Jean Chrysostome

texts.fr:
Jean Chrysostome est un jeune homme intègre de 36 ans. Il vit avec sa femme et ses 4 enfants à la campagne ou il pratique l’agriculture.
Il est emprunteur chez Vahatra depuis 2 ans. Les prêts d’avant lui ont permis d’augmenter le capital à utiliser dans l’agriculture. Il a pu acheter une charrette avec les bénéfices. Pour ce prêt, il va acheter cultiver de la pomme de terre. Il va acheter des semences et des produits phytosanitaires. 
Jean Chrysostome se bat dans la vie pour offrir un bel avenir à ses 4 enfants.
texts.en:
John Chrysostome is a 36-year-old man of integrity. He lives with his wife and four children in the country where he is a farmer.

He has borrowed from Vahatra for the past two years. The previous loans enabled him to increase his capital for use in farming and he was able to buy a cart with the profits. This loan will be used to grow potatoes: he will buy seedlings and pesticides.

John Chrysostome is struggling in life to provide a bright future to his four children.

loans.use: buy seedlings and pesticides to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is a 24-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task. Now her husband has just started to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike).

This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to stand the jerks over the roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto rickshaw.

Zakiya has requested a loan so that her husband can buy the moto rickshaw body and drive it smoothly.

Zakiya thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new moto rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He started doing agriculture (livestock farming and crop growing) three years ago. He likes his occupation so much because he likes to feel his independence.

He cooperates with his siblings to rear animals and also look after the livestock and also cultivate vegetables. This helps him to collect enough money to be able to pay tuition for the sibblings.

Today he is applying for a loan from UGAFODE to purchase baby goats that he will graze and later sell at a profit. He is very positive about the future and is optimistic this will improve his livelihood and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy baby goats.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is married and she has one child. She has been involved in a business activity for a few years. She started her business with her own working capital.

Her business is selling fried bread. And she is always selling around the village. So she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional materials such as cooking oils, wheat, bananas and fix her wagon.

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so as to be big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, wheat, bananas and fix her wagon.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, 47 years old, is a farmer on a rice field that is far away from her house. She is a mother of three children, one married. Her husband is also a farmer. They can only make 5 USD per day to support their family. Saran resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 10 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standard. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a resident of the town of Talibon. She is married and has two children.

She raises and sells hogs. She works hard to support the needs of her family. Aside from hog raising, she also engages in fishing. Nida also sells rice on a retail basis, serving neighbors in her place.

She needs funds to support her existing project, but the main problem is the lack of capital to expand. Nida has requested a loan to buy pig feed, fishing materials like fishing net and fuel, and stock of rice. These would boost her income, and she would continue to seek ways to become more successful.

Nida is hoping that someday she will become more sustainable and be able to finance her children's respective studies.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, fishing materials like fishing net and fuel, and stock of rice.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matthew is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of wood.

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more timber for making furniture. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will save the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy more timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a farm where she grows maize, french beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climate changes.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman, 47 years old with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Marites has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her stall.

Marites has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en:
Yowasi is a 45-year-old hardworking married man, a committed father who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He looks after ten dependents and runs a retail shop which is always open throughout the week.

He supplements his retail shop with farming and coffee selling to earn extra income with an intention of improving the standards of living for his family. His dream is to move to a wholesale superstore so as to earn more income in order to educate all his children, equip them with skills that can also help them sustain themselves but his main challenge is inadequate capital.

He wishes to use the loan facility to buy more soap, cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr: Antoinette est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Confiance», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 30 ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des récipients plastics au marché de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en une douzaine de bassins et des seaux en plastics. Elle débuta par le premier fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en: Antoinette is a merchant, a member of the 'banc villageois' named “Confiance”, and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. Aged 30, she is the married mother of five children, of whom four are students, and one is still very young. For ten years, Antoinette has been selling plastic containers at the town market. She is going to stock up with a dozen plastic tubs and buckets. Her wish is to grow her business and provide schooling and food for her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with a dozen plastic tubs and buckets.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a school business for the past five years, offering education to children .She mentioned competition as a major challenge in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase books and furniture for her school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her little school.

loans.use: to purchase books and furniture for her school.

loans.name: Josefina Beatriz

texts.es:
Josefina, es madre de tres hijos, solo su hija menor de 10 años de edad vive con ella, ya asiste a la escuela, ella es casada, comenta que junto a su esposo ha compartido la felicidad de tener un hogar, cuando formo su propia familia busco la forma de ser un apoyo para su esposo y así juntos salir adelante, su fuente de ingresos es administrar una tienda de productos de la canasta básica y una venta de antojitos típicos como: pasteles, tostadas de plátanos, enredos, etc., aprendió a cocinarlos mientras ayudaba a su madre en el negocio que ella tenía, posteriormente con las ganancias pudo fundar la tienda.
Requiere de un financiamiento para poder mejorar su negocio, comprara huevos, lácteos, bebidas, golosinas, etc., para tener una tienda con más mercadería, además invertirá en leña para preparar la venta de antojitos, el objetivo de Josefina es aprovechar que en los próximos meses se celebran las fiestas patronales de su localidad y las de fin de año, de esta manera podrá tener mayores ingresos para cumplir con sus responsabilidades.
Su sueño es tener una situación financiera más estable para reparar su vivienda y así darle a su familia una vida más confortable y feliz.
texts.en:
Josefina is a mother of three children. Only her youngest daughter, 10 years old, lives with her and is already in school. She is married and notes that along with her husband, they have shared in the joy of having a home. When she formed her own family, she sought out a way to support her husband and to get ahead together. Her source of income comes from running a store for basic necessities and from selling traditional appetizers like pasteles (savory stuffed pastry), plantain chips, enredos (fried yucca in threads), etc. She learned how to cook these while she helped her mother at the business that she had. She was then able to open her store with her earnings..

She needs a loan in order to improve her business. She will buy eggs, dairy products, drinks, sweets, etc. in order to have a store with more merchandise. She will also invest in firewood to prepare for selling appetizers. Josefina’s goal is to take advantage of the local patron saint and end of the year celebrations in the following months. In this way, she will be able to have better earnings for fulfilling her responsibilities.

Her dream is to have a more stable financial situation in order to repair her home, thus giving her family a more comfortable and happy life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, dairy products, drinks, sweets, etc. in order to have a store with more merchandise. She will also invest in firewood to prepare for selling appetizers.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima’s husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and pays a daily rent because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing older and their needs have increased. He has been worried for many days about how to avoid paying the daily rent and has decided to buy his own rickshaw.

Saima has been saving for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing she did not have enough money. Therefore, Saima has requested a loan so that her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of their savings.

Saima is a 35-year-old woman, living with her three children and her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because now he will not pay daily rent to anyone.

She is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to add to their savings to buy a new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children.

Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her her husband can buy gents' shoes for his shoe store. He has been selling shoes for many years. He has been selling ladies fancy and casual shoes in his hometown. Most of his customers demand gents' shoes as well, but due to lack of availability of funds, he can not purchase gents' shoes.

Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan so her husband can buy a variety of gents' shoes for reselling purposes. In this way, he can easily cope with the demand and abstain from the customers' disappointment. His shop is situated in the shoe market and lot of other shoe stores are available there, which becomes the cause of tough competition. He dreams of moving his shop to another place to abstain from the competitors.

Through the investment of the current loan, he can easily establish his shoe store and can enhance his savings so his dream can come true.

Farzana thanks Kiva, honorable lenders and the field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy gents' shoes for her husband's shoe store.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Michel est un jeune homme vaillant de 30 ans. C’est un paysan spécialiste en culture de pomme de terre et d’élevage de vache laitière. Il est marié et élève 2 enfants. 
Il a déjà pris plusieurs prêts chez Vahatra, ce qui lui a permis de louer beaucoup de terrains cultivables. Pour ce prêt, il compte acheter de la nourriture et de la provende pour sa vache laitière. Il y a un grand potentiel  quant au marché du lait. 
Les bénéfices vont servir à améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Michel is a courageous 30-year-old man. He is a farmer specializing in growing potatoes and breeding dairy cows. He is married and is raising two children.

He has already taken several loans with Vahatra, which enabled him to rent a lot of arable land. For this loan, he intends to buy food and provender for his dairy cow.

There is a great potential regarding the milk market. Profits will be used to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy food and provender for his dairy cow

loans.name: Sahidi Liliana

texts.es:
La Joven Sahidi  es una persona trabajadora y dedicada al negocio propio,  el cual es la venta de abarrotería actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, vende pollo, manteca, arroz, salsa, harina, huevos, churros, refrescos, etc. este negocio lo atiende todos los días de manera personal.
Sahidi  también cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos el cual es horneado de rosquillas, actividad que realiza 3 veces por semana, junto a su hermano atiende este negocio y las ventas las realiza en aldeas cercanas al lugar donde vive, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pollo, manteca, arroz, jabón espaguetis, refrescos y también ingredientes para la elaboración de rosquillas, espera que esta inversión le permita poder salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Sahidi sueña con graduarse y seguir manteniendo la pulpería bien surtida para lograr obtener bastantes ventas.

Danli, Honduras - Octubre del 2015
texts.en:
Sahidi is a hard working young woman dedicated to her own business. She has been selling groceries for 4 years. She sells chicken, lard, rice, sauce, flour, eggs, "churros" (pastries), beverages, etc. and she personally takes care of the business.

Sahidi has another source of income which comes from baking pastries. She does this 3 times a week with her brother. They sell to the communities nearby.

She is requesting the loan to purchase chicken, lard, rice, soap, pasta, beverages and also ingredients to bake the pastries. She hopes that this financing will allow her to get ahead and improve her quality of life. Sahidi's dream is to graduate and to maintain the grocery store well stocked to have enough sales.

Danli, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to purchase chicken, lard, rice, soap, pasta, beverages and condiments for her business.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a married man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business even more.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Ceferina is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ceferina is 48 years old now.

Ceferina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ceferina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, meat, spices, etc.

Ceferina has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Ceferina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, fish, meat, spices.

loans.name: Norma Lorena

texts.es:
Norma en la actualidad se encuentra acompañada y es madre de dos hijos, junto a su pareja trabajan para salir adelante, ella es muy reconocida por ser una mujer trabajadora y honrada, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y a elaborar antojitos para vender, junto a su pareja trabajan en las actividades agrícolas y por las tardes se dedica a cocinar los antojitos para luego salir a venderlos en el caserío, por su experiencia en la administración de su negocio no representa dificultades.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono para que sus cultivos se desarrollen mejor y le den una cosecha abundante, así como también verduras para elaborar la venta de antojitos, con la inversión pretende tener un inventario surtido para que su negocio se mantenga en el mercado y así seguir aportando a los gastos de su familia.
Las aspiraciones son que sus cosechas sean mejores para lograr tener estabilidad económica y darle a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
texts.en:
Norma is in a relationship and is the mother of two children. Together with her partner, they work in order to move forward. She is very well-known for being an honest and hard-working woman. She works growing staple foods and making "antojitos" [popular corn-based dishes such as tamales, tacos, tlacoyos and tortas] to sell. She and her partner work in agriculture, and in the afternoons she works cooking the antojitos to go out selling them later in the village. Due to her experience in managing her business, it does not pose any difficulties for her.

The loan is needed to buy manure so that the crops can develop better and give an abundant harvest, as well as for vegetables for making the antojitos to sell. With the investment, she will try to have an assorted inventory in order to maintain her business in the market and thus continue providing for the family expenses.

Norma's aspiration is for better harvests in order to be able to have economic stability and to give her family a more decent life style.

loans.use: to buy manure so that her crops can develop better and give an abundant harvest, as well as vegetables for making"antojitos" [popular corn-based dishes such as tamales, tacos, tlacoyos and tortas] to sell

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr: Kalivanda est un entrepreneur, vendeuse des tricots dans la rue de la ville, présidente  du groupe de crédits «Faida», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée 38 ans, mère de 3 enfants tous étudient. Elle va s’approvisionner en cent tricots. Il y a 14 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité, avec le premier capital reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Kalivanda is an entrepreneur, a street vendor of knitted clothing in town, and the president of the loan group “Faida”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is a widow, 38 years old, and the mother of three children, all in school. Kalivanda is going to stock up with 100 knitted items.

For fourteen years, she operated this business with initial capital from her husband, when he was still living. Her wish is to grow her business and educate her children. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked entrepreneurs. We really wish to indicate that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to stock up with a hundred knitted items

loans.name: Usiano Group

texts.fr: Hadidja est une entrepreneuse, propriétaire d’un atelier de couture, trésorière du groupe de crédits «Usiano», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 54 ans et mère de douze enfants parmi eux, 4 étudient et 8 n’étudient plus. Elle va acheter un tissus de couturer pour renforcer ses activités. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son fils depuis 10 ans. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
Hadidja is an entrepreneur, owner of a tailor shop, treasurer of the "Usiano" loan group, and client of the Hekima MFI. She is a 54-year-old married mother of twelve children, of whom four attend school and eight no longer study.

She will buy sewing fabric to reinforce her activities. She started her business with funds provided by her son ten years ago. Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: buy sewing fabric

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 40-year-old woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Divina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Medy requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, meat, spices and other materials for her food production business. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Medy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, meat, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Spandaryan village with her husband and son. She is a teacher by profession, with a Master's degree in pedagogy. She works at the local village school.

All of her time after work, Gohar devotes to the farm. The income from it is very important for the family to cover daily costs.

Gohar and her husband keep 3 piglets, hens and cultivate potato, carrot and beta which they sell at the local markets.

To be able to invest in her farm and develop it, Gohar requested this loan. She plans to purchase potato seeds and pressed forage for the livestock, and to cover transportation costs from the baazar to the farm.

She will be very grateful to receive lenders' faith and improve her farm.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and pressed forage for the livestock, and to cover transportation costs from the bazaar to the farm.

loans.name: Cefora Rosa

texts.es:
Con la comercialización de ropa, Cefora ha podido construir una vida junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos.
Esta actividad viene ejerciéndola hace poco tiempo y la aprendió a través de una amiga.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa para surtir su inventario y aumentar su capital de trabajo, pues con este negocio es que pagara la educación de sus hijos y mejorara su vivienda.
texts.en:
By selling clothing in the market, Cefora has been able to build up a life with her husband and three children. She has been practicing the trade for a little while, which she learned about through a friend.

She is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of clothing to supply her inventory with and increase her capital, since her business is how she will pay for her children’s education and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothing to supply her inventory with and increase her capital.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
Félix es un hombre muy trabajador y honesto, tiene cincuenta años de edad y es padre de siete hijos, a los cuales ha logrado ayudar gracias a su negocio de venta de abarrotes y productos para el hogar, este hombre luchador ha logrado fortalecer su negocio y por ende ha crecido como comerciante. 
Esta temporada del año es crucial para Felix, por eso ha decido solicitar un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCredito con el que abastecerá su puesto, podra comprar productos como: detergentes, desinfectante para pisos, jabones, shampoo, entre otros que sus clientes siempre demandan. En un futuro el desea hacer de su negocio una distribuidora importante del mercado donde los oferta.
texts.en:
Félix is a very hardworking and honest man. He is 50 years old and is the father of seven children who he has been able to support thanks to his groceries and home goods business. This strong willed man has been able to grow his business and therefore has grown as a businessman.

This time of year is crucial for Félix, which is why he decided to request a loan from Kiva along with MiCredito, with which he will stock his store with products such as detergents, disinfectants for floors, soaps, shampoo, and other things that the customers ask for. In the future he wants to make his business a major distributor in the market he fulfills.

loans.use: to buy products for his store including detergents, disinfectant for floors, soaps, shampoo, among other things.

loans.name: Coralia Del Carmen

texts.es: Coralia de 54 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida quien es su compañía y su apoyo para sobrevivir el día con día. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar se dedica a la venta  de platillos típicos como lo son: pasteles, pasteles de plátano, atol, tamales de gallina, de cerdo, tamales de elote, además de eso sale a vender ropa interior, blusas, faldas y ropa de niño. Se esfuerza a diario para que en el hogar no le falte nada. Coralia en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, láminas, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra para encementar el piso y la pared del corredor y reparar el techo. De esta manera mejorar considerablemente su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Coralia is 54 years old, and lives with her life partner who is her companion and support to survive day by day. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who, to cover household expenses, makes a living selling traditional dishes such as cakes, banana cakes, gruel, tamales made of chicken, pork or corn. In addition, she travels to sell underwear, blouses, skirts, and children's clothing. She continuously strives to provide everything for her home. In search for a better quality of life, Coralia is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, metal, bricks and labor payment for cementing the floor and the hallways, as well as repairing the roof. With this she can considerably improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, metal, bricks and labor payment for cementing the floor and the hallways, as well as repairing the roof.

loans.name: Claudia Jamileth

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de platos típicos, actividad que lleva realizando desde hace 2 años frente a su vivienda. Ella tiene 25 años de edad y vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 2 años de edad. Claudia desea mejorar el área del lavadero, ya que actualmente no cuenta con protección, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para instalar techo en el área del lavadero.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hardworking woman who earns a living selling traditional food in front of her home, she's done this work for two years. She is 25 and lives with her life partner and two-year-old son.

Claudia would like to improve the laundry area which is currently unprotected, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire in order to put up a roof in this area.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to install a roof for laundry area.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha is a Kiva borrower. She has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, rice, salt, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

This is Jerusha's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina and her family live in a small town of Catigbian, Bohol. She is a 41-year-old married woman and has six children. The oldest child is 19 years old while the youngest child is five years old.

Her husband works hard as a farmer while Marcelina is engaged in basket making. She has been doing this business for 2 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy raw materials for making baskets. Specifically, she will use rattan stem (rattan is a tropical palm) and bamboo stem.

Aside from this, she also plans to buy piglets and feed. Definitely, she plans to start a hog raising business.

In the future, Marcelina is determined to improve their livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy rattan stem (rattan is a tropical palm) and bamboo stem; also piglets and feed.

loans.name: Emily Beth

texts.en:
Emily Beth is 22 years old, married, and she has two children who are presently in school.

Emily Beth is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emily Beth has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Eljin

texts.en:
Eljin is 29 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Eljin requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Eljin has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Eljin would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lantoniaina Angeline

texts.fr:
Lantoniaina est une femme mariée de 31 ans. Elle est mère de trois enfants dont leurs âges respectifs sont de 10, 8 et 5 ans et elle est enceinte du quatrième. Ces trois enfants sont tous scolarisés. Elle est une femme débrouillarde et indépendante, ne se contente pas du salaire de son mari qui est dans l'armée.
Elle démarre un petit commerce de "kafé sy mofo" en juillet 2015.  Le magasin général reste toujours son activité principale. Le "kafé sy mofo" était déjà familier car étant petite ses parents exploitaient l'activité.
A part la réussite de leurs enfants, le couple espère aussi la mutation de leur terrain à leur nom, car ceci est encore un domaine de l’État.
texts.en:
Lantoniaina is a 31-year-old married mother to three children aged five, eight, and 10 years old. She is currently pregnant with her fourth child. Her three children are all currently attending school.

She is a hard-working, independent woman who is dissatisfied with her husband's salary, who is in the army. She started a small "Kafé sy mofo" (Coffee and Cake) business in July 2015. Her general store remains her main business. She is familiar with the "Kafé sy mofo" trade since her parents used to run a similar venture.

In addition to ensuring their children's future success, the couple hopes to be able to purchase the plot of land they live on and make it their own, as it currently belongs to the State.

loans.use: to purchase Malagasy rice flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Умедчону аз района Файзабад 25 лет. Он женат и имеет двухлетнюю дочь. Умедчон работает на двух местах, чтобы прокормить семью. Умедчон и работает и дома еще учится. У него заочное форма обучения. Он хочет стать бухгалтером и учится, чтобы осуществить свою мечту. Обучение Умедчон является платной скоро необходимо внести оплату за еще один год обучения. Для оплаты годового обучения Умедчон просит кредит.
texts.en: Umedjon is 25 and from the Fayzabad region. He is married and has a two-year-old daughter. He works in two places to feed his family. He works and he is also a student, studying from home via distance learning. He wants to become an accountant and is studying to achieve his dream. He needs to pay his tuition soon for another year of school and he is requesting a loan to do so.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is 31 years old, married, and blessed with four children aged between 10 and 4 years old.

She has been into her tea and vegetable selling business for eight years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.8,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more tea and vegetables for resale in the village, as she anticipates helping her husband to pay school fees for their children from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to have a stable profit-making business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tea seedlings and fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Yolonimo

texts.en:
Yolonimo is a hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening alongside crop farming and has been doing this kind of farming for over fifteen years, intending to increase his earnings.

In the future, he plans to buy more land to enable him expand his farm, but the challenges of little capital and unpredictable weather changes have not favored his work plan. He has requested a loan to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to add to his farm.

loans.name: Marion Dardanes

texts.es:
Marion es una mujer muy creativa y llena de energía, a sus treinta y ocho años de edad, ha logrado hacer de su negocio de elaboración de piñatas y otras manualidades algo importante. Aunque a lo largo de su camino como comerciante se le han presentado dificultades ella no ha desistido y ha seguido siempre poniendo lo mejor, gracias a que MiCrédito y Kiva confiaron en ella un financiamiento, esta mujer pudo fortalecer su negocio y crecer como emprendedora. 
Esta temporada del año, donde todos están de fiesta por navidad, Marion debe esmerarse en elaborar piñatas y adornos acorde a la temporada, es por eso que ha solicitado a Kiva junto a MiCrédito un financiamiento que le permita abastecerse de materiales y comprar pinturas, papel decorativo, aplicaciones, escarche, lentejuelas, cintas de colores, pegamento, entre otras muchas cosas que ella usa como materia prima. En un futuro desea abrir una fábrica de piñatas.
texts.en:
Marion is a very creative woman and full of energy. At 38 years old, she has managed to render her business making piñatas and other handicrafts into something important. Although she has been presented with difficulties throughout her journey as a merchant, she has not stopped and has continued putting her best forward. Thanks to MiCrédito and Kiva for trusting her with a loan, this woman has been able to strengthen her business and grow as an entrepreneur.

This time of the year, where everyone is celebrating Christmas, Marion should strive to make piñatas and seasonally appropriate decorations. This is why she has requested a loan from Kiva and MiCrédito that will allow her to restock materials and to buy paints, decorative paper, reinforcement, candy, sequins, colored ribbons and glue, among many other things that she uses for raw materials. In the future she wishes to open a piñata factory.

loans.use: to buy paints, decorative paper, reinforcement, candy, sequins, colored ribbons and glue, among others.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is a 46-year-old hardworking married man with six children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. All his children attend school. Lawrence also takes care of other eight dependents because they are orphans.

He is a crop grower and he especially grows bananas and coffee to earn income. Apart from farming, he also grazes goats and he loves this work.

He has a vision of expanding his gardens to a modern farm which he believes can increase his household income to help him pay school fees for his children and also have improved living standards.

All his dreams are hindered by inadequate capital. He requests a loan which he will use to buy manure to apply on his banana and coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure to apply on his banana and coffee plantation.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es  una mujer digna de admirarse porque se esfuerza para darle a su familia lo necesario, ella cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo comprar sus insumos agrícolas y a Dios gracias una buena cosecha obtuvo, ella está contenta con este avance mas no conforme, pues ahora está necesitada  de un nuevo préstamo que en esta ocasión lo invertirá nuevamente en el cultivo de tomillo, pues este cultivo ha marchado muy bien que ahora es necesario  comprar  más insumos agrícolas para  lograr una buena cosecha al final del año
Su más grande anhelo es lograr que su cultivo crezca y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is a woman worth admiring because she strives to provide for her family. She says that thanks to her last loan which allowed her to buy agricultural goods, and thanks to God she obtained a good harvest. She is happy with this development, but is not settling, as now she needs a new loan to invest in the cultivation of thyme, as this crop has gone so well that she now needs to buy more agricultural inputs to achieve a good harvest at the end of the year.

Isabel's greatest wish is to get her crop to grow and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural goods.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is 43 years old. She is a responsible mother of three children and is living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an old member of Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan; she has been taking loans according to the needs of her family.

She belongs to a poor family, and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses with poor earnings. In fact, her husband is a hawker by profession and sells many kinds of hair oils from his bicycle.

He sells mustard oil, avocado oil, castor oil, coconut oil, olive oil, rosemary oil, safflower oil, etc. He calls loudly to the consumers in the streets to offer all of these hair oils, which are famous for protecting hair from falling out.

He wants to buy a large quantity of hair oil to sell for the growth of his business and to overcome their poverty. Therefore, Nusrat requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy a greater quantity of hair oil.

Nusrat is very impressed with this honorable support. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of hair oil such as olive oil, rosemary oil, etc. for her husband's oil selling business.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José de 22 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora, reside en vivienda propia y para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas presta sus servicios en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad, y en los días que tiene libre labora en una panadería para poder obtener otro ingreso a su economía. José en busca de mejorar su estilo de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: dos puertas, cuatro ventanas y pago de mano de obra para la instalación en su hogar. De esta forma poder estar más tranquilo y seguro en su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 22 years old, is a hard working person. He lives in his own home and in order to cover his basic needs, he works at a business located near his community. On his free days, he works in a bakery in order to obtain another addition to his finances.

José, seeking to improve his quality of life, is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: two doors, four windows and to pay the labor costs for installing them in his home. In this way, he can be safer and more relaxed in his home.
