loans.use: to invest in: two doors, four windows and to pay the labor costs for installing them in his home.

loans.name: Perice

texts.en: Perice is a married woman. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another water tank to store more water to sell. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more tanks.

loans.use: to buy another water tank to store more water to sell.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry thanks you for your generosity because his previous loan helped him establish his business. That loan enabled him to purchase additional grocery products to increase his product inventory. His business profits were used to provide for his family's daily needs and expenditures.

Jerry is very positive that he can further improve his business with another 25,000 PHP loan. This new loan will be used to purchase additional stock, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages. By offering more items for sale, Jerry's customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make his business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Jerry to sustain his family's needs.

Aside from his variety store, Jerry offers fish ball (a popular Filipino street food) and part of the loan will be used to improve his profit from this. He dreams that his family will always be completely healthy and happy. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of grocery items to display and sell in his store.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 51 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Hilda has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Hilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Veleriano

texts.en:
Veleriano is a 45-year-old hardworking married man with six children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is very active and caring at his home. Three of his children attend school.

He brews local alcohol, commonly called waragi, to earn income, and he also earns income from fish selling, which business he started three years ago.

He desires to expand his brewing business, though he is challenged by high transport expenses. He will use the requested loan to buy bananas for making local brew.

loans.use: to buy bananas for making local brew.

loans.name: Shamaila

texts.en:
Shamaila is a 30-year-old woman living with her two children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is full of damage.

He does not have a sufficient amount to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy the rickshaw body.

Therefore, Shamaila requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a new rickshaw body so he could drive the rickshaw smoothly. She hopes that now her husband will be able to have more income.

She is very happy after receiving this loan. Shamaila thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body and seat covers for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 42-year-old married woman who has four children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Asia's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthful, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can sell the maximum amount of fruits until evening and get the maximum reward for his efforts.

Asia applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy seasonal and fresh fruits for her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children.

Her son provides whitewashing and oil paint services to his customers in the community. Sometimes he has to go out of the city also.

Her son has gotten a new contract for the whitewashing and oil painting of a newly constructed house, but he has no paint brushes or rollers for providing these services.

Abida requested a loan for her son so he would be able to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene, oil, etc.

She wants to change the condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her son. Abida is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new paint brushes, rollers, kerosene, oil, etc. for her son's paint work.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Yong is a 45-year-old farmer on a rice field far away from her house. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is married. Her husband is also a farmer. They can only make $10 USD per day to support their family. She resides in a rural area of Moung Ruessei District, Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 10 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo is 55 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is a father of four children and operates a transportation service and manages his own farm to earn a living.

He has been in this business for many years and he earns well for his family. Cerilo had successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to buy tires and for repairs.

He took a new loan recently from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer to have a productive farm. He plans to build a farm warehouse in the future.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 42 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has had a clothing sales business for 2 years.

Priscilla has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more second-hand bed sheets for her to sell and earn more income.

She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her children by paying school fees. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life together with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand bed sheets for her to sell and earn more income.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, mangoes, tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of onions and tomatoes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family.

This is Paulina's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jerioth

texts.en: Jerioth is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows maize, kale, onions and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable family. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Narina

texts.en:
Narina, supports her family through her food vending business in the Philippines. The accompanying photo shows Narina with her son Jeric, who is 18 years old and is the third of three children in the family.

Narina is borrowing 7,448.77 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Jeric, who is studying toward a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. Jeric is currently in his third year of this four-year program. He plans to be a programmer and help his family when he graduates.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is a woman with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelie is 25 years old now. She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Emelie requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

She has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Emelie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in  her buisness

loans.name: Julian Arbey

texts.es:
Julián tiene 36 años y está felizmente casado. Vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 5 años en la ciudad de Medellín, donde trabaja arduamente para darle la mejor calidad de vida a su familia, en la medida de lo posible. 

Siempre ha amado la cocina, y tiene un talento natural para eso, razón por la cual ha tomado la decisión de estudiar para profesionalizar ese talento. Espera con sus nuevos conocimientos en cocina poder iniciar su propio negocio, el cual ha venido pensando con su esposa desde hace un tiempo.

Hoy solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder empezar sus estudios en bizcochos y cubiertas (repostería), para así darle el inició a este sueño que tiene hace muchos años. Ayuda  Julián a dar un paso gigante en la construcción de su negocio a través de la educación.
texts.en:
Julián is 36 years old and is happily married. He lives with his wife and small 5 year old son in the city of Medellín. There he works hard in order to give the best quality of life to his family, to the extent that is possible.

He has always loved cooking and has a natural talent for it, and for this reason he has made the decision to study in order to professionalize this talent. He hopes with his new knowledge of cooking he will be able to start his own business, which he has been thinking about with his wife for some time.

Currently, he is requesting a loan with the goal of being able to start his studies in cake and confection-making, and in this way begin this dream that he has had for many years. Help Julián take a giant step in the building of his business through education.

loans.use: to begin his studies in cake and confection-making.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 41-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children.

Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a cobbler and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot experience about his profession.

He sews leather and rexine (a type of synthetic leather) shoes with a machine, and after that he attaches the soles through stitching by hand. In this way he is generating income for his family.

He has been making shoes at home, and now he established a shop to continue his business on a wider level. But he does not have cash in hand to buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.
Therefore, Shehnaz requested a loan for her husband so he can buy the initial raw materials for making shoes.

Shehnaz thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy the initial raw materials for her husband's newly set-up shoe making shop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 41-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 21, 18 and 10.

Maria and her husband reared the children by operating their hog raising business, and by buying and selling pigs. This is quite difficult regarding their daily consumption, because raising hogs takes a few months before it will turn into cash.

Because of that, Maria is requesting a loan to buy piglets and feed as well. Aside from this, she will also buy pigs to sell. In the future, she dreams to have a sustainable business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and pigs

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a 44-year-old man and a resident of Tubigon, Bohol, where he earns a living by selling “lechon manok” (whole chicken roasted over live charcoal). He has been doing this for four years to support his family.

Joel works hard through his business to reach his goal and to sustain each day. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy dressed chicken and spices. In the future, Joel plans to improve this livelihood for his family.

loans.use: to buy dressed chicken and spices

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are presently in school.

Gina is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Gina has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, es una persona que desde muy joven ha luchado para salir adelante, actualmente vive con su compañera de vida, ellos han procreado tres hijos, pero ya son adultos y son independientes, en su juventud estuvo viviendo en el extranjero, pero luego regreso al país para iniciar una nueva vida, por un tiempo fue empleado, dejo de serlo cuando siguió el consejo de tener un negocio propio que le dio un amigo, es así como se arriesgó y desde hace 20 años tiene su propio negocio el cual consiste en atender una tienda donde ofrece muchos productos de la canasta básica.
Para ofrecer nuevos productos en su negocio opta por solicitar un financiamiento en Padecomsm, con el que piensa comprar platos, vasos, servilletas, manteles, bebidas, etc., así podrá tener suficiente mercadería  almacenada para aprovechar la temporada de fiestas patronales y de fin de año, pues espera que las ventas sean mayores y le generen mayor ganancia.
Confía que con la ayuda que le brinda Padecomsm su negocio se fortalecerá y tendrá más recursos económicos para seguir progresando y teniendo un estilo de vida más digna.
texts.en:
Julio is a person who has struggled from a young age to get ahead. He currently lives with his life partner.They have conceived three children but they are already independent adults. He lived abroad during his youth but then returned to this country to start a new life. He was employed for a while but stopped when he followed a friend’s advice to start his own business.

That is why he took a chance and he has had his own business for 20 years. It consists of running a store selling many basic necessities.

In order to offer new products at his business, he has chosen to request a loan from Padecomsm. He plans to buy plates, cups, napkins, tablecloths, drinks, etc. so that he can have sufficient merchandise stored to take advantage of the patron saint and end of the year season. He expects sales to be greater and to generate greater income.

He is confident that with Padecomsm’s help, his business will be stronger and he will have more financial resources to continue progressing and to have a more dignified lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy plates, cups, napkins, tablecloths, drinks, etc. so he can have sufficient merchandise stored to take advantage of the season.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 27-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

Najma wants to grow her husband's business, and so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan. She is expecting a boost in the earnings, and she dreams of expanding the business further in the future. Najma is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Diego Hernando

texts.es: Diego es un hombre trabajador de 26 años de edad que vive junto a su madre y sus 2 sobrinas de 16 y 7 años de edad. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios de albañil independiente, actividad que realiza desde hace 5 años. Diego es un joven visionario que siempre busca la manera de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que ha decidido mejorar el techo de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Diego is a hardworking, 26 year old man who lives with his mother and two nieces of 7 and 16 years of age. He works as an independent mason, a job that he has done for 5 years.

Diego is a young visionary who always searches for ways to improve his family’s quality of life. This is why he has decided to improve the roof of his home. For this, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof of his home.

loans.use: to invest in: galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails and wire to improve the roof of his home.

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”.
La socia Jacqueline Elizabeth continua dedicándose al negocio de  Internet, con esta actividad saca adelante a su familia.
Su negocio es un éxito por las ganas y la calidad de servicio que ella da a sus clientes, por esta razón la socia desea seguir ampliando su negocio y renovando su tecnología.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar una computadora. 
La socia esta contenta y agrádese el crédito que le otorgaron los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en:
The member continues to belong to the communal bank "Yanahuara Señor de Torrechayoc". She continues in her Internet business, and with this work is getting her family ahead. Her business is successful due to her effort and the quality of service she gives to her customers. For this reason, she would like to continue expanding her business and update her technology.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a computer. She is happy and grateful for the loan from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her business.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr:
Lucie est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et vit avec ces 2 enfants dans un quartier semi-rural. Elle exerce une activité d’élevage de bovin depuis 10 ans. 
Elle a déjà pris des prêts auparavant pour l’élevage porcin. Cela lui a permis d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants. Ce prêt servira à acheter 3 zébus à engraisser puis à vendre aux bouchers. De ce fait, elle va acheter des aliments et de la provende pour ces zébus.
Le rêve de Lucie est de pouvoir acheter un terrain et de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Lucie is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her two children in a semi-rural neighborhood. She has been raising bovine for 10 years.

She has already taken loans in the past for raising porcine. This has allowed her to ensure paying for her children’s education. This loan will allow her to buy 3 zebus to fatten up and then sell to butchers. For this, she is going to buy food for the zebus.

Lucie’s dream is to be able to buy land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 zebus and food to fatten them up.

loans.name: Boe Toke Village Group

texts.en:
A previous loan from Proximity helped duck raisers from Boe Toke village expand their livestock business, and that boosted their income. They could repair their unstructured duck farms and purchase 100 more ducks. With these, their households could not only cover their living costs, but also support their children's education.

Boe Toke community is excited to get another loan from Kiva. For the upcoming loan, six more borrowers will join the group for a total of 22 members. Before the duck prices increase, these customers aim to purchase more packets of feed and store them.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feeds and store them.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a widowed woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelia is 54 years old and has three children who are in school.

Emelia has a spice vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Con 32 años de edad, María vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hija de 8 años y su hijo de 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable quien en busca de cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos en diferentes viviendas planchando y lavando con el fin de poder obtener un ingreso y de esta manera mantener la economía del hogar y así también para poder mejorar su estilo de vida, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, ladrillos y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una pared divisoria en su hogar. Además María se encuentra muy agradecida con el crédito anterior, pues gracias a ello pudo invertir en reparar parte de su vivienda logrando una mayor tranquilidad para sus hijos.
texts.en: 32-year-old María lives with her life partner, her 8-year-old daughter and her 10-year-old son. She's a hardworking and responsible woman. As a way to afford her family's basic needs, she provides housekeeping services for various homes, washing and ironing clothes in order to obtain an income. That way she maintains the household economy and is also able to improve her living conditions. That's the reason why she requests a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase sand, cement and tiles, and also to pay for labor so that she can build a partition wall in her house. In addition, María is very thankful for the previous loan, since thanks to that she could invest in some home repairs and therefore provide more comfort for her children.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and tiles, and to pay for labor so she can build a partition wall in her house.

loans.name: Rosa Gladis

texts.es: Rosa tiene 54 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de pupusas todos los días, además los fines de semana vende sopa de pata, lo que le permite tener mejores ingresos para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella es madre soltera y habita junto a sus dos hijos de 12 y 17 años de edad. Rosa desea construir las paredes de su vivienda, ya que por ser de adobe y estar deterioradas, se cayeron, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir las paredes de su vivienda y hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and works selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) every day. Additionally, she sells sopa de pata (a soup made with cows' feet) on the weekends. This brings her a greater income so that she can offer her family a better quality of life. She is a single mother and lives with her two children, ages 12 and 17.

She would like to build the walls of her home, since being of adobe and damaged, they fell. It is for this that she is requesting a loan through FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and steel: so that she can build the walls of her home and make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and steel to build the walls of her home.

loans.name: Mungu Ni Mwema Group

texts.fr: Masumbuko est une femme d’affaires, membre du groupe de crédits «Mungu ni Mwema», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 28 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 2 sont petits. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans la rue de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en quinze paires de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Masumbuko is a business woman and a member of loan group “Mungu ni Mwema,” an IMF Hekima customer. She is 28, married, and a mother of five, three of whom attend school and two of whom are little. She has been selling used shoes in the city streets for 8 years. She is going to stock up with fifteen pairs of shoes. She started this business with the money she received from her husband. She hopes to pay for the education of and feed her children. In the end, she thanks Hekima for their support of unbankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with fifteen pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Fabio Ismael

texts.es:
En la cría de aves encuentran muchas personas una gran oportunidad de vida y desarrollo, tal es el caso de Fabio que con sus 53 años tiene un pequeño negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde, los cuales alimenta para venderlos posteriormente.

Vive en el municipio de Chinu donde comparte su vida con 2 hijos y su esposa.
Son una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora y sincera.
En los ojos de este campesino se refleja el esfuerzo y el pasar de los años con un gran corazón y con enseñanzas para sus hijos.

Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de gallinas, pollos y alimento para los mismo, de este forma lograra aumentar su producción y mejorar su capital de trabajo para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Raising birds provides many people with a great life opportunity. This is the case of 53-year-old Fabio, who has a small business raising laying hens and broiler chickens, which he feeds to sell at a later time. He lives in the town of Chinu, where he shares his life with his wife and two children. They are a modest family that is hardworking and honest. 

In the eyes of this country person are reflected the effort and the passing of years with a great heart and with lessons for his children. He is requesting a loan to buy hens, chickens and feed, which will help him increase his production and improve his working capital to offer his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy hens, chickens, and feed, which will help him improve his production.

loans.name: Fara Domoina

texts.fr:
Fara Domoina vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit que vous lui avez accordé. Avec lequel, elle a pu améliorer son taxi-phone, elle a acheté des recharges telma, orange et airtel et puis elle a pu étendre l'activité en faisant de nouveau investissement (vente des œufs). 
En outre, elle projette de vendre d'autres articles: des friandises, pistaches et cigarettes c'est à dire épicerie. Elle espère que vous allez encore l'aider et lui ré-accorder ce nouveau prêt. Elle devient de plus en plus motivée à continuer à développer l'activité et améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille et surtout financer les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fara Domoina thanks you so much for the loan that you’ve granted her. With it, she was able to improve her phone taxi, she bought Telma, Orange, and Airtel phone cards, and she was able to diversify her business with a new investment (selling eggs).

Further, she plans to sell other items: sweets, pistachios, and cigarettes. She hopes you will help her again by granting her this new loan. She is becoming more and more motivated to continue to develop her business and improve the level of her family live, especially when it comes to paying for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy 2 phones, a small table, phone cards, candy, cookies, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Ángel de 47  años de edad es casado y  vive con su esposa y sus hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 05 años al negocio de venta de Abarrotería como ser frescos, jugos, pan, churros, galletas, confites, arroz, azúcar, huevos, jabón, salsas, espaguetis, sopas etc. También él ha emprendido un pequeño taller de bicicletas y venta de repuestos como ser llantas, neumáticos, pedales, frenos, monturas, cables, rines, y más, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas que transitan por la zona,  Don Angel radica en la aldea San Juan Bautista de Pespire   al sur de Honduras,  él es un hombre  emprendedor con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Don Angel esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de más repuestos para surtir su taller con llantas, neumáticos, pedales, frenos, monturas, cables, rines, y más y de esta manera atender mejor a sus clientes,  con el apoyo de este crédito él pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.
SAN LORENZO, HONDURAS - OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
Ángel, 47, is married and lives with his wife and his children in his own home in the town of San Juan Bautista de Pespire, in the south of Honduras. He's an enterprising man who wants to get ahead, and he strives every day to improve his quality of life.

Ángel has worked for five years selling groceries, including cold drinks, juice, bread, churros, cookies, candy, rice, sugar, eggs, soap, sauces, spaghetti, and soup. He also has started a small bicycle shop with parts such as tires, tubes, pedals, brakes, frames, cables, rims, and so forth. His customers are all his neighbors and friends, as well as people who walk by in the area.

Ángel's requesting the loan to buy more parts to supply his shop with tires, tubes, pedals, brakes, frames, cables, rims, and others. That way he'll provide better customer service.

He hopes to improve his income and his quality of life with this loan. He's a new client who wants to work with Prisma.

His dream is to have a good business and increase his clientele as well as improve his future and his family's.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2015

loans.use: to buy tires, tubes, pedals, brakes, frames, cables, rims, and other bicycle parts for his business

loans.name: Felicita Refugio

texts.es: Felicita es una mujer trabajadora de 25 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 8 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida con su trabajo de oficios domésticos, lo que le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su familia. Felicita desea mejorar el techo y el corredor de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para mejorar el techo y el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Felicita is a hardworking 25-year-old woman. She lives with her life partner and her two children aged 8 and 14 years. She's a hardworking woman who earns a living through her housekeeping work, which allows her to obtain the income she needs to support her family. Felicita wishes to improve the roof and the corridor in her home. That's why she requests a loan from FUSAI so that she can purchase cement, sand, gravel and iron in order to improve the roof and the corridor of her house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, tiles and iron in order to improve the roof and the corridor of her house.

loans.name: Hetwik

texts.en:
Hetwik is a 25-year-old mother with a toddler named Tika who is one year old. Hetwik is married to Harmo, 26, an employee. Hetwik owns a kiosk business selling daily needs and has been involved in the business for a year. Hetwik enjoys the days with her daughter while serving the customer. The business is going well and the income generated allows her to support her husband in covering their living needs. Nevertheless, she wants to expand the business by adding more stock such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, kerosene, noodles, etc.

She got information that TLM usually provides loans for entrepreneurs who want to improve their businesses. She then applied a loan of IDR 2,500,000. She believes that the loan from Kiva through TLM will give her an opportunity for a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and supplies such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, kerosene, noodles, etc., to add to her kiosk.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a 43-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Catigbian, Bohol. She is married with three children; two adults and one school-aged child. Her husband works hard as a laborer, while Generosa has been engaged in basketmaking for 15 years. Aside from this, she also sells charcoal to the community for additional income.

Generosa’s biggest dream in life is to improve her business to have enough money to send her school-aged child to college. To do this, first she needs to improve her products and her sales. This is why she is asking for a loan. She needs to buy raw materials for basketmaking; specifically she uses nito vine. Nito vine (Lygodium Circinatum) is a plant belonging to the fern family that grows abundantly in the hinterlands of Mindanao in Southern Philippines. In addition to this, she will also buy coconut shells. (They will be processed and become charcoal.)

loans.use: to buy nito vine (a plant belonging to the fern family) and coconut shells.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Marcelino is a 57-year-old married man with two adult children. He lives with his family in a municipality of Catigbian in Bohol, Philippines. For the past 33 years, Marcelino has run a farm where he grows rice and vegetables. It is very important for him that his business can last a long time because it is the financial support for his family. 

Marcelino is requesting a loan to buy sacks of rice and vegetable seeds, medicines, and fertilizer to enhance the growth of his plants. In the future, he wants to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and vegetable seeds, medicines, and fertilizer

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 52-year-old married woman with two grown children. Her husband is a tricycle operator. For many years, Martina has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells merchandise such as rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.

Martina is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as rice, canned goods, soft drinks, and liquors. She will use her loan to improve her earnings and keep up the inventory of her store, thus attracting more buyers. In this way, she will be able to repay her obligation and set aside some savings for emergency use. Martina is hoping that she can make her business sustainable and she is grateful to Kiva for continued support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, canned goods, soft drinks and liquors

loans.name: Artesanos Del Sector Guarcas Cantón Camanchaj Group

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 30 años de edad es soltera vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en  una comunidad del Cantón Camanchaj.

María para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de güipiles típicos, con esta labor lleva ella 10 años de realizarlo, gracias a sus años de experiencia su producto tiene mucha demanda por la calidad que tiene. Con la fiesta de fin de año el producto de María tiene mucha demanda y sus materiales para elaborar hermosos atuendos no le es suficiente por esa razón se ha organizado con un grupo de personas para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos.
Su gran sueño es tener su propio local para vender mejor su producto y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old, is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the town of Camanchaj. She obtains an income and is getting her family ahead by working to make traditional güipiles (tunics). She has been doing this work for 10 years, and thanks to her years of experience she has a lot of demand for her product because of its quality.

With the end of the year holiday, María's product has a lot of demand and her materials to make beautiful clothing are not sufficient. For this reason she has organized with a group of people to request a loan that will be used to buy different colors and styles of thread. Her big dream is to have her own location to sell her product and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy different colors and styles of thread to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Dieu Merci Group

texts.fr: Furaha est une femme d’affaires, présidente du groupe de crédits «Dieu Merci», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 3 sont petits. Elle est vendeuse du kérosène dans la rue de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 80 litres de kérosène. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en: Furaha is a business woman and president of the loan group “Dieu Merci” (Thank You God), who is an IMF Hekima customer. She is 39, married, and a mother of six, three of whom attend school and three of whom are little. She has been selling kerosene on the city streets for 8 years. She is going to stock up on 80 liters of kerosene. She started her business with the capital received from her husband. She hopes to pay for her children’s schooling and food. In the end, she thanks Hekima for their support of unbankable entrepreneurs. We would like to point out that certain clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to stock up with 80 liters of kerosene.

loans.name: Tujikomboe Kitopeni Group

texts.en:
Abdalah, who is in his early 50s, is married with five grown-up children. He has been a food vendor for 12 years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Abdalah's 21st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his food stock and start selling water. He has managed to pay back all of his loans successfully. He is really doing great with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to buy water tanks, buy a plot of land, take care of his family, repay the loan, reinvest in his business and cover his household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his stock of water, and buy sugar, flours, beans, rice, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

Abdalah will share this loan with his loan group Tujikomboe Kitopeni which has seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his stock of water, and buy sugar, flours, beans, rice, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Here is Priscila. She is again knocking on the door of your generous hearts to make improvement in her business and provide additional capital to buy the materials and ingredients for her food stall. Priscila is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and other raw ingredients she needs to make a greater variety of the food that she usually sells. 

Priscila never stops looking for ways to improve her family’s living condition and she grabs every opportunity that comes along her way. She still regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, which gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and other raw ingredients

loans.name: Ross Mery

texts.es: Ross es una mujer luchadora quien gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado mantener y sacar adelante su negocio, ella tiene la edad de 24 años, acompañada y madre de una niña de diez meses. Ella es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace cuatro años, en el negocio le ayuda su cuñada a despachar. Solicita por primer ciclo  el financiamiento de la institución para desarrollar su negocio con la compra de granos básicos, aceite, avena, jabón y gaseosa, debido a que su meta es hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
Ross, 24, is in a common-law marriage and the mother of a 10-month-old girl.

She's a persevering woman who, thanks to her efforts, has managed to support and make progress with her business. She has owned a grocery store for four years. Her sister-in-law helps her wait on customers.

She's requesting a loan from the institution for the first time to develop her business. She wants to make it grow with a purchase of staple products, oil, oatmeal, soap, and soda.

loans.use: to buy staple products, oil, oatmeal, soap, and soda

loans.name: María Antonieta

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 37 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 15 y 28 años de edad, esta familia habita en una comunidad de Sololá.
María para generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, con esta actividad lleva 15 años de realizarlo, su  negocio está situado en el mercado regional de su comunidad.
María con los deseos de incrementar su patrimonio y poder dejarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una cuerda de terreno, pues para ella es muy importante la adquisición de este terreno puesto que su familia no tiene suficiente terreno.
Su mayor anhelo es comparar este terreno para que sus hijos tengan un lugar mejor donde poder algún día construir su casa.
texts.en:
María is a 37 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with four children between the ages of 15 and 28. This family lives in a community in Sololá.

In order to generate income, María works buying and selling clothing traditional to her region. She has been doing this work for more than 15 years. Her business is located in her community’s regional market.

Hoping to grow her estate and to be able to leave her children with a better quality of life, she has decided to request a loan to buy an acre of land. The acquisition of this land is very important to her because her family does not have sufficient land.

Her greatest desire is to buy this land so that her children have a better place to one day build a home.

loans.use: to buy an acre of land for future construction.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 38-year-old married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an artificial jewelry shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewelry for the shop that includes bangles, necklace, rings, and bracelets. Therefore Tahira has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase artificial jewelry for her husband's shop. Tahira is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business.

loans.use: to buy artificial jewelry such as bangles, necklace, rings, bracelets, etc. for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children. One is in school and the other one is still small. She has been running a grocery business for four years now. She works from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Neema's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her grocery stock and has managed to pay back all of her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, buy a plot of land, open a clothes business, reinvest in her business and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best-selling drinks in the store. She dreams of expanding her business.

Neema will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best-selling drinks in the store.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es:
La señora María Teodora de 56  años de edad es casada y  vive con su esposo e hijas  en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 07  años al negocio de venta de Ropa Nueva y Usada, ella vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, brasieres, biquinis, zapatos, sandalias etc. Sus cliente son personas de Esquimai y comunidades vecinas como san juan bautista, el terrero, tierra agria, las garzas, las crucitas, san Antonio de Padua y otros, Doña Maria radica en aldea Esquimai de Pespire al sur de Honduras, ella es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Doña Maria está solicitando el préstamo para compra de más Mercadería como ropa y zapatos, sandalias de mujer y ropa interior de ambos sexos. Para mejorar sus ventas en el tiempo que se aproxima,  con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma y KIVA.
Doña Maria su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - OCTUBRE  2015.
texts.en:
María Teodora is 56 years old, is married and lives with her husband and daughters in her own home. She has worked for 7 years selling new and used clothing. She sells pants, shirts, shorts, boxers, lycra clothing, blouses, dresses, skirts, brasiers, bikinis, shoes, sandals, and other items. Her customers are people in Esquimai and neighboring towns such as San Juan Bautista, El Terrero, Tierra Agria, Las Garzas, Las Crucitas, San Antonio de Padua, and others. She lives in the town of Esquimai de Pespire in the south of Honduras. She is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead and fights every day to improve her quality of life.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as clothing and shoes, women's sandals, and men's and women's undergarments to improve her sales in the upcoming period of time. With the support of this loan she intends to increase her income as well as her quality of life.

She is a new client with a desire to work with Prisma and Kiva. Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, and at the same time improve her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a 57-year-old mother of three children, She is a farmer on a rice field which is far away from her house. Her husband is also a farmer. They can only make $5 USD per day to support their family. Thy resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 20 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all of the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Gs El Matazano Group

texts.es:
Orfilia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al comercio ella cuenta con una venta de insumos agropecuarios y útiles escolares, este negocio lo atiende personalmente desde hace mas de 5 años, Orfilia cuenta con una variedad de clientes los cuales son productores del Sector agrícola, su negocio es muy frecuentado por las personas ya que es el único de la zona, Orfilia comenta que desearía realizar su sueño de ampliar su negocio y poder cubrir mas comunidades de la zona, ya que así sus ingresos aumentarían y mejoraría la calidad de vida de su familia y apoyaría a sus hijos y nietos a concluir sus estudios, secundarios y universitarios.
Doña Orfilia solicita el préstamo para la compra de los diferentes productos agrícolas como ser: fertilizantes, fungicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas y abonos, Ella solicita el apoyo del préstamo de forma grupal con María quien se dedica a la venta de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles, contando con 10 años de experiencia.
Doña Orfilia y Doña Maria solicitan el crédito porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente para trabajar y se acerca la navidad época en que el mercado aumenta y necesitan incrementar sus inventarios para obtener ganancias y ayudar a sus familias a tener una mejor calidad de vida.


Honduras - Octubre 2015
texts.en:
Orfilia is an enterprising and hardworking woman who works in retail. She sells farm supplies and school supplies. She has personally run this business for the past five years. Orfilia has a diverse clientele comprised of agricultural producers. Her business is in high demand among the local people, since it's the only one in the area. Orfilia reports that she would like to achieve her dream of expanding her business and being able to cover more communities in that area. That way her profits would increase and she would improve her family's living conditions. She would also help her children and grandchildren to finish high school and college.
Orfilia requests this loan in order to purchase various farm supplies such as fertilizer, fungicide, pesticide, insecticide and compost. She requests the help of this loan as a group alongside María, who has 10 years of experience in selling basic grains such as corn and beans.
Orfilia and María request the loan because they don't have enough capital to work with. Also, the holiday season is approaching. It's a time when turnover increases and they need to stock up so that they can make a profit and help their families improve their living conditions.

Honduras - October 2015

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fungicide, pesticide, insecticide and compost for her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her establish her business. That loan enabled her to purchase additional grocery products to increase her product inventory. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Jocelyn is very positive that she can further improve her business with another 30,000 PHP loan. This new loan will buy additional stock, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages. By offering more items for sale, Jocelyn's customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Jocelyn to sustain her family's needs.

Aside from her variety store, Jocelyn also operates a room for rent. Part of the loan will be used for the room's maintenance cost and repair. She dreams that her family will always be completely happy. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business, and pay the maintenance cost of her boarding house.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly, supports the family through her business buying and selling personal collections in the Philippines.

The accompanying photo shows Merly with her son Carl Floyd. He is 21 years old and the first of three children in the family.

Merly is borrowing 7,800 PHP to pay the tuition fees of Carl Floyd who is studying for his bachelor's of science in civil engineering. Carl Floyd is currently in his fifth year of this five-year course.

When he graduates, Carl Floyd plans to be an engineer and help his mother to send his younger siblings to finish college as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 33 years old and has three children. Araceli is married and has three children who are in school.

Araceli is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Araceli requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Araceli has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Araceli would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 57 years old and has five children. Adelaida is a married woman.

Adelaida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Adelaida has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 63 years old now.

Nenita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 46 years old and has one child still in school.

Mary Ann has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Mary Ann has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Orlinda

texts.en:
Orlinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Orlinda is 61 years old and has one child still in school.

Orlinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Orlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, pork and other materials for her food production business.

Orlinda has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, pork and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa es una mujer de 56 años de edad, es casada con una familia muy linda con la que vive, ellos habitan en una comunidad de la aldea la ladrillera.
María Luisa a pesar de su edad, es una mujer que busca superarse y para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, con este negocio lleva ella 6 años de realizarlo, su negocio se ubica en el mercando central de su comunidad.
Con la fiesta de fin de año la demanda de ropa incrementa por esa razón ella ha decidido solicitar  un préstamo para la compra de más productos de ropa típica como: cortes, fajas y güipiles, lo que ella busca con esta inversión es satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Luisa is a 56-year-old woman. She is married with a beautiful family she lives with. They live in a community of the village La Ladrillera. In spite of her age, María Luisa is a woman who always seeks to overcome obstacles, and to earn an income she works buying and selling typical clothing. She has had this business for six years; her business is located in the central market of her community.

With the holiday at the end of the year, the demand for clothing increases. For this reason she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more typical clothing products like skirts, sashes and huipiles. With this investment she seeks to better satisfy her customers' needs and to improve her earnings. Her hope in life is to strengthen her business and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing products like skirts, sashes and huipiles.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leah is 51 years old and has one child still in school.

Leah has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Leah has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old and has six children. Francisca is married and has one child still in school.

Francisca is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Francisca requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Francisca has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Riza is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Riza has a business buying and selling used shoes in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

Riza has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es un hombre trabajador de 73 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de chocolate, la cual realiza de forma ambulante, recorriendo los comedores y pupusería para ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes. Él vive con su esposa en casa de su propiedad desde hace 30 años. Ricardo desea cambiar las láminas deterioradas de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar las láminas del techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a hardworking 73-year-old man who works selling chocolate. He works as a street vendor, visiting restaurants and pupusa stands to offer his product to the patrons. He lives with his wife in the home they purchased thirty years ago.

Ricardo wants to replace the damaged sheet metal in his home, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest it in buying new sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire. This will allow him to replace the roof.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to replace his roof.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, who is 42, comes from Prey Chhor district, Kompong Cham Province. He is a farmer on his rice field which is far away from his house. He has two children and his wife is also a farmer. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business. This couple earns money on average $7.00 (USD) a day. So far, they have been in this career for 12 years.

Due his workplace is far from his house and he has a motor to travel there which doesn’t work, yet he doesn’t have sufficient money to repair. Therefore, he would like to apply a Kiva loan to repair his motor. He would like to thank all lenders for his financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his motor

loans.name: Fatima Raquel

texts.es: Fátima es una mujer laboriosa de 44 años de edad, casada, madre de un niño de once años, quien es su mayor motivación. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y perfumes desde hace 10 años y está solicitando el crédito número doce para la compra de camisas, pantalones, chores y faldas. Una de sus metas es llegar a tener su tienda. Con el crédito anterior logro aumentar la oferta de productos y compro un televisor.
texts.en:
Fatima is a hardworking 44-year-old woman. She is married and has an eleven-year-old boy, who is her main motivation. For the past ten years, she has been working selling clothing and fragrances.

She is requesting her twelfth loan in order to buy shirts, pants, shorts, and skirts. One of her goals is to one day open her own store. Her previous loan helped her increase variety in the products she offers, and she was also able to buy a television.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts, and skirts.

loans.name: Sabuhi

texts.en:
Sabuhi was born in 1983. He is married and has two children. His children are 7 and 4 years old. One of the children studies in primary school and the other is going to kindergarten. Sabuhi is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from the region of Fuzuli, but he is now settled in Baku city with his family.

Sabuhi rents a store and in this store he sells baby clothes. He has been in the clothing business for five years. He needs his first loan in the amount of 1900 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan he wants to buy new baby clothes. He says he is greatly thankful to Kiva organization and lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy new baby clothes for sale.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field is far away from her house, Len, is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children. Her husband is also a farmer. They can only make $5 USD per day to support their family. Len resides in a rural area of Trapeang Chong District, PURSAT Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 20 years now.
Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia Rosario sigue perteneciente al banco comunal “YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”.

La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales, para esta labor hay que tener paciencia y conocer el comportamiento animal, la socia entiende esto porque se dedica hace muchos años a esta actividad.
Rosario peticiono el préstamo para comprar cuyes, alfalfa y pasto.
la socia está contenta con el préstamo y agrádese a los inversionista de KIVA por seguir confiando en ella, y ayudarla a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Rosario still belongs to the communal bank Yanahuara Senor de Torrechayoc. This member continues to work raising animals. This work requires patience and knowledge about the animals' behavior. She has been in this business for many years.

Rosario is requesting this loan to buy Guinea pigs, alfalfa, and grass. She is happy with her loan and is grateful to Kiva lenders for their continuing confidence in her and their help in achieving her goals.

loans.use: to buy Guinea pigs, alfalfa, and grass.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 4 children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be hardworking. He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes for sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of raw materials for making boxes. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of raw materials for making metal boxes.

loans.name: Zarah

texts.en:
Zarah has run her sari-sari store for many years now. She was able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy additional grocery items she sells. Zarah wants to improve her business, for she wants to ensure a better life for her family. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time in the amount of PHP 40,000, to purchase additional stocks of gorceries, toiletries, beverages and other wide arrays of selections.

In the next few years, Zarah wants to see her business thrive and be able to gain more customers, for she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She hopes also to find a bigger space for her shop so she can house more stock.

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back their micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages and other products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 55 years old and has five children. Lourdes is married and has one child still in school.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lourdes has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joseline is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Joseline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Joseline requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Joseline has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Joseline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Asylbek

texts.en:
Asylbek is 19-years-old freshman in the International and Business Law Program at AUCA. 2 years ago his family lost his father after many years of struggling with disease. Finishing school he hadn’t a chance to enter university, so started to work. But having worked in the summer, he understood that will not earn enough money for living. This reason forced him to think on his next steps and make a decision to get high education.

He began to search for scholarships and found out AUCA’s 1-year-study New Generation Academy, which provided full scholarship, stipend and accommodation for the selected 70 best students/graduates of schools. As Asylbek was a diligent student at school and had good marks, he was blessed and selected as a finalist. During 2014-15 AY he moved to Bishkek to study at this Academy and got acquainted with the modern education system in English, improving his critical thinking and computer skills.

At present Asylbek is a freshman and has to pay for his tuition fee by himself. He applied for financial aid and got it from AUCA, but still the rest of the fee is too high for him. Asylbek has a mother and his younger brother at home. His mother is a nurse at the local hospital. The budgetary workers in Kyrgyzstan have a small salary, what is hardly enough for living there, but not to support a student in the capital as Bishkek.

Searching for education loans, Asylbek was happy to learn about Kiva loan for AUCA students, which was a deferred payment with zero interest and that could be returned after graduation. If Asylbek gets higher education and finds a good job in the future, he will be a great help for his mother to bring up his younger brother, who is a school-boy now. The family is hoping for the Kiva lenders’ understanding.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education for a degree in International and Business Law

loans.name: Miguel Eduardo

texts.es:
Miguel tiene en su sangra el empuje y fuerza para trabajar, a pesar sus 45 años, aun se siente con toda la energía del mundo.
Es padre de 2 hijos por los cuales trabaja incansablemente para ofrecerles una vida digna.

Los ingresos los obtiene de su trabajo como agricultor y porcicultor, pero este trabajo ha sido difícil por la competencia que se vive en las veredas del municipio de Sahagún.

Miguel solicita humildemente un apoyo para poder comprar lechones y alimento para los mismos, de este forma intentara superar estas dificultades y tendrá un mejor capital para trabajar.
texts.en: Miguel has the drive and strength to work in his blood; in spite of the fact that he is 45 years old, he still feels like he has all the energy in the world. He is the father of two children for whom he works tirelessly, to offer them a dignified life. He earns an income from his work as a farmer and by raising pigs, but this work has been difficult due to the competition experienced in the municipality of Sahagún. Miguel is humbly asking for support to be able to buy pigs and food for them. In this way he will try to overcome these difficulties and he will have greater working capital.

loans.use: to buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Obeida Gertrudys

texts.es:
Obeida de 28 años de edad, instalo en su casa un corral para criar cerdos buscando tener una micro-empresa para generar recursos y aportar en su casa los recursos que tanto escasean. 

Vive en unión libre y aprendió de esta profesión porque nació en una familia campesina donde adquirió empíricamente estas actividades. 

Buscando ser más competitiva en el sector y dar buenos precios Obeida quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos cerdos, cuido para alimentarlos y materiales para la mejora de la cochera, haciendo de sus cerdos animales de gran calidad para los posibles compradores. 

Obeida es trabajadora y sueña con tener su propia casa y no se detendrá hasta conseguirla pues quiere vivir en ella junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Obeida is 28 years old and in a common-law marriage. She set up some pig pens at her house in order to start raising pigs. She decided to start this small business so that she could make her own income and contribute to her household, where resources were quite limited. She learned the trade early, because she was born into a peasant family and acquired her skills through practice.

In order to become more competitive in her area and offer good prices, Obeida is requesting a loan to buy more pigs, feed, and materials to improve her pig pens. She wants her pigs to become high-quality animals for her potential customers.

Obeida is a hard worker. Her dream is for her family to all live together in their own house one day, and she will not stop until she achieves this goal.

loans.use: to buy two pigs, pig feed, and materials to improve her pens.

loans.name: Juddy

texts.en: Juddy is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail busines where she sells cereals, shoes, utensils, fertilizer and other items. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, shoes, utensils and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, shoes, utensils and other items.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en: Johnstone is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows, poultry. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to have a large scale farm within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Kibale Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a member of Kibale Tweyombeke where members guarantee each other when borrowing and at the time of paying back the loan. She owns a business of growing and selling Irish Potatoes and she has been doing this work for a period of three years. She is charged with responsibility of caring after her 3 children by providing all the basic needs at home. Most of her customers describe her as a hardworking, responsible and innovative woman in the way she does her things. She is facing challenges of lack of enough capital which limits her dream of of expanding her farm and producing a variety of food crops for commercial purpose and educating all her children to higher levels of learning.

Agnes has asked for a loan to enable her prepare the garden where she will grow Irish potatoes by paying the workers who are working with her. The children in the photo are group members' children at the time of taking a photo they couldn't separate them from their parents since one is breastfeeding and the others are at there home where the group was meeting in the compound.

loans.use: to enable her prepare the garden where she will grow Irish potatoes by paying the workers who are working with her.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are not working properly. So he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Zahida is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy new auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Un día se encontraba la señora Rosa mirando hacia cielo buscando una manera de generar recursos, pues sabía que el dinero no caía del cielo, tomar una pequeño capital ahorrado que tenía, compro algo de mercancía y la vendió; con el paso del tiempo le fue gustando mucho la vocación de ventas e hizo grandes sacrificios para poder montar su negocio. 

Hoy a sus 48 años de edad, con el negocio ya montado, busca la manera de sostenerlo y poder generar empleo.

Quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de productos de uso personal al por mayor que le permitirán a abastecer su pequeño inventario.
texts.en:
One day Rosa was looking up at the sky trying to think of a good way to make her own income. Because she knew that money doesn't fall from the sky, she decided to use her small savings to buy some merchandise. She sold it, and in time she found her vocation in the retail business. She made a lot of sacrifices, but she was able to set up her own business.

Today she is 48 years old and her business is still running. She wants to keep expanding and create jobs for others one day.
