She is requesting this loan to buy wholesale personal care products in order to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to stock up on wholesale personal care products.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed  mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Sreynet's Group

texts.en:
Sreynet’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Sreynet makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saverz's Group

texts.en: Saverz’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Saverz makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sophat's Group

texts.en: Sophat’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sophat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 65 years old. She is married and blessed with 2 children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water tank, seeds and fertilizers to boost her farming. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her farming business to large scale and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 23 years old, single, and blessed with one 2-year-old child.

She has been selling clothes for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to buy more clothes to resell in the village.

With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, she will be able to pay for her child's health care.

Her dream is to own a big clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale in the village

loans.name: Hạnh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hạnh is 30 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling noodles for five years.

Hạnh lives in Yen Dinh district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hạnh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more noodles and other supplies to cook for sale.

In 2014, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

In future, Hạnh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more noodles and other supplies to cook for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more oxen for his farm.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 45 years old and married with three children, who are in school, so Ana Marie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, chips, bread, etc.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 25 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Rasoa

texts.en:
Rasoa is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge because of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 25,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre honesto, de carácter muy tranquilo y trabajador, tiene cincuenta y tres años de edad, junto con su esposa luchan día a día para mantener a flote sus pequeños negocios de pulpería y venta de medicamentos. Él ya ha experimentado un cambio gracias a los préstamos de MiCrédito y Kiva, por lo cual está agradecido y cree fielmente en ambas organizaciones. 
En estos momentos, se le ha presentado una buena oportunidad a Fernando para mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de sus seres queridos. La alcaldía de su ciudad ha iniciado un proyecto de tuberías para que entre el agua potable y se desechen de aguas negras en su barrio, por lo tanto él ha recurrido a Kiva junto a MiCrédito para que se le otorgue un préstamo de saneamiento, que le permita instalar las tuberías para hacer uso de un servicio higiénico que cumpla con todas las medidas para preservar la salud.
texts.en:
Fernando is an honest man, very quiet and hardworking. He is 53, and with wife they strive every day to get ahead with their small businesses of a grocery store and selling medicines. He has already experienced a change thanks to the loans provided by MiCrédito and Kiva, for which he is grateful and faithful to both organizations.

Currently, a good opportunity has come up for Fernando to improve living conditions for himself and his loved ones. The Mayor's office in his city has started a plumbing project providing a potable water and sewer system for his neighborhood. Fernando has therefore applied to Kiva through MiCrédito for a sanitation loan that will allow him to install the plumbing for a bathroom, so that all measures can be applied to preserve their health.

loans.use: to install the plumbing for a bathroom.

loans.name: Kimeng's Group

texts.en: Kimeng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia.  Kimeng makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Maritza Stella

texts.es:
Con sus manos trabajadoras, Maritza ha luchado fuertemente para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella es una mujer amable y tiene un negocio de venta de desayunos y almuerzos en su restaurante.
De este negocio depende su futuro. Es por esta razón que solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de un equipo de sonido, el cual utilizara para amenizar la visita de sus clientes.

Apoya a Maritza a sacar adelante su negocio con un préstamo.
texts.en:
With her hardworking hands, Maritza has fought hard to bestow her family with a better quality of life.

She is a kind woman and has a business selling breakfast and lunch at her restaurant.

Her future depends on this business. For this reason, she is requesting financial support to buy a sound system which she will use to brighten up her customers' visits.

Support Maritza with a loan to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a sound system which she will use to brighten up her customers' visits.

loans.name: Abdulrauf

texts.en:
Abdulrauf is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abdulrauf has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Abdulrauf would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abdulrauf can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Abdulrauf will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abdulrauf is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a 52-year-old man from Tubigon, Bohol. He is married and has four children. His oldest child is 21 years old, while his youngest child is nine years old. Alberto and his wife earn a living by selling “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) fiber. “Buri” fiber has various usages; it can be made into bags, mats, and native hats. They have been doing this livelihood proficiently for 21 years. Aside from selling “buri” fiber, Alberto is engaged in charcoal selling. With this, he is asking for loan to buy young stem of “buri” and coconut shell. This young stem is the raw material for “buri” fiber and the coconut shell will be processed into charcoal. In this way, he will be able to sell more “buri” fiber and charcoal that will probably augment his earnings. 
,

loans.use: to buy young "buri" stem and coconut shell for weaving

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married with one child. He describes himself as determined. He operates a farm and grows vegetables to sell wholesale. He has been involved in this business for two years.

His business is located in a fertile area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as price fluctuations.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use this loan, for 50,000 Kenyan shillings, to buy farm inputs to grow more vegetables. In the future, he hopes he will be the area's preferred vegetable supplier. He will use his anticipated profits to open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to grow more vegetables.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu works hard to support her family. Lulu is married and she buys and sells vegetables as a business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Lulu has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Lulu would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ismat

texts.en:
Ismat is 38 years old, a married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

Ismat needs to satisfy more customers time after time. That is why she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. This will allow her to purchase combs, hair straightener, make-up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase combs, hair straightener, make-up kits, and cleansers for treating many customers at a time.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is 46 and married with two children who both attend school. She operates a retail shop mainly selling general merchandise such as salt, sugar, soft drinks, and bread among many other items. She supplements her business by owning rentals where she is assured of income at the end of the month.

Mary has always aspired to run a self-supporting business, only to be limited by high transport costs and stiff competition. She is seeking credit to buy more salt, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar, and soap for resale.

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
La socia continúa perteneciendo al banco comunal YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC.

La socia Nemecia es una mujer trabajadora, ella continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de productos secos.
Su  deseo de tener una mejor calidad de vida hace que cada día salga en la madrugada de su casa para empezar a vender sus productos y regresar en horas de la tarde a su hogar, su fuerza es la que hace salir a delante a su familia.
La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar almendras, maíz y frejol.
La socia está contenta con el crédito que le otorgaron, ya que le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
The member still belongs to the YANAHUARA SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC communal bank.

The member Nemecia is a hardworking woman. She continues working at her business selling dry goods.

Her desire for a better quality of life causes her to go out everyday in the early morning to begin selling her goods and then return to her home in the evening hours. Her strength is what moves her family forward.

The member requests a loan to buy almonds, corn and beans.

The member is happy with the loan she was granted because it will help her a lot with her business.

loans.use: to buy almonds, corn and beans.

loans.name: Karambi Women S Group

texts.en: Annet a member of Karambi Women S Group where members guarantee each other when borrowing and paying back loans. She is 43 years old with 5 children all living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a business of brewing Waragi a local drink in her village. She has been doing this business for 4 years and she started it with a small amount of savings from her family's labor. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after her children by paying school fees and providing food for them. Her main hardships in her business are inadequate capital and high transport costs when delivering her product to her customers in the market and shops. However, she is looking at becoming the main Waragi supplier in her village and educating all her children to higher levels of learning. Annet has asked for a loan to enable her buy Kisubi (bananas) and sorghum to use in the brewing of Waragi, a local drink in her village.

loans.use: to buy Kisubi (bananas) and sorghum to use in the brewing of Waragi, a local drink in her village.

loans.name: Tâm's Group

texts.en:
Tâm is 47 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 10 years. Tâm lives in Yen Dinh district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Tâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In 2014, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 25 years old, single and blessed with one child aged five years old.

She has been in the beauty salon business for twelve years and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 16,000.

This being her first loan with VFK, she intends to buy more braids, hairdressing chemicals, and a hair dryer.

She anticipates to provide medical care and food to her family from the expanded business profits. Her dream is to grow her business to a desirable standard.

loans.use: to buy more braids, hairdressing chemicals, and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Willa

texts.en:
Willa is 57 years old and married and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, milk, etc.

Willa has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, spices, milk, etc.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es muy querida en su comunidad. Hace 26 años Luz buscó la independencia financiera y abrió su propio taller de confección. 
Su red de amigos, familiares y vecinos le apoyó con gran afecto y lealtad a lo largo de todo el proceso de iniciar un negocio. 

Ella está buscando un préstamo para comprar tela, hilos, botones, apliques, y otros suministros que incrementarán la capacidad de su taller. 

Está cumpliendo su sueño, el de levantarse cada día con la energía y la satisfacción de servir a sus clientes. 

Ayuda Luz seguir viviendo el sueño!
texts.en:
Luz is very well liked in her community. 26 years ago, Luz sought financial independence and opened her own sewing shop.

Her network of friends, acquaintances and neighbors supported her, throughout the entire process of starting a business, with deep affection and loyalty.

She is seeking a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, wall lamps and other supplies that will increase the capacity of her shop.

She is fulfilling her dream of getting up each day with the energy and satisfaction to serve her customers.

Help Luz to continue living her dream!

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, wall lamps and other supplies that will increase the capacity of her shop.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 55-year-old vigorous married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls.

She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day.

Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Nasreen ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best-earning resource in her household. She is a mother of one children.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time.

She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Her businesses are tailoring and farming.

She has been in the businesses for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of five thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a new stock of cloth materials.

She will use the profits from the expanded business to invest in her farm. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new stock of cloth materials

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 1 hijo y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlo adelante.
Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende fritos como patacones de plátano y chicharrón.

Trabaja todos los días para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar una mesa metálica e insumos para sus preparaciones.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Olga is an experienced, wise, and very patient woman. She is the mother of one child and has worked practically her entire life in order to provide for her child. She has a small food stand where she sells fried foods such as fried plantains and pork rinds.

She works every day in order to have her products ready and fresh for her clients. The majority of her clients are neighbors in the area where she lives. She hopes to capitalize her business which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a metal table and ingredients for food production.

One of her main challenges is a lack of money to invest in her business but, she trusts that the help of Interactuar and the good heart of the Kiva lenders will help to carry her business forward.

loans.use: to buy a metal table and ingredients for food production.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales.

She has been doing the milk business for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Currently she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

Asmat aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she at present owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Alejandra Vanessa

texts.es: Alejandra es una mujer emprendedora de 34 años de edad, casada y  madre de un hijo por el que trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante con sus esfuerzos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapato desde hace ocho años, Ella ha mostrado ser una mujer responsable y puntual con los pagos de créditos anteriores, esta vez solicita el financiamiento numero trece de la institución porque quiere invertir en la compra de pacas de camisas, pantalones, chores, faldas y sabanas, con créditos anteriores logro hacer un mejoramiento en la infraestructura de su vivienda. Su nuevo proyecto es tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Alejandra is an entrepreneurial woman. She is 34 years old, is married and is the mother of one child. She works every day to carry her family forward. She has worked selling clothes and shoes for the past eight years. She has proven to be a responsible woman and has been punctual in paying off her previous loans.

She is asking for her thirteenth loan from the institution because she wants to invest in the purchase of bundles of shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, and sheets. With her previous loans she was able to make improvements to the infrastructure of her home. Her new project is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy bundles of shirts, pants, shorts, skirts and sheets.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a long time, he wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Because of this, he is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw’s body.
 
Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business. Musarat is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community.

She has been doing the tailoring business for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, etc., to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is applying for a loan of $ 1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of clothes in center of the market, so every day many people come to buy her clothes, because she sells modern clothes.

She started to do this business a few years ago, with her own working capital. Delia is earning a good income from her business, and now she wants to add more clothes with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin such as shirts, turtleneck shirts, jackets, skirts, pants, shorts, distribution, and others.

loans.use: to buy shirts, turtleneck shirts, jackets, skirts, pants, shorts, distribution, and others.

loans.name: Julieta De Los Angeles

texts.es: Julieta es una microempresaria exitosa de 33 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de 3 y 4 años, quienes son su mayor motivación para crecer económicamente en su negocio, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace tres años, cuenta con la ayuda económica de su esposo y solicita por tercer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución porque desea invertir en la oferta de productos como arroz, aceite, azúcar, avena, pan y huevo. Una de sus metas es abrir una segunda pulpería en un punto estratégico para satisfacer la demanda. Con el crédito anterior logro fortalecer el negocio y comprar un televisor.
texts.en:
Julieta is a successful micro-entrepreneur. She is 33 years old, is married and is the mother of two children, aged 3 and 4 years old. Her children are her greatest motivation for growing her business economically. She is the owner of a small grocery store located in her home. She has had this business for three years. Her husband also supports her economically.

She is requesting her third loan from the institution because she wants to invest in a supply of products such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, oats, bread and eggs. One of her goals is to open a second small grocery store in a strategic location in order to meet demand. With her previous loan she was able to improve her business and buy a new television.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar, oats, bread and eggs.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 53 years old. She is married and blessed with seven children.

Her business is a retail shop and a boutique. She has been in the business for 16 years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is her fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of cereal, fertilizers, and bags for the shop. She will use the profits from expanded business to improve her home and pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve standard of living of her family and build permanent premises.

loans.use: to buy stock of cereal, fertilizers, and bags for the shop.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to grow the fund used for her food stall business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenses.

She is very positive that she could improve her business if you will lend her an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will be used for more raw ingredients and supplies that she needs to make more viands and food to sell so she can increase the profit from her business. An increase in profit will also help her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Blesilda aims to be able to save for the future of her children. She also wants their lives to be improved and successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her recipes and other materials needed in cooking or selling

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 59-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for many years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs.

She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. Balqees is a motivated mother of five children. She is responsible for providing them with good quality food, health, and clothing.

For the improvement of her business, she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads, and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders, leather covers, threads, and needles in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.name: Repay On Time Group

texts.en:
Tâm is 40 years old and she is married with two children. Tâm lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover the market need is low in this region.

She has had a retail business, selling dry food and general things, for seven years. The main hardship that Tâm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

In 2014, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "Repay on time" group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Tâm hopes for her children to do well in school, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a 55-year-old, married woman. She has been engaged in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and along with packs of beads, sequins and stones, which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently

loans.name: Alhaji Usaini

texts.en:
Alhaji  Usaini is a maize farmer from Badamasi village. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji  Usaini is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji  Usaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Alhaji  Usaini can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Alhaji  Usaini no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Alhaji  Usaini hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Armayau

texts.en:
Armayau is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Armayau is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 
Traditionally, Armayau would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Armayau will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Armayau now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhaji Gambo

texts.en:
Alhaji Gambo is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Gambo has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Gambo would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Alhaji Gambo can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Gambo will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Alhaji Gambo is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is maize farmer from rural village. As a member of Babban Gona, John is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 
Before joining Babban Gona, John would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, John can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
John is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Marta Patricia

texts.es:
Marta administra su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pequeña tienda de productos varios, tiene su local en el mercado municipal, su jornada de trabajo es de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, no tiene más ingresos que los genera con su negocio, Marta es soltera y no tiene hijos, más sin embargo tiene la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus padres.
El préstamo será de mucha ayuda para comprar boquitas, bebidas, dulces, huevos, harina, azúcar, etc., tendrá un inventario más surtido para atender diariamente las peticiones de sus clientes, considera que si continua administrando bien su negocio podrá sacar el mayor provecho de la inversión y tendrá mejores ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio más competitivo con el que pueda continuar progresando y dándoles una vida más confortable a sus padres.
texts.en:
Marta manages her own business, which consists of a small store with a variety of products. She has her space in the municipal market. Her work schedule is from six in the morning to four in the afternoon. She does not have an income other than what she earns from her business. Marta is single and doesn't have any children, but she has the responsibility of getting her parents ahead. 

The loan will be a lot of help for buying snacks, drinks, sweets, eggs, flour, sugar, etc.; she will have a better-stocked inventory to attend to her customers' requests on a daily basis. She thinks that if she continues managing her business well, she will be able to take advantage of the investment and have better earnings. Her aspirations are to have a more competitive business with which she will be able to continue progressing and giving her parents a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, drinks, sweets, eggs, flour, sugar, etc., to have a better-stocked inventory to attend to her customers' requests on a daily basis.

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es:
Marta tiene 55 años y es viuda, pero a pesar de esto, ha logrado sacar su familia adelante. Tiene 3 hijos a los cuales ama y por los cuales lucha por salir adelante. Lamentablemente enfrenta ciertas dificultades económicas que le han complicado la vida, pero tiene toda la fortaleza para salir adelante.

Tiene gran talento para la cocina, y sueña con algún día tener su propio negocio, para esto ha decidido estudiar para mejorar sus habilidades culinarias y dar el paso que necesita para comenzar su propio restaurante. Pide hoy un préstamo que le permita pagar sus estudios en cocina express.

Ayuda hoy a Marta con el préstamo que necesita para comience sus estudios, y pueda empezar a hacer sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
Marta is 55 years old and is widowed. Despite this, she has been able to carry her family forward. She has three children whom she loves and for whom she fights to get ahead. Unfortunately, she faces some economic difficulties which have complicated her life but, she has all of the strength necessary to move forward.

She has a great talent for cooking and her dream is to one day have her own business. This is why she has decided to study to improve her culinary skills and take the steps she needs to open her own restaurant. Today she is asking for a loan which will allow her to pay for the "Cocina Express" cooking class offered through Interactuar.

Help Marta today with the loan she needs to begin her studies so she can begin to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to pay for her studies in the "Cocina Express" cooking class.

loans.name: Noong Het 21 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy, 30, is a Thai ethnic lady who has been married and become the mother of two girls. She lives with her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small village where the main production generating income is agriculture.

Like other villagers, she works very hard at farming and animal husbandry, with several activities such as growing rice and breeding buffalo, pigs, chickens and ducks while her husband works as a commune official. Her husband sometimes supports her in farming.

This is the third time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy food for the cattle that she is raising. She hopes that the animals will grow fast and healthily and then bring a good income for her family. Mrs Thuy dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a bright future for her children. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for the cattle that she is raising

loans.name: For A Better Life Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lai is 60 years old and she is married with three children. She has had a retail business selling electronic goods for three years. Lai lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village and the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Lai faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more electronic goods to resell.

In 2014, Lai joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lai has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "For A Better Life" group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, Lai hopes for her children to find a good job, to travel for vacation internationally, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more electronic goods to resell.

loans.name: Rael Jelimo

texts.en:
Rael is 28 years old, married to David, and blessed with two children, aged eight and three years old. She has been in the clothes selling business for five years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more dresses, blouses, skirts and trousers for resale in the market.

With the anticipated profits, Rael will be able to help her husband in paying school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more dresses, blouses, skirts and trousers for resale in the market

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda is 39 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Eda has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Eda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is 26 years old and married. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work as a seamstress. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her tailoring business to meet her household expenses. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday needs. She has now requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors for sewing more dresses to get a boost in her earnings. She wishes to spend the extra money on providing a quality life for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbon, cloth, needles, and scissors to sew more dresses.

loans.name: Smile Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dung is 43 years old and she is married with two children. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for five years.

Dung lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and moreover, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Dung faces is a lack of capital. She has no collateral so can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

In 2014, Dung joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the Smile group, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell

loans.name: Tunas Muda Tolnaku Group

texts.en:
The Tunas Muda Tolnaku group is made up of 6 energetic women. Most of the members are farmers and traders in the traditional market. Yuliana, 37 (on the right side, with a dark brown blouse), is the representative of the Tunas Muda Tolnaku group. She is married to Claudius, a 41-year-old priest in the village. Yuliana owns a business of selling cakes and snacks at school. The business aims to support her husband in covering their living expenses and in providing a good education for their 4 children, whose ages are between 4 to 10 years old. Three of them are still enrolled in elementary school.
In addition to being a priest, Claudius also grows crops on the farm so that they have another income source. Besides using her skill to produce and sell cakes and snacks, Yuliana is thinking of selling food such as yellow rice with side dishes. She is sure this business will be profitable in the future. She was interested when a neighbor informed her about the group loan product provided by TLM. Along with 5 other women, she formed the Tunas Muda Tolnaku group, and they requested a loan of 10,500,000 IDR from Kiva through TLM. Like Yuliana, the other women would like to invest their portions for their businesses and interests. They are sure the loan will be beneficial for improving their business.

loans.use: to buy food and cake ingredients such as rice, eggs, vegetables, and flour

loans.name: Ana Magdalena

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan  que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 13 y 11 años de edad,  los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica al reciclaje.
Doña Ana es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse la vida y más aun si es junto a su marido, ellos se dedican al reciclaje, recorren la ciudad en un carro de su propiedad recogiendo  material reciclable como cartón, hierro, aluminio, plásticos, entre  otros materiales,  también le compran a otros recicladores de la zona a quienes les pagan a buen precio y que después venden a una empresa  recicladora en la ciudad que le  compran a ellos y con esto se ganan el sustento diario.
Este crédito es para comprar más material reciclable, cartón, bronce, hierro entre otros. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
The San Juan credit group meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of San Juan in the city of Manta which is known for it's beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by local and foreign tourists. Most of the inhabitants in this area work in the fishing industry.

This is where Ana lives. She is 40 years old, is married and has three children from this marriage, aged 16, 13, and 11 years old. Her two oldest children are in high school. Her husband works in recycling.

Ana is a woman who likes to work and earn a living and even more so if she can do it together with her husband. They work in recycling, going all over the city in their own car collecting recyclable materials such as cardboard, iron, aluminum, plastic and other materials. They also buy from other recyclers in the area to whom they pay a good price. Afterwards, they sell these materials to a recycling company in the city who buys the materials from them. This is how they earn their daily bread.

This loan will be used to buy more recyclable material, cardboard, bronze, and iron, among others. She has been in the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans help her very much. Her dream is to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy recyclable material, cardboard, bronze, iron, etc.

loans.name: Lucely Janeth

texts.es:
Lucely es una mujer de 38 años de edad, se dedicó inicialmente al negocio de las confecciones en el cual duro tres años como operaria, después de pasar este periodo de tiempo inicio manejando un taller con un amigo el cual le enseño el oficio y la guiaba en todo el proceso para adquirir su propio negocio. 

Es madre de tres hijos. Hace poco tiempo es una mujer independiente que gracias a los micro créditos tiene la posibilidad de ser su propia jefe y generar un empleo pues su pecera es reconocida por su buen servicio al cliente; solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para confección y pago de una máquina de confección, pues tiene un muy buen espacio el cual por la falta de capital no es aprovechado de la mejor manera, su principal sueño es tener un taller con muy buena producción.
texts.en:
Lucely is a 38-year-old woman. She initially worked as an operator at a sewing business for three years. After that time she started managing a workshop with a friend who taught her the business and guided her through the process of acquiring her own business. 

She is the mother of three children. For a short time she has been an independent woman who, thanks to microloans, has the opportunity to be her own boss and to create a job, as her workshop is well known for its good customer service. She is asking for the loan to buy supplies for sewing and to pay for a sewing machine, as she has a very good space that she is not taking advantage of due to her lack of capital. Her biggest dream is to have a workshop with a very good production.

loans.use: to buy supplies for sewing and to pay for a sewing machine

loans.name: Yurley Alejandra

texts.es:
En el municipio de Abejorra, habitan muchas personas emprendedoras y trabajadoras con las ganas y fuerzas para salir adelante y luchar por un buen futuro; una de ellas es Yurley, una mujer que con su carisma y gran capacidad de trabajo ha podido superar varios obstáculos que se le han presentado en su vida.

Tiene un pequeñísimo negocio de fabricación y venta de closets artesanales en su propia casa, oficio que inicio como un hobbie pero que poco a poco se convirtió en una fuente de ingreso real para el sostenimiento de su pequeño hijo de 2 años.

Ella, siendo una madre muy joven, no tiene mucha experiencia, pero tiene un gran corazón y energía para su bebe.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera y cinta para armar los closets.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Abejorra live many entrepreneurial and hard-working people with the will and strength to get ahead and work for a good future. One of them is Yurley, a woman who with her charisma and great capacity for work has been able to overcome various obstacles that have been presented to her in her life.

She has a small business of making and selling artisanal wardrobes in her own house, work that she began as a hobby but that little by little became a source of real income for the support of her little 2-year-old son.

Being a very young mother, she doesn't have much experience, but she has a big heart and energy for her baby.

She is applying for a loan for the purchase of wood and tape to assemble the wardrobes.

loans.use: to buy wood and tape to assemble wardrobes

loans.name: Leotrim

texts.en:
Leotrim is the father of four children and is the main source of income. He is a stone smith, working with stone to enhance gardens, yards and as decorations for public and private buildings and companies. He has been in business for 10 years now and is very satisfied with the income and his work.

At this time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for his work. With the investment, he will be able to offer better products and more variety for his clients and provide them with a better service. He is confident that the loan will help him to then increase his profit and client base, which will be used to help improve the living conditions and standards for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his work so he will be able to offer better products and more variety to  his clients and provide them with better service.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Flora is from the community of Garcia Hernandez, in Bohol, Philippines. She raises hogs and grows vegetables as her source of income. From this business, she earns an income of PHP 5,000 per month.

She is asking for a loan to further expand her business. She will use it to increase her hogs, stock more feed and buy fertilizer for her farm. Flora hope to increase her business investments someday for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with seven children. She operates a retail shop. She started with 150,000 shillings she got from her husband, but her stock has improved and increased. She is doing fairly well, but is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations faced by many retailers.

Jane has an aspiration of constructing a residential house for her family that is so urgent at this time. Thus, she needs a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, timber and other items to assist her in building her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks, timber and other items to assist her in building her house.

loans.name: Sonia De Jesus

texts.es:
Sonia con 37 años, radicada en una zona rural del municipio de El Santuario, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres, lleva varios años con su propia cría de pollos para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con aumentar el número de pollos para criar y solicito a la Corporación un crédito con el que adquirirá varios de estos animales y los insumos para la alimentación de estos, las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales serán mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.
texts.en:
Sonia is 38 years old. She resides in a rural area of the municipality of El Santuario. She has always worked in the agriculture sector along with her family where she learned these activities. She has been raising chickens on her own for a number of years to sell and distribute in various areas of her community.

She dreams of increasing the number of chickens to raise so she is requesting a loan from the Corporation to buy a number of these animals and the supplies to feed them. The profit earned from the increase in animals will be much greater and this will allow her to have a better living standard without so much economic difficulty.

loans.use: to acquire a number of chickens and supplies to feed them.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 50 years old and a married woman. She is been involved in the business of clothes trade. She purchases variety of fancy clothes at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Saima has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She wants to buy greater variety of fancy and embroidered clothes in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of fancy and embroidered clothes in different colors for her business to get a boost in her earnings

loans.name: Luisa Fernanda

texts.es:
Luisa, a sus 18 años de edad es soltera y vive con sus padres.  
Desde que tenía 16 años, ella comenzó a laborar en el campo de la confección, pues le colaboraba a una Tía que tenía una empresa grande y allí se encargaba de pulir y revisar las prendas, cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad fue vinculada a la empresa, donde laboró por algunos años. 

Hace unos meses, Luisa se independizó y montó su taller con gran empuje y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar una máquina plana industrial, con el fin de brindarle a sus clientes una prenda bien elaborada y con excelente terminación, así aumentará los contratos y podrá generar mayores ingresos para poder cumplir el sueño de tener una línea propia, además de brindar oportunidades de empleo a otras  personas. 

Ella sabe que Interactuar es un gran apoyo para el crecimiento de su empresa!
texts.en:
Luisa is 18 years old, is single and lives with her parents. When she was 16 years old, she started working in the field of sewing, as she was working with an aunt who had a large business. She was in charge of polishing and checking the clothing there; when she became an adult she joined the company, where she worked for a few years. A few months ago, Luisa became independent and opened her own workshop with great effort and a great desire to get ahead.

With the loan she has asked for, she wants to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to provide her customers with well-made and excellently-finished clothing. In this way she will increase her orders and be able to generate more earnings to achieve her dream of having her own clothing line, in addition to providing employment opportunities for other people. She knows that Interactuar is a great support for the growth of her business!

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to provide her customers with well-made and excellently-finished clothing

loans.name: Mensur

texts.en:
Mensur comes from the Roma community. He earns a living through his small business selling fruit and vegetables. He purchases the produce cheap and then sells it at a higher price to make a profit. He also has a greenhouse, and usually, after the month of May, he sells his own homegrown, fresh produce to customers and to a local restaurant he has a deal with. He is very happy with his business and enjoys what he does.

At this time he is in need of a loan in order to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell so that he can continue to provide for his family in the winter months, before his greenhouse produce is ready. He has many loyal clients and knows that he will be able to make a good profit, and he needs to continue to sell to them so he doesn't lose any business or loyalty. He looks forward to expanding his business in the future and appreciates the help from the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to resell so that he can continue to provide for his family in the winter months before his greenhouse produce is ready.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es una persona que estudia y se sacrifica siempre para poder salir adelante. comenta que tuvo que cambiar su carrera de ingeniería de alimentos a licenciatura de laboratorio, ya que por razones a ajenas a ella tuvo que hacerlo.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y así poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Andrea is from the city of San Lorenzo. She is a person who always studies and sacrifices to be able to get ahead. She comments that she had to change her major from food engineering to a lab technician due to reasons beyond her control.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to invest in the payment of the fees for her studies and thus be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de Nutrición, y comenta que desea es ser una profesional independiente y mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera ayudar a su familia y a los más necesitados.
Ella es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que pone todo de sí. Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Carmen is from the city of San Ignacio. She is studying in the nutrition program, and she comments that her wish is to be an independent professional and improve her income and in this way help her family and the most needy.

She is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead, and she puts all of herself into this.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the bills for her program and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university bills.

loans.name: Vilma Doris

texts.es:
La señora Vilma Doris de 37 años de edad, es casada tiene 03 hijos que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de Cuajada y Queso, también a la elaboración y venta de pan, rosquillas hojaldras  tamales, sus ventas son de lunes a sábado de forma ambulante en los barrios y caseríos de su comunidad ya que es conocida por ser una persona honesta, radica en Playa Grande ubicada en la zona sur de Honduras, Municipio de Nacaome, Valle.

Doña Vilma esta solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en Mejora de su vivienda y que está construyendo unos cuartos para sus hijos y en la compra de leche para la elaboración de cuajada y queso, con el apoyo del crédito ella pretende mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos estén un poco mejor en la casa además de mejorar sus ingresos es su Noveno (09) crédito que solicita.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa para poder hacer cada dia mejor su castillo ya que para ella su casa es su castillo y cada dia quiere verlo mucho mejor.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre 2015.
texts.en:
Vilma Doris, who is 37 years old, is married and has 3 children who depend on her. She has her own home, and has worked for a long time in the sale of curd and cheese. She also makes and sells bread, donuts, pastry, and tamales. Her sales are from Monday to Saturday as a street vendor in the neighborhoods and country houses in her community. She is known to be an honest person. She lives in Playa Grande, located in the south region of Honduras, Municipality of Nacaome, Valle.
Vilma is asking for the loan to invest in improving her house, as she is building some rooms for her children, and to buy milk to make curd and cheese. With the help of the loan, she hopes to improve her house and that her children are a littler bit better in the house, as well as improving her profits with this ninth loan that she has requested.
Her dream is to improve her business and her home, to improve her castle every day, because for her the house is her castle, and she wants to see it looking better every day.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2015.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and milk for her curd.

loans.name: Alexandra Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan  que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 6 y 4  años de edad, los  mismos que estudian en escuela. Su marido es chofer.
Doña Alexandra es una mujer muy trabajadora  que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con sus ingresos poder ayudar a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar y sus hijos, para esto ella trabaja en un centro de belleza, pero para generar más ingresos ella también vende  ropa de todo tipo así como también maquillajes y artículos para el cuidado y belleza personal,  ella sale a vender en sus ratos libres y también vende en su trabajo, allí ropa,  ella deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas,  maquillajes, entre otros. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 4 ciclos  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The loan group "San Juan" meets every two weeks in the San Juan neighborhood in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are much visited in every season of the year by both national and foreign tourists. The majority of the residents of this place work in fishing and maritime jobs.

Señora Alexandra lives in this place. She is 23 years old. She is married and from this relationship she has two children, ages 6 and 4, who are in school. Her husband is a driver.

Doña Alexandra is a very hard-working woman who likes to fend for herself and with her income be able to help her husband raise their children and move their household forward. To do this, she works in a beauty center, but in order to generate more income, she also sells clothing of all types, as well as make-up, articles for personal care, and beauty products. She goes out to sell in her free time and also sells clothing at her workplace. She leaves items on credit and collects weekly.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and make-up, among other items. She has been in the loan group for four loan cycles, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to give the best to her little ones.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, make-up, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Cruz Elena

texts.es:
Cruz a sus 49 años de edad ve su sueño cumplirse, el cual es ser una persona independiente y competitiva en el mercado, gracias a la incursión de la Corporación Interactuar en su vida, pudo lograr este sueño y montó una cría y venta de pollos en un corral de su casa. 

Por lo que hoy solicita un crédito que invertirá en la compra de pollos para la cría y alimento para los mismos. 

Es madre de 3 hijos a los que sueña poder pagarles una buena educación. Cruz como buena madre siempre estará a su lado apoyándolos incondicionalmente, por eso esta tan determinado en triunfar en este nuevo proceso de su vida.
texts.en:
At 49 years old, Cruz sees her dreams becoming a reality. Her dream is to be an independent person and to be competitive in the market. Thanks to the involvement of Interactuar in her life, she was able to achieve this dream and started a business raising and selling chickens in a corral in her home. Today she is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of chickens for breeding and feed for said chickens.

She is the mother of three children for whom she dreams of being able to pay for a good education. As a good mother, Cruz will always be by their side supporting them unconditionally. This is why she is so determined to triumph in this new phase of her life.

loans.use: to buy chickens for breeding and chicken feed.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila es estudiante de la carrera de ciencias contables, y actualmente está trabajando para solventar sus gastos de universidad, con miras a independizarse como contadora.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar y ser una buena profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de universidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Zoila is studying for a degree in accounting science, and currently she is working to pay for her university expenses, looking to become independent as an accountant.
She is a very selfless person that gives all her effort to improve and become a good professional.
She asks for this loan to be able to pay university fees and in this way continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es una persona muy sacrificada que lucha y esfuerza para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, estudia arduamente su carrera de Derecho, y por medio de su carrera pone todo de si para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar los útiles de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a selfless person who fights and works hard to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She is arduously studying law. By way of her studies, she gives all of herself in order to improve her living conditions.

She is asking for this loan to pay for university supplies in order to continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy university supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de Contabilidad, está estudiando el último año de la carrera, ella trabaja en un estudio contable como auxiliar y aspira recibirse el próximo año y comenzar a ejercer de forma profesional.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is an accounting student. She is studying in the last year of the program. She works in an accounting firm as an assistant, and she aspires to graduate next year and begin to work as a professional.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the bills for her program and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university bills

loans.name: Nury Adriana

texts.es:
Con la ilusión de salir adelante y superarse, Nury desea montar un negocio de panadería en un local ubicado en el municipio de Marinilla.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Aunque ella siempre ha querido ser independiente, nunca había tenido el valor de arriesgarse a iniciar con un negocio; pero ahora se siente con la fuerza y capacidad para hacerlo.

Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar todos los elementos necesarios para el montaje de su negocio tales como 1 congelador, un horno, insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de panes.

Con estos elementos podrá iniciar con este proyecto y podrá cumplir así su sueño de ser independiente.

Con el apoyo a este crédito estarás impulsando las ideas emprendedoras de una madre colombiana!
texts.en:
Aiming to get ahead and improve herself, Nury wishes to set up a bakery business in a shop located in the municipality of Marinilla. This idea was born out of the need to generate the  income needed to maintain her household. Although she has always wanted to be independent, she never had the courage to risk starting a new business. Now, however, she feels strong and able to do it.

Nury is applying for a loan to buy all elements needed to set up her business, such as a freezer, an oven, inputs and ingredients to make bread. With these elements, she will be able to start this project and thus realize her dream of being independent. 

With your support of this loan, you will be promoting the entrepreneurial ideas of a Colombian mother!

loans.use: to buy all elements needed to set up her business, such as a freezer, an oven, inputs and ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en: Dila is a villager from the northern part of the country; she is a married mother of two and a retiree on a little pension of $100/monthly. She and her family own about 7 dynyms (about 7,000 square meters) of agricultural land, where she plants mainly fodder and corn for the animals and also has some orchards (peaches, nectarines, citrus, and grapevines). In the front and back yard, she plants vegetables for her family's consumption. She had a dairy cow before, but last February someone stole it and she needs to replace it. In addition to the cow, she has always managed to have three pigs and use them for the family, not to sell. Dila said to the loan officer, "I make fodder, I feed the pigs, and I sell the rest. So far, I have been selling 200 bales of lucerne (alfalfa) at a price of $27/bale. Hence, all in all, I make from this roughly $5400/year." Dila lives with her retired husband and their younger son.

loans.use: to replace a stolen dairy cow and build a fence around the house to prevent thieves from coming to the barn and stealing again.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley es una joven estudiante, es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive con sus padres, es una persona trabajadora, honesta y  responsable es muy dedicada al estudio, desea sobresalir adelante profesionalmente a través de los logros obtenidos por medio de su carrera de farmacia. Su meta es de tener su título y poder trabajar. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios esforzándose por ser alguien en la vida. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Shirley is a young student from the city of Santani. She lives with her parents and is a hardworking, honest and responsible person. She is very dedicated to her studies and hopes to get ahead professionally by means of the successes she has achieved in her pharmacology studies.

Her goal is to earn her degree and be able to work. She is asking for a loan to pay for the fees for her degree, and in this way, be able to continue with her studies; making an effort to be successful in life. She is thankful for this opportunity that she has to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Let Children Go To School Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 51 years old, married and has two children. The family lives in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province, in which her family is counted as a low-income household. She is also the leader of this three-member group called Let Children Go To School.

For more than ten years Thủy has sold incense and ghost money, or joss paper. Her job is an unreliable one for a stable income. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital.

In the past, since Thủy had no collateral she was unable to obtain a loan from surrounding banks or credit institutions. So in 2009 she joined Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa to access its loans, and so far she has taken out and successfully repaid six.

Now Thủy is requesting a 40,000,000 VND loan to be apportioned among her group members. She will use her share to buy supplies to make incense and ghost money to sell. With her profits Thủy hopes to renovate her house, for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make incense and ghost money to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Floresmila

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan  que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
Allí Vive la señora Blanca, tiene 57 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo mayor de edad que vive en su casa. 
Doña Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta a base de trabajo y con sus recursos ayudar a su familia salir adelante,  ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, sale por ratos y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 2  años en su negocio el cual mejora cada vez que recibe los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante trabajando para así no depender de nadie si no de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The loan group "San Juan" meets every two weeks in the San Juan neighborhood of the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches that are much visited in every season of the year by both national and foreign tourists. In this place, the majority of the inhabitants work in fishing and maritime jobs.

Señora Blanca lives there. She is 57 years old. She is the single mother of an adult son who lives in her house.

Doña Blanca is a very hard-working woman who likes to help her family get ahead with her work and her resources. She works in commerce. She sells clothing of all types. Her form of sales is door-to-door. She goes out at intervals and also sells in her house. She leaves items on credit and collects every week. She has been in her business for more than two years, and it improves every time she receives a loan.

She is going to use this loan to buy pants, blouses, and t-shirts, among other items that she sells. She has been in the loan group for two years, and she likes it because the loans allow her to get ahead. Her dreams are to continue working so that she won't have to depend on anyone, only on her work.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Flerida Felisa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Flerida, tiene 52 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen 6  hijos,  5 mayores d edad y el menor de 8 años el cual estudia en escuela. El marido es chofer.
