Doña Flerida es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para obtener sus propios recursos y así poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, interiores y zapatos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 15  años en su negocio el cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución por lo cual está muy agradecida con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa interior y zapatos. Lleva más de 15 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
The loan group San Juan meets every 15 days in the neighborhood San Juan in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited in every season of the year by national and foreign tourists. In this place the majority of the citizens work in fishery and jobs of the sea.
Here lives Flerida, she is 52 years old, she is married and from this relationship she has six children, five who are adults and and eight-year-old who goes to school. Her husband is a driver.
Flerida is a woman who likes to be independent and to obtain her own resources, and be able to help her husband with household expenses. She works in retail, and she sells all type of clothing, underwear, and shoes. Her sales strategy is door to door. She sells on credit and collects every eight days. She has had her business for 15 years, which she started with the first loan she received from the institution, which is why she is very grateful to the people who help her with the loans.
She will use this loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, and shoes. She has been with the loan group for more than 15 years, and she likes it because they allow her to get ahead. Her dreams are to give the best to her little son.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, underwear, and shoes.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and has six school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water and school fees for the children.

For the past ten years, Mariam has operated a business buying and selling meat goats, selling to the butchers around her residential area.

Mariam faces the major challenges of goat sicknesses and drought.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en: Hamdi is the father of four children and is the main source of income for his family. He is employed as a security guard and also has an orchard with various fruits and most recently hazelnuts. He does all the work by himself in the orchard, planting, harvesting and selling the fruit. At this time he is requesting a loan to purchase seedlings to plant his fruit so that he will harvest even more crops and increase his profit. He is very hardworking and hopes in the near future to be able to hire an employee to assist him. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings to plant his fruit so that he will harvest even more crops and increase his profit.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, además está trabajando de manera a poder tener los ingresos y cubrir sus gastos de la universidad.
Comenta que quiere ser un buen profesional, y por medio de sus conocimientos abrirse camino en el mundo laboral y poder crecer en su lugar de trabajo.
Pide este préstamo, ya que desea poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, y seguir con de esa manera con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jorge is studying for a degree in law. He is also working in order to be able to have an income and pay for his university expenses.
He says he wants to be good professional, and through his knowledge, open his way in the working world and be able to grow in his place of work.
He is asking for this loan, as he wants to cover the fees of his degree, and in this way continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora, está estudiando la carrera de medicina, quiere ser un médico cirujano, y es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder seguir creciendo.
Él quiere culminar su carrera para poder ayudar a las demás personas y luego de terminar sus estudios quiere seguir capacitándose para poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales de estudios, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Gustavo comes from a humble, hardworking family. He is studying for a degree in medicine, he wants to be a surgeon, and he is putting all of himself into this to keep growing.

He wants to achieve his degree in order to help other people, and upon completion of his studies he would like to continue with training in order to move forward. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to buy study materials and thus continue striving towards his goals.

loans.use: to buy study materials for his degree in medicine.

loans.name: María Dioselina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 48 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos, tres mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 12 años que estudian en colegio. El marido se dedica al reciclaje.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta de alguna forma colaborar con su marido para salir adelante, es por esta razón que ella realiza el crédito  para que su esposo lo utilice en su actividad, él se  dedica al reciclaje, el sale en su carro por toda la ciudad recogiendo  embases de plástico, aluminio, hierro, cartón y todo tipo de material que pueda ser reutilizado,  el también les compra a otros recicladores para luego al final del día llevar lo que ha recolectado a una empresa que compra estos artículos. Así el obtiene sus ganancias que le sirven   para sacar  adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar embases plásticos, aluminio, cartón,  hierro entre otras cosas que sirven para reciclaje. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho a su marido. Sus sueños son seguir adelante luchando día a día.
texts.en:
The loan group San Juan meets every 15 days in the neighborhood San Juan in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are frequently visited in every season of the year by national and foreign tourists. In this place the majority of the citizens work in fishery and jobs of the sea.
Here lives Maria, she is 48 years old, and is in a common-law relationship from which she has five children. Three of them are adults, and two are 17 and 12, and study in high school. Her husband works in recycling.
Maria is a woman who likes to collaborate in a way with her husband to get ahead. It is for this reason that she is taking out this loan, so that her husband will use it in his occupation. He work in recycling. He takes his cart out throughout the city, picking up plastic containers, aluminum, iron, cardboard, and all sorts of materials that can be reused. He also buys from other recyclers, and at the end of the day takes what he has collected to a company that buys these items. In this way he obtains an income, which is useful to help his family get ahead.
This loan is to buy plastic containers, aluminum, cardboard, and iron, among other things that can be recycled. She has been in the loan group for 5 cycles, and she likes it because the loans are very helpful for her husband. Her dreams are to keep moving forward, working hard day to day.

loans.use: to buy plastic containers, aluminum, cardboard, iron, etc. to recycle.

loans.name: Daniel Maximiliano

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive el señor Daniel, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva cinco ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para seguir adelante.
Don Daniel es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos, el tienen una  tienda de víveres en la casa de sus padres,  allí venden junto a su mamá todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también artículos de bazar papelería y útiles escolares, helados, entre otros víveres, también productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), los cuales venden allí en su local y también su mamá sale a vender por la localidad, de esta forma el logra ganarse algo y colabora con su madre para generara ingresos para su hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres y productos Avon. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su local.
texts.en:
The San Juan credit group meets every two weeks in the San Juan neighborhood in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches frequented year-round by tourists. The majority of residents here make a living from fishing and other work at sea.

Daniel, 22, lives here. He is single and lives in his parents' house. He's been through five cycles with the credit group and he likes that they are helping him get ahead.

Daniel is a hard-working young man who likes to work and have his own resources. He has a convenience store in his parents' house where he and his mother sell all types of basic necessities, as well as stationary and school supplies, frozen treats and other food, as well as Avon products (beauty products for women). His mother also sells Avon products around town. This is how Daniel is able to earn something and collaborate with his mother to generate income for the home.

This loan is to buy to food and Avon products, as he dreams of continuing to improve his store.

loans.use: buy food and Avon products.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Janet es de la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando el 3er. año de la carrera Ingeniería Industrial, a la par que estudia también trabaja para poder salir adelante.
Su meta y sueño es tener su propia empresa o trabajar en una institución pública, tener un buen ingreso para ayudar a mi familia, y crecer como profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Janet is from the city of Pilar and is in her third year studying industrial engineering. While studying, she also works in order to get ahead.

Her goal and dream is to have her own business or to work in a public institution, to earn a good income to help her family, and to grow professionally.

She is asking for this loan to pay for university fees and in doing so, be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Johanna Listeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Johanna, tiene 27 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres. Ella lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para seguir adelante y mejorar su vida.
Doña Johana es una mujer que le siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos y con estos salir adelante y ayudar a sus padres, ella se dedica a la venta de recargas y tarjetas telefónicas de varias operadoras, realiza esta actividad ya sea en su casa o en cualquier parte ya que desde su teléfono ella realiza las recargas, tiene mucha clientela que a veces solo le envían un mensaje y ella les recarga el servicio, de esta forma ella luego les cobra y gana más clientela ya que ofrece el mejor servicio  y les ayuda en emergencias que sus cliente tengan.
Este crédito es para comprar recargas y tarjetas telefónicas. Sus sueños son tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The San Juan credit group meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of San Juan in the city of Manta which is known for it's beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by local and foreign tourists. Most of the inhabitants in this area work in the fishing industry.

This is where Johanna lives. She is 27 years old, is single and lives in her parent's home. She has been in the credit group for eight years and she likes it because of the help that they provide through loans that allow her to move forward and improve her life.

Johanna is a woman who has always liked to work in order to earn her own means which allow her to move forward and help her parents. She works selling phone credits and calling cards from various providers. She carries out her business in her home or in other areas since she sells the phone credits from her phone. She has many clients who sometimes just send her a message and she sends them credits. In doing this, she gets paid by them later and gains more clients because she offers the best service and helps her clients in whatever emergency they may be in.

This loan will be used to buy phone credits and calling cards. Her dream is to have her own storefront in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy phone credits and calling cards.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel, 48, is married and has six children, one of whom is still in school. For the past year she has worked hard at fishing in the Philippines to earn a living.

Maribel has applied for an 8,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy a fishing net, gasoline for her boat and other supplies for her business. She would like to build up her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, gasoline for her boat and other supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en:
Radilla is 54 years old, married and has two children. To earn an income and help her husband provide for the family, she runs a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Radilla wants the best for her children. To achieve this dream, she must increase her income. That's why she has applied for a 30,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner GDMPC to buy more goods to sell and so increase her income. Her plan for the future is to renovate her house for safer living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her sari-sari, or small general store.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Isaac Leonardo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Oro Verde se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive el señor Isaac, tiene 19 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de los padres. El lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten ganarse la vida.
Don Isaac es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta trabajar y así lograr sus propios recursos, el tienen un bar billar en su casa donde venden colas, jugos, aguas, cervezas y bocadillos de picar a quienes a diario llegan hasta este lugar a entretenerse y distraerse un rato del duro día de trabajo,   allí trabaja todos los días en horas de la tarde y parte de la noche que es cuando las personas ya salen de sus labores y acuden hasta su casa a distraerse y conversar entre amigos.
Este crédito es para comprar colas, aguas, jugos y bocadillos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando su negocio y su vida para cuando le toque formar su hogar propio.
texts.en:
The Oro Verde credit group meets every two weeks in the neighborhood of Perpetuo Socorro in the city of Manta which is known for it's beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by local and foreign tourists. Most of the inhabitants in this area work in the fishing industry.

This is where Isaac lives. He is 19 years old, is single, and lives with his parents. He has been part of the credit group for four cycles and he likes it because the loans allow him to earn a living.

Isaac is a very hardworking young man who likes to work in order to earn his own means. He has a pool hall and bar in his house where he sells soda, juice, water, beer, and snacks to those who come to this place every day to entertain themselves and distract themselves for a little from a hard day of work. He works there every day for some hours in the afternoon and then at night, which is when people get out of work and go to his house to distract themselves and talk with their friends.

He will use this loan to buy soda, water, juice and snacks. His dream is to continue to improve his business and his life for when he has his own family.

loans.use: to buy soda, water, juice and snacks.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 43 years old and married with two children. For the past ten years she has worked hard running a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. She also earns money through food vending.

Leonarda has taken out and successfully repaid nine prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 18,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She is working to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
Véronique vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit, avec lequel , elle a pu renforcer le fonds de roulement du commerce de friperie. 
A part la friperie et la vente des chaussures à l'occasion, elle exerce aussi une autre activité: élevage de poulet de chair et porcin. Après une petite pause, elle a repris l’élevage de poulet de chair en septembre 2015. Le couple vient d'acquérir un terrain où il projette de créer une ferme. Dans l'idée d'étendre cette activité, il possède déjà 300 têtes de poulet chair et 2 truies qui attendent des petits.
C'est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde qui cherche toujours les moyens d'améliorer son revenu afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Véronique says thank you very much for the loan, with which she was able to bolster her working capital for her commerce in used clothing. Aside from the used clothing and shoes she sells, she also has another business: raising fryer chickens and pigs. After a short pause, she started raising poultry again in September 2015. The couple just acquired a plot of land, where a farm is planned. With the idea of expanding this business, she already has 300 chickens and 2 pregnant sows.

Véronique is a hard-working and resourceful woman, who is always searching for ways to improve her income, so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 240 poultry chicks

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is 51 years old, married and has six children, two of whom are still in school. For the past 21 years she has farmed vegetables to earn an income.

Judy has taken out and successfully repaid seven prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer, vegetables seeds and other farm supplies to use on her farm. Her goal is to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetables seeds and other farm supplies to use on her farm.

loans.name: Tillo

texts.ru: Тилло благодарит за предыдущий кредит. Она смогла значительно продвинуть свой бизнес. Но она не будет стоять на одном месте и хочет дальше идти. Теперь Тилло просит кредит для той же цели. Скоро зима и Новый год. Она привезет мандарины и апельсины и гранат. Спасибо за поддержку!
texts.en: Tillo is thankful for her previous loan. She has been able to significantly advance her business. But she won't stand still, and she wants to move further. Now she is requesting a loan for the same goal. It will soon be winter and the New Year. She is going to bring in mandarins, oranges and pomegranates. Thank you for the support!

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Shirley Yamilet

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Oro Verde se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señorita  Shirley, tiene 21 años de edad,  está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres.  Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le son de mucha ayuda.
Doña Shirley es una joven que le gusta trabajar para labrarse un mejor porvenir y con sus ingresos ayudar a sus padres que son de escasos recursos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Yanbal (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas) su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días, gracias a los créditos ella puede comprar productos de ofertas los mismos que al venderlos al precio normal le dejan muy buenas ganancias, lleva 3 años en este negocio y le encanta e comercio.
Este crédito es para comprar  cremas, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Sus sueños son tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The credit group Oro Verde meets every two weeks in the Perpetuo Socorro neighborhood in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches frequented year-round by tourists. The majority of residents in this town make a living from fishing and other work at sea.

Shirley, 21, lives here. She is single and lives in her parents' house. She has been through four cycles with the credit group and likes it because the loans are always very helpful.

Shirley is a young woman who likes to work so that she can create a better future for herself. With her earnings, she helps her parents who have limited resources. She makes a living selling Yanbal products (perfumes, creams, and costume jewelry, among other things) door-to-door.

She goes out three or four days a week offering her products which she leaves on credit and collects every week. Thanks to the loans, she can buy products on sale and sell them at normal prices, bringing in good earnings. She has been in this business for three years and loves it.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics. She dreams of having her own house.

loans.use: buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a married woman who has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells dresses, shirts, and skirts. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a big, well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 58 years old, widowed and has five children. She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Noemi requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Noemi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 66 years old, married and has five children. She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edmondine

texts.fr:
Edmondine a 28 ans et est mariée. Le couple a 3 enfants, respectivement âgés de 9ans, 6ans et le dernier qui n’est encore qu’un nourrissant.
Edmondine est dans la vente de chaussures à l'occasion depuis 7ans. C' est une activité familiale, mais chacun a son propre lieu de vente. Son activité a été financée en partie par ses parents et l’autre part, par CEFOR grâce au prêt. Son travail marche à bien jusqu’à ce jour. Elle en est à son 3eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. 
Pour que l’activité soit rentable, il faut que les articles soient très variés pour que les clients aient le choix. Ainsi les pourcentages de vente augmenteront et le seuil de rentabilité sera atteint.
texts.en:
Edmondine is 28 and married. The couple have three children, aged 8 and 6, and the last one who is still only an infant.

Edmondine has been selling used shoes for seven years. This is a family business, but each has his own sales outlet. Her business was financed partially by her parents and partially by a CEFOR loan. Her work is going well so far. She is on her 3rd loan with CEFOR.

For her business to be profitable, the goods should be highly varied, so that the customers may have choices. Thus, the sales figures will increase, and profitability will be in hand.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bales of used shoes

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a 58-year-old, married woman with three grown children. Many years ago, she started operating a carenderia or a small restaurant. She sells home meals to neighbors and nearby residents in the community. She lives in the rural town of Getafe, Bohol.

She would like to serve a variety of meals, but the only problem she is facing right now is the shortage of capital. Tita has requested a loan to purchase supplies like rice, meat, seasonings and vegetables. In that way, her earnings will speed up and start to settle her obligations. Thus she can continue to improve her earnings and continue to expand.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice, meat, seasonings and vegetables.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 45 years old, with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care product, and other groceries.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: Dramane  est le monsieur qui  tient la corde du mouton sur la photo, malien  non scolarisé âgé de 43 ans, marié et  Père de 07 enfants, dont 1  est scolarisé. Sa femme est une ménagère, Dramane fait  l’élevage des moutons il y’a de cela dix ans sérieux il tient à toute ses promesses de remboursement avec le RMCR  Il fait recourt  prêt pour acheter  des moutons. Il s’approvisionne  dans  les marchés environnants  et revend  ses  moutons dans  les mêmes  marchés. Avec le profit,  Dramane  arrive à subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille entre autre habillement, santé et frais de scolarité.  Dans l’avenir, Dramane souhaite avoir un prêt plus  élevé pour acheter plus de moutons  et gagner plus de profits afin de  construire une maison en tôle  pour sa  famille.
texts.en:
Dramane is the gentleman holding the sheep’s rope in the photo. He is Malian, uneducated, 43 years old, and the married father of seven children, of whom one is in school. His wife is a homemaker. Dramane has been a livestock farmer of sheep for ten years. A serious man, he keeps all of his promises of paying back RMCR. He has turned to borrowing in order to purchase some sheep. He stocks up at nearby markets and resells his sheep at the same markets.

With the profits, Dramane manages to meet certain family needs, including clothing, healthcare, and schooling costs. For the future, his wish is to have a bigger loan to purchase more sheep and earn more profit, so as to build for his family a house of sheetmetal.

loans.use: to raise sheep for six months

loans.name: Ronaliza

texts.en:
Ronaliza is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ronaliza is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ronaliza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase boxes of fish to sell.

Ronaliza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ronaliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Zhanylkan

texts.ru: Жанылкан, 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Жанылкан жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав в 2003 году. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы. Ежемесячная прибыль Жанылкан - 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья и приобретение материалов для завершения строительства сарая для скота. Доходы от кредита Жанылкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zhanylkan is 59 years old, married, and is raising 5 children with her husband. She is a joyful and responsible woman, and she does agricultural work as a source of income for her family, which she began doing in 2003. Thanks to Zhanylkan's very hard work, she now has 4 cows. Her monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her farm, Zhanylkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow to increase the size of her herd, and to purchase materials to complete construction of a barn for her animals. Zhanylkan plans to use the income from her loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to buy one cow and construction materials to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Oro Verde  se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Johana, tiene  35 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 6 años que estudian en colegio y escuela, ella vive con los padres.
Doña Johana es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar duro y sacar adelante sola a sus hijos, ella tiene en su casa una tienda de víveres la misma que era de su mamá pero al ver sus necesidades se la dejo para que ella se haga cargo de este negocio y se gane sus ingresos, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, pollo, carnes, granos, embutidos, legumbres, confitería, artículos de bazar, helados, aguas y muchos otros productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes  que a diario acuden a su local a comprar los víveres para el consumo diario, sus hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados, aunque siempre es ella que está en su local, lleva más de 20 años el negocio que la ha mejorado mucho con la ayuda de los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda y comprar más variedad de víveres. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella cada vez aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Oro Verde” loan group meets every 15 days in the Barrio Perpetuo Socorro in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited during all seasons of the year by many domestic and foreign tourists. In this place, the majority of the population works in fishing and other maritime jobs.

In this place lives Johana. She is 35 years old and is separated from her spouse. From that relationship she has two children, ages 16 and 6, who are in high school and primary school. She lives with her parents.

Johana is a woman who has had to work hard and support her children on her own. In her house, she has a grocery store. It was her mother’s, but when she saw Johana’s needs, she left it to her, so that she could take charge of the business and earn an income. There, she sells all types of groceries, such as chicken, meats, grains, cold cuts, legumes, sweets, household items, ice cream, water, and many other products, to satisfy the needs of her customers, who each day come to her store to buy provisions for daily use. Her children help her when they are free, although she is the one who is always in the store. She has been working in the business for more than 20 years, and she has improved it a lot with the help of the loans.

She will use this loan to stock up her store and buy a greater supply of groceries. She has been in the loan group for nine years, and she likes it because with the loans, she grows her business more and more. Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Brigida Otilia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Oro Verde se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Brígida, tiene 52 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad que aun están en su casa.
Doña Brigida es una mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propios recursos gracias a su esfuerzo, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad así como también  legumbres, verduras y frutas, carnes, colas, helados y otros productos, tiene muy buena clientela la cual ha logrado tener en más de 20 años que lleva con su negocio que le permite ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad, legumbres, carnes y otros víveres para abastecer su tienda. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The credit group Oro Verde meets every two weeks in the Perpetuo Socorro neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches frequented year-round by tourists. The majority of residents in this town make a living from fishing and other work at sea.

Brigida, 52, lives here. Her husband died many years ago and she has remained a widow, but their four adult children still live with her.

Brigida is a woman who likes to have her own resources. Thanks to her effort, she has a convenience store in her house where she sells all kinds of basic goods, as well as legumes, fruits and vegetables, meats, sodas, frozen treats and other products. She has a very good clientele which has allowed her to have this business for more than twenty years and earn an honest living.

This loan will be used to buy basic goods, legumes, meats and other food to stock her store. She has been through three cycles with the credit group and likes the help that she gets with loans.

She dreams of getting ahead and enjoying good health.

loans.use: buy basic goods, legumes, meats and other food.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct products selling, Avon business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more products to sell like lotion, lipsticks, deodorants, body spray, etc. for her business.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years. She also earns more income from selling ready-to-wear. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell like lotion, lipsticks, deodorants, body spray, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment. His business goal is to have a classic barber shop within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Ba4nk.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Annie Jane

texts.en:
Annie Jane is 36 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Annie Jane is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Annie Jane requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Annie Jane has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Annie Jane would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has five children who are currently in school. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline for her motor, and maintenance for her business. Lorena has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline for her motor, and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Vergelia

texts.en:
Vergelia is a woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old now. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Vergelia has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of fruits to sell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Vergelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Esther Lucia

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Oro Verde se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive la señora Esther, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una de 16 años la cual estudia en colegio es la que aun vive en su casa.  El esposo es chofer. Ella hace varios años atrás  aprendió corte y confección en un Academia de la ciudad. 
Doña Esther es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante y poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene un taller en su casa lugar en el cual confecciona todo tipo de ropa, aunque lo que más le gusta es  hacer sabanas, adornos para baños y cocinas entre otros trabajos que realiza por pedidos y para la venta al público. Además de la costura a ella le encanta la cocina y es por eso que con la ayuda de este crédito espera instalar un local en su casa y vender deliciosos ceviches de pescado, lo va a hacer para tener otra fuente de ingresos ya que los gastos cada vez son más grandes y solo trabajando puede salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas, hilos, botones  y para instalar su cevichería. Lleva 4 ciclos del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener bien instalada su cevichería.
texts.en:
The “Oro Verde” loan group meets every 15 days in the Barrio Perpetuo Socorro in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited during all seasons of the year by many domestic and foreign tourists. In this place, the majority of the population works in fishing and other maritime jobs.

In this places lives Esther. She is 56 years old and married, and from this relationship she has three children, two of whom are adults, and one of whom is 16, in high school, and still lives in Ester’s house. Her husband is a driver. She learned to sew several years ago in an academy in the city.

Ester is a very determined woman who likes to support herself in order to get ahead and to be able to help her husband with household expenses. She has a workshop in her house, where she makes all kinds of clothing, although what she most likes to make is sheets and decorations for the bathroom and kitchen. She makes these and other items by request and for sale to the public. In addition to sewing, she loves cooking. For this reason and with the help of this loan, she wants to set up a shop in her house and sell delicious fish ceviche. She’ll do this to have another source of income, since her expenses are always increasing, and she can only get ahead by working.

She will use this loan to buy cloth, thread and buttons, and to set up her ceviche shop. She has been with the loan group for four cycles, and she likes it for the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to have her ceviche shop well set up.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and buttons, and to set up her ceviche shop.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es de la ciudad de Concepción, ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y a través de ella quiere poder ayudar a las personas y también dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está poniendo lo mejor de sí para poder crecer y ayudar a sus seres queridos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Fabiola is from the city of Concepción. She is studying for a nursing career, through which she wants to help others and also give her family a better quality of life. She is doing her best to grow and help her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her college fees. This way, she can continue with her studies as she has been.

loans.use: to pay college fees

loans.name: Cherryb Joy

texts.en:
Cherryb Joy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cherryb Joy is 30 years old and all of her children are still in school.

Cherryb Joy has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Cherryb Joy has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa works hard to support her family. Felisa is widowed and has a buy and sell of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Felisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Felisa has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Felisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Luvuno operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over six years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses, as a challenge in the business. Luvuno dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es estudiante de la carrera de administración de empresas, su objetivo es terminar su carrera, tener un título universitario, ser una buena profesional y ayudar a su familia. 
Con mucho sacrificio está a punto de terminar su carrera y obtener su título para trabajar y  para lograr obtener  mayor  ingreso para ella su familia. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carreras y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lorena is from the city of Villarrica. She is a student majoring in business administration. Her goal is to finish her major, to have a university degree, to be a good professional, and to help her family.

With a lot of sacrifice, she is about to finish her major and get her degree in order to work and to be able to earn better income for herself and her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees and in this way, to be able to continue her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to open another business within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virginia is 27 years old and has two children who are in school.

Virginia has a buy and sell of coconut wine business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Sairakan

texts.ru: Сайракан, 46 лет, замужем. У нее - среднее образование, с 2000 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Сайракан на сегодняшний день есть корова, 10 овец, на 0,55 Га земли она выращивает арбузы. Супруг Сайракан во всем помогает по хозяйству. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота племенных пород для разведения и увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Сайракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sairakan is 46 years old and married. She has a secondary-level education, and since 2000, she has raised crops and livestock as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to Sairakan's very hard work, her farm now has a cow and 10 sheep. She grows watermelon on 0.55 hectares of land. Sairakan's husband helps out with everything around the farm.

Sairakan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy purebred livestock for breeding and to increase the size of her herd. Sairakan plans to use the income from her loan to continue increasing her quantity of domestic livestock, and to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy some purebred livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is married with one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetics shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions

loans.name: Hafeezan

texts.en:
Hafeezan is a 45-year-old, married woman living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Hafeezan runs a small clothing shop. She sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothes from the market on low prices, sews them and then sells them for high prices in her community.

The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for her clothing garments has increased due to attractive designs and colours. Her husband affords all the household expenses from his earnings, and she contributes her earnings only for savings. She wants to increase the variety of clothing on a daily basis. This is the reason she has requested a loan, so that she can buy more variety of clothing to fulfill the demand. Hafeezan wishes for the bright future of her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothing to fulfill the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis continua con sus estudios de enfermería, es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder ser una profesional útil a las demás personas y a si misma, y al mismo tiempo poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para poder continuar estudiando.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is continuing her nursing studies. She is a person who puts forth a lot of effort to be able to be a professional who can be of service to others and to herself, and, at the same time, to be able to give her family a better quality of life. She comments that the previous loan helped her a lot to continue studying.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to pay her university fees again. In this way, she will be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: pay her university fees.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es de la ciudad de Villarrica, proviene de una familia humilde del campo que con mucho esfuerzo le han apoyado  siempre.
Ella estudia la carrera de enfermería y al mismo tiempo está trabajando para poder costear parte de sus estudios.
Su mayor anhelo es culminar su carrera y llegar a ser una gran profesional así mejorar mis ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Hilda is from the city of Villarrica. She comes from a humble family from the country which, with a lot of effort, has always supported her.

She is studying for a degree in nursing, and at the same time she is working to pay for part of her studies.

Her greatest wish is to finish her degree and become a great professional, thereby improving her income and helping her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Bellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Bellas, está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por salir adelante e ir creciendo. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Selva, quien se dedica a hacer comidas de todo tipo, comenta que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas del día, y que se esfuerza por poder crecer y mejorar cada día en lo que hace, ya que a través de ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos que necesita para poder hacer sus comidas para poder vender, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo y esforzándose por poder mejorar.
texts.en:
The group is named Mujeres Bellas. It is in its second cycle of the women's committee program, here everyone works and helps each other to make ends meet. In addition, they are in the poverty elimination program, striving to move forward and keep growing. 

One of the members is Selva, who works making all kinds of food. She comments that every day she begins her work in the very early morning, and she strives to grow and improve every day in what she does, because this is how she has the means to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies that she needs to make her food to sell, such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, herbs and others, in order to continue her work and strive to improve.

loans.use: to buy supplies to cook with, such as vegetables, meat, seasonings, herbs and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en el 1er ciclo, son un comité muy responsable que ha demostrado interés por el programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se pusieron como meta el crecimiento de cada una en cada no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
Nancy es la presidenta de este grupo, ella tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja muy arduamente, comenta que siempre trata de apoyar a sus compañeras para poder ir mejorando cada día.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para la venta en su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, lácteos, panificados bebidas y otros, de manera a poder tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras committee is in its first cycle. They are a very responsible group who have shown their interest in the women's committee program and have set a goal for each one of its members, which is to grow not only financially, but also as a person.

Nancy is the president of this group. She runs a grocery store where she works hard every day. She says that she always tries to support her fellow members so they can gradually improve little by little.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy a variety of products for her store, such as vegetables, meat, dairy products, breads and pastries, drinks, and other items. She wants to be able to offer her customers a wide array of products.

loans.use: to buy groceries like vegetables, meat, dairy products, bread, drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Santos Horacio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan  que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio San Juan de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Santos, tiene 51 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, 2 mayores de edad y una hija de 17 la cual estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ellos. Su mujer trabaja en una fábrica local.
El señor Santos es un hombre muy trabajador que hace lo posible para que a su familia no les falte lo necesario para vivir, el es albañil y  trabaja por contratos de personas particulares que le piden que les construya sus casas o cualquier tipo de trabajos relacionados con su profesión, el trabaja con materiales como tablas de madera cañas, estructuras para fundir las losas, es para estos materiales que el utiliza los créditos ya que siempre se dañan las tablas y hay que reemplazarlas o para combustibles y ciertos arreglos de las maquinarias, el necesita tener todo en perfecto estado ya que así se gana la vida..
Este crédito es para comprar herramientas, madera, cañas guadua y otros materiales de construcción. Lleva 2 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Juan meets every two weeks in the San Juan neighborhood of the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches. Many domestic and international tourists visit them all year round. Most of the residents of this area are fishermen.

This is where Santos lives. He is 51 years old and married. He has three children from this relationship. Two of them are adults and his youngest daughter is seventeen and in high school. She is the only one that still lives at home. His wife works at a local factory.

Santos is a very hard worker and does everything in his hand for his family to have everything they need. He works in construction as a contractor. People hire him to build their homes and for all kinds of remodeling projects. He works with materials like wooden planks, reeds, structures for casting slabs, etc. He uses his loans to purchase these items, because planks always need to be replaced. He also buys fuel and pays for equipment maintenance, because he needs to have everything in mint condition in order to make a living.

He will use this loan to buy tools, wood, giant bamboo reeds, and other construction materials. He has been with his communal bank for two years and enjoys being a member because the loans are a great help. His goal is to give his family the best of everything.

loans.use: to buy tools, wood, giant bamboo, and other construction materials.

loans.name: John Meliton

texts.en:
This is John, 30, a resident of Coron Palawan, Philippines. He is single and he is working hard to provide for his everyday needs. He is also helping his parents and siblings financially.

John maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one unit of tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of her business, he is requesting an amount of PHP 11,000 in his loan. He will be using the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. He will also use a portion of the loan to buy additional stock of rice, which he sells at retail.

John hopes to buy another unit of tricycle and dreams of having a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance cost of his tricycle unit and buy additional stock of rice he sells to his regular clients.

loans.name: Begimai

texts.ru: Бегимай, 23 года, замужем, есть годовалый сын. Образование неоконченное высшее, работает библиотекарем в школе. С 2012 года, как вышла замуж Бегимай начала заниматься полеводством. На 1,2 Га земельной доли выращивает многолетние травы (клевер) для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль около 6,000 сом (KGS). Бегимай решила приобрести одну нетель, поэтому обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS). Бегимай намерена развить ее бизнес, она мечтает приобрести легковой автомобиль для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Begimai is 23 years old, married, and has a one-year-old son. She has an incomplete post-secondary education, and she works as a librarian in a school. Since 2012, when she got married, Begimai has been practicing field husbandry. She grows perennial greens (clover) for resale on a 1.2 hectare plot of land. Her monthly income is around 6,000 som (KGS).

Begimai has decided to purchase a heifer, so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS). Begimai intends to develop her business, and she dreams of purchasing a small automobile for her family.

loans.use: to buy one heifer in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Orlando Patricio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Oro Verde se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Perpetuo Socorro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.
En este lugar vive don Orlando, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no ha tenido hijos. Su mujer es comerciante.
Don Orlando es un hombre muy trabajador que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida honradamente, el instala techos y tumbados, trabaja con sus materiales y es para esto que el emplea los créditos, el hace contratos con sus clientes en los cuales se compromete a poner todos los materiales, los mismos que compra al por mayor para que le salga más barato y le quede mayor utilidad. 
Este crédito es para comprar pinturas y otros materiales para los tumbados. Lleva 2 ciclos en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a bajos intereses. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Oro Verde credit group meets every two weeks in the Perpetuo Socorro neighborhood in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches frequented year-round by tourists. The majority of residents in this town make a living from fishing and other work at sea.

Orlando, 35, lives here. He is married but does not have any children. His wife is a businesswoman.

Orlando is a very hard-working man who has always wanted to earn an honest living. He installs roofs and ceilings, and he uses loans to buy materials. He has contracts with his clients and is therefore committed to getting all of the materials he needs, which he buys at wholesale because it is cheaper.

This loan is to buy paint and other materials for ceilings. He has been through two cycles in the credit group and likes that the loans are fast and have low interest.

He dreams of giving the best to his family.

loans.use: buy paint and other materials for ceilings.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish selling. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jillian

texts.en:
Jillian is 36 years old, married, and works hard to support her family.

She operates a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income selling frozen foods.  Jillian is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Jillian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Atyrkul

texts.ru: Атыркул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Атыркул на сегодня есть 4 коровы, 10 коз, 10 овец и 3 лошади. На 1,0 Га земли выращивает кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. По хозяйству помогают ее дети и муж. Ежемесячная прибыль - 25,000 сом (KGS). Атыркул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят, для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Атыркул и в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en:
Atyrkul successfully repaid her loan, using the funds for their designated purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Today, Atyrkul's farm has 4 cows, 10 goats, 10 sheep, and 3 horses. She grows corn and clover for on-farm consumption on 1.0 hectare of land. Atyrkul's husband and children help her on the farm. Her monthly income is 25,000 som (KGS).

Atyrkul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy calves, to increase the size of her herd. The income from the loan will allow Atyrkul to develop her business even further.

loans.use: to buy some more calves in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 54-year-old, married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a butcher shop; he generates insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy mutton and lamb from the market and sells it from his butcher shop.

Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which discouraged his purchasing power for new inventory of his butcher shop. Thus, Zarina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy billy goats and sheep for producing mutton and lamb. She wants to provide higher education to her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life to her children. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy billy goats and sheep for her son, so he can produce mutton and lamb to sell from his butchery shop.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is a 47-year-old married woman living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a hawker and sells fruit in their hometown. He daily goes to the fruit market to buy fresh fruit such as apples, pineapples, bananas, oranges, guava, etc. He is very famous in the community due to his polite behavior and the freshness of the fruit. He has been selling fruit for many years; because of this, he understands the minds and demands of the people. To cope with the demand, he wants to buy more fruit. In this way, he will be able to fulfill the demand and can easily earn more profit.

Therefore, Arshad requested a loan so her husband will be able to buy more fruit, especially oranges.

Arshad thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit such as oranges, apples, and bananas for her husband's fruit selling business.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for four years.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: San Miguel 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Miguel 2, el grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida que con mucho sacrificio y esmero pudo montar y el cual es el sostén de su familia. Mirtha es una persona que lucha y no se cansa de poder trabajar por sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Mirtha solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos variados para la venta como por ejemplo harina, aceite, azúcar, leche y productos de panificados. Maneja bien su negocio lo que le permite tener mejores  ingresos.
texts.en:
The group is called San Miguel 2, and is part of the poverty elimination program. Each member strives to improve the living conditions for herself and her loved ones. One of the members is Mirtha, who has a well-stocked grocery store that she was able to set up with great sacrifice and care, and with which she supports her family. Mirtha is a person who struggles tirelessly to be able to work for her loved ones.

Mirtha is requesting this loan to buy various products to sell such as flour, oil, sugar, milk and bread products. She manages her business well, which enables her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell, such as flour, oil, sugar, milk and bread products.

loans.name: Sory

texts.en:
A fish seller at the market, Sory is 59 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is married. Her husband is a construction worker. They can only make $10 USD per day to support their family. Sory resides in a rural area of Baribour District, Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 10 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for her house

loans.name: Maluda

texts.ru: Малуда, 48 лет, вдова, она счастливая многодетная мама 6 детей, младшие дети учатся в школе. У Малуды среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она на протяжении 23 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством. В хозяйстве Малуды есть 3 коровы, 28 овец и 2 лошади. На участке мерою 1,47 Га она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль Малуды составляет около 17,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на содержание семьи и воспитание детей. Малуда обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для продажи экологически-чистого молока, что позволит увеличить доходы семьи Малуды.
texts.en:
Maluda is 48 years old and a widow. She is the happy mother of 6 children. The younger children study in grade school. Maluda has a secondary-level education, and she has raised livestock and grown crops for 23 years as a source of income for her family. Maluda's farm has 3 cows, 28 sheep, and 2 horses. On a plot of land measuring 1.47 hectares, she grows corn. Maluda's monthly income is around 17,000 som (KGS). These funds are catastrophically insufficient to support a family and raise children.

Maluda has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 dairy cows so she can sell organic milk, which will allow her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows to produce and sell milk, which will help bolster her income.

loans.name: Amelia Leticia

texts.es:
Amelia con 61 años de edad,vive en casa familiar de material rústico,junto a su madre y hermanos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de arroz, con una experiencia en el rubro de 25 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Amelia es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,a trabajado un crédito de S/.1500, S/.2000,S/.1,000, los cuáles los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Amelia is 61 years old. She lives in her family home made out of rustic materials with her mother and siblings in the district of Pomahuaca, province of Jaén, departament of Cajamarca, Perú. She has very good references, personal and work-related from people from the area. The people of the town work primarily in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.
She works in agriculture, specifically growing rice, with more than 25 years of experience in the field. She will use this loan to pay for farm workers' labor, the application of fungicides and fertilizers and labor for the harvest. This will help the physiology, morphology and productivety of the crops, as well as to have a timely harvest which will result in a better production, so she won't have problems selling her produce.
Amelia is a recurring member with Edpyme Alternativa. Her previous loans have been for S/.1500, S/.2000,S/.1,000, which she was able to pay on time without problems.

loans.use: to pay for farm workers' labor, the application of fungicides and fertilizers and labor for the harvest

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia tiene 33 años, ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, comenta que hace tiempo que emprendió esta actividad, como 18 años aproximadamente.
Mauricia es una señora muy sacrificada quien se esfuerza diariamente para poder sobrellevar  el día a día, y para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas, calzados, articulo de bazar y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mauricia, 33, makes a living from itinerant sales of all kinds of products. She has been doing this for about 18 years.

Mauricia is a very selfless woman who exerts herself daily to be able to get by each day, as well as to help her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to invest in a variety of clothing, shoes, housewares and more so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: buy supplies to sell, like a variety of clothing, shoes, housewares and more.

loans.name: Abdyrahman

texts.ru: Абдырахман, 63 года, женат, отец двоих детей. Он на пенсии, образование среднее. Уже много лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Супруга помогает во всем. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец. На 0,83 Га земли Абдырахман выращивает кукурузу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере около 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях развития своего дела, Абдырахман обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и реализации. Абдырахман намерен развить его бизнес и накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Abdyrahman is 63 years old, married, and is the father of two children. He is retired and on a pension, and he has a secondary-level education. He has been practicing animal and field husbandry for many years now. His wife helps him with everything. He has 4 cows and 10 sheep on his farm. On 0.83 hectares of land, Abdyrahman grows corn and clover for on-farm consumption. All these activities bring in a monthly income of around 11,000 som (KGS).

In order to develop his business, Abdyrahman has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to fatten up and resell. Abdyrahman intends to develop his business and save to buy furniture for his home.

loans.use: to purchase some cows to fatten up and resell.

loans.name: Rosa Kely

texts.es:
Rosa Kely con 26 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar, junto a su hijo en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes,patos y carneros,desde hace más de 05 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de animales y comida para éstos.De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Rosa Kely es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa Kely is 26 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her family home with her son, in the disctrict of Zana, in the province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, Peru. She has very good personal and work references from local residents. The inhabitants of this region work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

She has worked for more than 5 years raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, ducks and sheep. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy animals and animal feed. In this way she will be able to continue working and improve her quality of life.

Rosa Kely is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Esperanza   está en su ciclo número 13° del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, esforzándose por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jacky quien se dedica a hacer trabajos por computadora y fotocopias, comenta que a través de su trabajo tiene los ingresos para poder procurar una vida digna para su familia. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora que quiere salir adelante, pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintas, hojas y otros productos variados para poder seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
